Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Quora's mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and our data team sits at the core of helping the company makes the best decisions possible to ensure we achieve this mission.  Business Data Analysts are responsible for driving the analytics that surface opportunities in our people, marketing, operations, and sales teams. You will draw on your product and business knowledge, available metrics, insights from teammates, and your industry experience to know where to best focus quantitative efforts for maximum impact. You're capable of executing independently and are energized by ambiguity. We are a highly cross-functional team and recognize we have the most success in working together, and as a result you will build strong cross-functional partnerships with our partner teams. You're curious, driven, and excited to make a significant impact in helping achieve the company's mission.ResponsibilitiesDefine & socialize key metrics to evaluate the health of our partner business teams & programsDiscover & drive program initiatives through data driven recommendations and partner with cross-functional teams to implement/launch themDevelop & manage data models to bring order and insight to complex datasetsLeverage existing Python abstractions and/or other visualization tools to design and develop new user-facing tools & dashboarding systems to empower partner teamsCommunicate findings from data and analyses to senior stakeholders, influencing them to make the best decisions possibleRequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics), or equivalent experience2-5 years of work experience in consulting or a technology-related analytical roleCuriosity and passion for QuoraStrong analytical skills, with experience solving ambiguous problems using data and providing practical business insightsStrong process-oriented skills and drive to find the most efficient way to do things without sacrificing a high quality of work and/or resultsProficiency in SQL & ExcelFamiliarity with Python or a similar scripting language for analytical contextsAbility to partner cross-functionally with engineering, marketing, operations, product management, and/or salesExperience in working with large data sets and distributed computing tools (Hive, Redshift) is a plusExperience with data visualization (e.g. Superset, Tableau) technologies is a plusExperience with data pipeline tools (e.g. Airflow) is a plusWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM.IBM Services is seeking Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Business Analysts to collect and analyze requirements and solve client problems using Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions. You will serve as a liaison between clients and project consultants, particularly during initial project phases. You will work primarily on project execution but may be involved in sales support as well.  Microsoft CRM Business Analysts are responsible for identifying, developing and deploying end-user solutions in CRM systems. Using your deep functional knowledge and familiarity with the Microsoft Dynamics CRM application, you will ensure that client business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training.Primary Responsibilities:Project ExecutionSupport the translation of client business requirements into CRM solutions, including requirements approval, communication, traceability and reuseContribute to the transfer of functional requirements to development and test teamsUse CRM workflow technology to automate business processesStay abreast on updates and new releases in CRM technologies (Microsofts and its competitors)Educate end-users on CRM functionsSales SupportHelp determine and translate customer needs into a solution and approachContribute to proposal developmentContribute to scope, approach, and estimating input to the proposal teamContribute to and participate in client demonstrations and presentationsAdditional skills required:Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioTeam Foundation Server (TFS)Familiarity with Microsoft technologies/trendsStrong analytical, presentation, and writing skillsBENEFITS Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population. http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/https://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wssCAREER GROWTH Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through: Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsFinding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employees strengths and career aspirationsDiversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovationCORPORATE CITIZENSHIP With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlhttp://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps Candidates that live in or near one of the following cities preferred, but all candidates considered: Atlanta, Chicago, Columbus, Houston, Dallas, Raleigh, Washington DC Metro Area, Piscataway, Philadelphia. GBSEA17RWMS Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 3 years team lead experience or management experience of 5+ team members (management consultant only)At least 2 years project experience in enterprise business application development and delivery (e.g., CRM, ERP, SCM, HCM)At least 1 year project implementation experience using Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Dynamics CRM online, or Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016, 2015, or 2013At least 2 years project experience translating client business needs into software capabilitiesAt least 2 years project experience with business requirements analysis and modelingAt least 2 years project experience creating functional designs, test conditions and test scriptsAt least 2 years experience working within a team environmentBasic knowledge of software development methodologies (Waterfall and/or Agile) Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 2 years consulting experience working for a global systems integratorMicrosoft Certified Professional (MCP)At least 1 year project experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Operations or Microsoft Dynamics AX 7, 2012, or 2009At least 1 year project experience working with global and offshore project teamsAt least 1 year experience with system integration or user acceptance testingAt least 1 year experience with organizational designAt least 1 year experience with business process design or re-engineeringAt least 1 year experience with developing and implementing end-user training programsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support sales and marketing functionsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support customer service, call center, or field service operations EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  The people here at Apple don’t just create products - they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.  Three or more years of data analytics experience.  Validated experience with quantitative and financial analysis.  Comfort working with ambiguous and unproven data.  Expertise working with large volumes of data while realizing limitations of small samples.  Big data skills are less relevant than strong eye for business.  Extraordinary analytic, problem solving, written/oral presentation skills.  Aptitude for synthesizing complex data into key components that drive informed decisions.  Attention to detail and comfort with presenting to leadership.  Flexible and able to multitask in a deeply dynamic business.  Comfortable working cross-functionally, and across organizational levels in global geographies.  In this role, you will regularly balance ad-hoc requests with long-term projects and initiatives. We are looking for the ability to see beyond the data and translate information into actionable business insight. We value fluid transition from an investigative to a big picture perspective, adjusting to the audience and objectives. Work to identify, evaluate and prioritize opportunities for operational improvements. Education & Experience BA/BS in mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, operations research, or related quantitative social/physical science MBA/MS a plus  Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who we want Business-oriented evaluators. People who effectively interpret information to demonstrate the effects of business initiatives, regulation and industry trends for sales, management and leadership teams.  Self-directed imitators. People who take ownership of their work and need no prompting to drive productivity, change, and outcomes.  Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.  User-focused creators. People who imagine with the user in mind, developing technology that helps foster business strategies. What you will do As a (Lead) Business Analyst you will own the overall results in planning, requirements gathering, functional design, testing/validation, and deployment of business sponsored system enhancements and issue resolutions. You will work with Business Process Owners to gather and analyze data and ensure complete documentation of user stories (business requirements) and functional designs to align with defined business ROIs and success criteria. Collaboration is a key skill in this role. Partnering with your IT/IS counterparts, you will translate business requirements to functional specs that will design system capabilities and leverage best practices. Lead the delivery of system enhancements and projectsCoordinate responsibilities amongst the BAs and Assoc. BAs on the teamEnsure the quality and data integrity of operational CRM systemsLead the delivery of data governance and systems administrationPartner with Business Process Owners to analyze requests and strategize ROI-based prioritizationsCoordinate with IS counterparts on system enhancements and reported incidents - accountable for timely and accurate deliveryLead Regression testing and stay connected to divisional and global CRM launches on our shared platformResearch industry analysis around CRM and apply to job functionsStay up-to-date on CRM platform upgradesWhat you needBachelor's degree or equivalent4 or more years' experienceProfessional experience with Salesforce.com and/or other CRM platformsProfessional experience in systems administrationTechnical understanding of Middleware, ERP, and Business IntelligenceStrong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skillsWorking knowledge of data collection, data analysis, and report creationProficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OutlookAbility to manage priorities and workflowOther Things to Consider:Industry training is available to each team member on a yearly basis - whether conferences, online courses or onsite group trainingOur team can take advantage of flexible work hours when needed -development activities do not need to always take place in the office

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Omlet Arcade is the community for mobile game streamers and e-sports. Every month we bring millions of gamers together to show off their gameplay and make new friends. We hatched up Omlet Arcade to serve the next generation of gamers; those who no longer need PCs or consoles due to the overwhelming power of the phones at their fingertips. This year has shown we're on the right path as AAA games like Fortnite and PUBG light up our mobile screens. In 2019, Omlet is taking it to the next level, bringing mobile e-sports to the world by empowering players with the tools they need to strut their skills, build amazing teams, and have a blast competing with each other.  You will be responsible for turning data into information, information into insights and insights into key business decisions, that steer the strategic direction of the company. The right person for this role thrives in a fast-pace environment, loves problem-solving and is a strong communicator. If you are someone who gains personal satisfaction from transforming data into knowledge for business insights, then this is a great role for you.  Responsibility Build data visualizations and cross-functional reporting that conveys key performance metrics, significant trends, and relationships across multiple data sourcesUse internal and external analytics tools, SQL, scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate dataInterface with engineering and business units to drive key operational metrics and KPI/s for enabling business success and value-addition within data and analytics domain.Translate business functional requirements into technical specifications for the associated engineering teams, by working with the relevant program managers.Collaborate with Data teams and Program Management to design process improvements for a diverse set of internal and external tools, responsible for accessing and delivering business data.Operationalize support requests across the business community by mapping to the relevant data teams with specific guidance on success criteria and relative priority. Requirement: A Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, etc.4+ years of experience as an analyst in a data and analytics domainJedi SQL skills for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting dataStrong working knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, with strong storytelling skills for technical and non-technical audiencesDemonstrated ability to work across technical and business stakeholders and transform vague business questions into data-driven insights and recommended actions.Experience working in R/Python/Spark on statistical modeling, machine learning, experiment design and evaluation.Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, modeling and familiarity with data engineering (Hadoop, Hive, Presto, BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.)Experience working with web analytic tools (particularly: Google Analytics, Google Search Council, etc.)Exceptional written and oral communication skillsPerks & BenefitsCompetitive SalaryMedical, Dental, VisionUnlimited PTOFree catered lunch through Door Dash 5 days per weekFriendly working environment

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Amazon Advertising creates powerful, customer-focused solutions for advertisers of all sizes. Our Ad Tech team builds the business programs and ad serving systems to enable campaigns to run across billions of advertising queries every day. The result is better performance for advertisers and publishers, and more relevant ads for customers. Our data platform processes massive data sets to develop business intelligence and analytics that are critical for the efficiency and profitability of our advertising business. Amazon Publisher Services (APS), a core part of Amazon's Advertising business, helps publishers of all sizes increase monetization and yield. Through its marketplaces (Transparent Ad Marketplace and Unified Ad Marketplace), APS provides publishers with convenient access to both Amazon demand as well as diverse, high-quality third-party demand.  The 3P Buyer team is seeking an experienced Business Analyst who will dive deep into complex data sets to identify actionable insights that drive great business decisions. The analyses you create will help drive buyer customer adoption, ad performance, and retention. To be successful in this role, you will need to define and produce metrics/dashboards for business teams, execute data extraction and transformation directly on big data systems, and develop hard-hitting analyses to solve complex business challenges. You are an analysis expert and a data evangelist who leverages a variety of platforms and analytical tools to extract critical insights from massive data sets. Responsibilities: · Analyze data to find actionable insights that lead to great business decisions and new opportunities · Collaborate with key stakeholders to translate business questions into verifiable hypotheses using complex, multi-source data · Build dashboards and custom reports to track key metrics, empower other team members with data, and investigate business questions · Execute deep-dive analyses addressing key business issues and present findings to stakeholders · Demonstrate great judgment in quickly forming actionable, data-driven conclusions in the face of uncertainty · Proactively make recommendations for new tests and initiatives to improve key metrics and customer outcomes  · Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format · Play an active role in strategic & operational planning discussions Joining this team, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California.Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation. Basic Qualifications · Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Business, or related discipline · 3+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analysis role · 2+ years of experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems and presenting results· 1+ years of experience working directly in the advertising or ad tech space · Advanced knowledge of Excel & SQL  · Proven analytical and quantitative skills with an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses · Knowledge of fundamental statistical concepts for data analysis · Ability to dive deeply into data integrity issuesPreferred Qualifications · Experience extracting, cleansing & manipulating data using SQL and Hive/Hadoop · Eager to learn and employ new technologies to achieve faster and better results · Ability to take loosely defined business questions and translate them into clearly defined technical/data specifications · Experience with BI / data visualization tools · Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, able to communicate effectively with both business and technical teams.· Strong knowledge of programmatic advertising spaceApply Now at Amazon

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  FiveBy is a high-end specialty services consultancy focused on cyber forensics. We are a team of specialized and talented people delivering programs and services to customers who need our support in that space, and were looking for a Business Analyst to help in our mission of fighting digital crime.  Are you ready to innovate, influence, transform and inspire on cutting-edge tech? We encourage you to apply to learn more!  This is a unique opportunity to be part of a team that uses data science to build products which are impactful to the software ecosystem. This position will specialize in data and research PR, working on a team that releases regular data reports and surveys and shares expertise, insights and research with stake holders.  Were looking for someone who is comfortable with data, has a solid understanding of our product goals and can find a compelling, meaningful story within a spreadsheet.  Responsibilities: Develop, drive and produce reports using data analyticsLeverage reports and talking points for internal and external use.Work with an amazing team of data and product specialists and coordinators.Develop strategies and story angles to make research accessible and relevant and find opportunities for experts to be thought-leaders on related issues.Research, evaluate, and present statistical methods to provide actionable insights.Solve strategic business problems leveraging data and analysis in support of the project and teams.Initiate and execute applied analytical projects.Design and lead analytical efforts that impact the business.Communicate findings to team leadership. Qualifications: 3+ years of experience using SQL.3+ years of experience in advanced data analytics, mathematical modeling, operations research, quantitative analysis or data modelling.A goal-oriented critical thinker.A curious, natural storyteller with an interest in economic trends and experience using data to find and tell relevant, accessible and compelling stories.Bachelors or higher degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or related disciplines.Experience working with relational database design, multidimensional database design, OLTP, OLAP, KPIs, Scorecards, and Dashboards.Ability to drive ideas from inception to completionAbility to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable mannerCapable of learning and creatively applying analytical techniques such as dynamic linear models, graphical models/probabilistic programmingAbility to form questions/ hypothesis about the business and then follow through on them through data analysis and reportingAbility to move very quickly, juggle multiple urgent priorities and work on a tight deadline.A good listener with experience managing or mentoring people.Excellent interpersonal and relationship skills. FiveBy is an EEO employer.

Join us in delighting our customers and empowering our employees. Apply today! What You'll Do Are you someone who gets great satisfaction from making a difference? Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better. Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analysts understand the business and user goals of a project and provide clear requirements for the development and testing team. Working with key stakeholders, Business Analysts clarify and communicate business needs, contribute to the definition and design of solutions, and ensure the alignment of business solutions and business needs. Business Analysts perform activities including business process analysis, needs assessments, requirements gathering and solution definition throughout the systems development lifecycle. Business Analysts helps develop processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders. As a Business Analyst, you have experience gathering and documenting product requirements. You have worked in a variety of systems environments and have at least a general understanding of the technology considerations. You are comfortable leading workshops, working meetings and presentations. You communicate in an empathetic, positive and friendly manner with a focus on clarifying business needs and customer service. Working with contractors, vendors and multiple processes and methodologies to manage requirements for all stakeholders.  For this role, we are seeking someone with significant experience working with tech, project and account management (delivery) and Clients to partner on the technical aspects of projects and client work, from concept to preparing the team for successful implementation.  As the focus will be on a large scale, globalized consumer facing desktop and mobile platform, your knowledge around world-facing platforms is critical to success. Expert communicator and involved in interaction with variety of audience (Product Management, Technical and Architectural teams, Integration Analysts, SMEs, Agile Delivery teams, etc.,). Highly proficient in preparing Business Requirement Documents, Functional Specification Documents and supported in preparing Systems Requirement Specifications, Technical Requirements. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Understanding of and experience with extracting business requirements from direct interviews with users, business process owners, and IT.  Regarding user interviews, candidate must be able to identify and understand workflows, data touch points and interactions with systems such that use cases and user stories can be created that “leave no stone unturned” and are comprehensive, exhaustive and ensure the solution will meet ALL requirements. Their experience and skill should allow them to quickly identify where the integration challenges and major affected systems lie inside the solution AND at the boundaries.  Regarding IT, the candidate MUST be able to speak (and understand) their language and use their terms correctly. Successful Bas understand and have experience in BOTH business and technology. Their career path should be headed toward Solution Architect and recent work experience should exhibit that aspiration. They should enjoy being mentored by EA / SA roles. They should understand major HW platforms, SW packages, the role of databases, why SOA adds value and what that value is, the role of “Cloud”, the impact of Mobile, and some appreciation of custom SW vs. package integration.  In all cases, their work products should “stand alone” and be clearly understood by other team members anywhere in the world without rework or excessive explanation. Name: Business Analyst
Description: At AREVO, our team is taking 3D printing technology to the next level. We are 3D printing ultra strong composite parts exceeding the strength of titanium. We have invented the world’s strongest composite materials, True3D printing and robotic arm based factory of the future manufacturing cells — and this is just the beginning. With our technology, we are making lightweight production parts for aerospace, industrial, consumer and medical industries enabling new applications for additive manufacturing.We are looking for a seasoned Business Analyst to build out the foundational capabilities of Arevo to enable us to scale unimpeded in 2018 and beyond.Our ideal candidate will have a mix of business analytics, strategic planning, demonstrated operational progress with strong program management skills. Our Business Analyst will report directly to the CEO and will be engaged in a wide breadth of functional activities at Arevo. To be successful in this role, you should be highly professional, a outside of the box thinker and proactive - capable of a high degree of self-direction. You will also play a significant role shaping the company’s strategic planning.Responsibilities● Develop and end-to-end cost model for the company● Develop a capacity planning model for company● Develop an uber operating quantitative model for the company● Program manage a wide variety of key projects across the company on anas-needed basis● Help develop and manage the operating infrastructure for the company includingStrategic Planning, objectives and key results● Act as the interim CFO● Help develop and implement key aspects of Arevo’s strategic plan including, butnot limited to product positioning, value proposition, competitive analysis,● Set current and long-term goals● Manage key budgets and cash flow of the company● Assist the CEO in developing key processes to enable the effective scaling ofArevo● Develop and track rigorous and actionable metrics and success criteria for keyoperating parameters for the company● Manage our hiring planning and staffing engagements● Participate in the quarterly and annual planning of the company’s objectives● Become an expert in our offering, promoting our product both internally andexternally.Requirements● Is a self-starter who is able to define strategy and execute. Thrives working in a lean and agile environment and with small, exceptionally talented teams. Ideally has some early-stage company experience.● Has a superb strategic mind. Ability to coordinate cross-functionally.● This individual ideally has a background in consulting (such as BCG, Bain orMcKinsey)● Outstanding quantitative analytics and modelling skills.● Excellent communications skills and successful track record with strategicplanning and client engagements.● Strong leadership and collaborative skills. Able to work with all parts of theorganization.● Displays an absolute passion for the Arevo’s mission. Has a willingness tosacrifice and work tirelessly for the success of our overall mission.● Ideally the candidate as an Engineering or technical undergraduate degree withan MBA.● Previous experience in plastics, composites and/or advanced materials a plus.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Milpitas, CA Contract to Hire Role Contract Hourly Rate: $55-65/hr URGENT ROLE! Kelly IT Resources is working with a very exciting enterprise solution company, who has a critical need to hire, on a contract to hire basis, a Technical Business Systems Consultant right away and serve as a critical Business Systems Analyst! The Business Systems Analyst will work onsite at one of their largest and prestigious IT Communications/Networking Clients, headquartered in the Silicon Valley. The Technical Business Systems Consultant will be responsible for managing technology applications, process, product roadmaps, training, workflow analysis, and feature enhancements for solutions within this prestigious, high-profile client account. The successful Business Systems Analyst will drive Information Technology application, testing and implementations, technology analysis, process management, and escalation resolution, as well as have accountable for developing critical business requirements. A truly exciting role for someone with a broad technical background, key liaison expertise and exceptional communication and business acumen know-how. Our client is eager to hire immediately! Business Analyst Role: 1. Information Technology and Business Administration Support Functions. The functions include: Monitoring the health of the installed applications within the client’s Workplace Resources group. Global frontline support for our inbound, outbound, and delivery tools. Responsible for escalating tool issues through the proper chain of custody via client management. Liaise between the business, Global Export Trade, Global Trade Ops, Customs, and Finance. Responsible for identifying process gaps and technology gaps with our current installed solutions, and identifying workarounds along with new product reviews. Subject matter expert for process development, workflow management, internal web communications/website management, IT application integration, business readiness reviews, scope analysis/definition development, business requirement document preparation, training and development, organizational effectiveness, implementation, and compliance. 2. Global Shipping Application Support Lead the effort in product development and phased releases to support client requirements for Compliance, Product Classification, Denied Party Screening and extensive IT coordination to meet global needs within specific Client organizations such as Product Development, Engineering, and Fixed Asset controls. Serve as primary contact in resolving software/hardware issues that arise in the daily use of applications and database issues. Perform QC on deliverables received from third parties and follow-up as necessary to correct any issues. Draft document indexes and identify privileged and confidential documents for analysis. Preparation of document production deliverables (CDs/DVDs, thumb drives, external hard drives, and FTP sites) Coordinate with 3rd-party vendors providing services such as paper document scanning, backup tape restoration, and forensic collection/analysis. Review database entries for accuracy and request review of inaccuracies from case teams as necessary during the QC process. Develop and maintain positive working relationships (treats clients, co-workers and visitors with respect; is courteous and helpful in all contacts; maintains professionalism under pressure). Demonstrate teamwork (is receptive to and acts upon input from other team members, is willing and able to compromise as needed, displays willingness to work with all firm employees, willingly assists other firm employees with overload work as requested and able). Demonstrate initiative (contributes new ideas, is self-motivated, obtains/maintains a working knowledge of relevant practice areas/clients). Demonstrate organizational skills and effective use of time (ability to plan daily work, set priorities and manage time to ensure work is timely and efficiently completed). Proactively follow up with case teams to provide status updates. - provided by DiceMaintain, administer, first level support, and troubleshoot applications and databases such as Relativity, e-Discovery etc.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company Information Velos Inc. is a leading provider of next-generation health care software. Velos provides an integrated suite of clinical, administrative, and financial products. Velos eResearch, the company's flagship product line, is a comprehensive clinical research management information system. Velos' specialty medical product line supports the information needs of health care providers in cardiology, cardiovascular surgery, dialysis, and transplantation.Job Profile The Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for creating and refining business and systems requirements to address business opportunities and for formulating documentation to support the development and implementation of the technical solution. The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between business users and technology programmers to understand user needs and develop/maintain all required documentation and reports. This position calls for both technical experience and functional domain, including the Analysis processes. Additional requirement is a clear understanding of the importance of quality customer service.Responsibilities include Acting as a liaison between the Information Technology group and the subject matter experts representing the business. Understanding the customers business needs and translating those needs into functional requirements and specifications. Representing the business perspective of a system or solution development project. Assisting the subject matter experts develop business processes and validate the processes against the system. Creating use cases, including wireframes and design documentation to represent the requirements for a large health care institution. Conducting detailed requirements gathering sessions for the business. Leading the analysis of current state and future state capabilities including user interface creation. Participating in the collection of the functional requirements and approval of the business requirements being delivered with the end solution.Required Skills & Abilities Good problem solving and analytical skills. Experience in producing wire frames and design documentation. Ability to pay close attention to detail. Good written and verbal communication skills. Ability to understand business requirements. Ability to maintain an overall business perspective while working on a detailed level. Working in a Team environment Travel, up to 100% Independent, with high energy and passion to complete tasks in timely orderEducation & Experience Required: Bachelors degree and/or equivalent work experience. Experience as a Business Analyst minimum of 3 years UML use case experience. Health care industry experience.

Name: Business Analyst (Intern) - United States
Description: WHAT YOU’LL DOAs a Business Analyst Intern for Cisco you will develop creative solutions for real business challenges. You will collaborate on multi-functional projects to identify areas for improvement. You will analyze internal processes, data, and problems and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities. Ultimately you will improve how Cisco operates and how we work together.WHO YOU'LL WORK WITHAt Cisco you will find a diverse group of people tackling business issues. We work with multi-functional teams to facilitate new business models and process improvements. Cisco employs the best so you will be surrounded by others as ambitious and dedicated as yourself.WHO YOU ARE• You are pursuing a bachelor’s or master's degree in Business, Management, Finance, Math, Accounting, Information Systems or related field• You have a minimum of a 3.0 GPA or equivalent• You have excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills• You have a high level of customer focus and service excellence as you seek practical and creative solutions• You have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and multi-functional teams• You have superb communication skills, “can do” attitude and a great teammate in global environment• You have effective time-management skills and the ability to prioritize work assignmentsWHY CISCOAt Cisco, each person brings their own unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.• We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.• We innovate everywhere - from launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.• We benefit everyone - we do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco#univanalystjobs #Engineering #Finance #GBS #ISG #IT #Sales #Services #SupplyChain #STO #Security @WeAreCisco

Name: Business Analyst (Full Time) - United States
Description: WHAT YOU’LL DOAs a Business Analyst New Graduate for Cisco you will develop creative solutions for real business challenges. You will collaborate on multi-functional projects to identify areas for improvement. You will analyze internal processes, data, and problems and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.• We benefit everyone - we do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco#univanalystjobs #Engineering #Finance #GBS #ISG #IT #Sales #Services #SupplyChain #STO #Security @WeAreCisco

Name: Analyst
Description: Your drive and intelligence put you on the path to academic achievement. Now you're ready to apply your knowledge and develop professionally. Become an Analyst at Charles River Associates, and you'll work with and learn from some of the most-respected scholars, specialists, and industry experts in the world. What do we do? CRA is a leading global consulting firm that provides independent economic and financial analysis behind litigation matters, guides businesses through critical strategy and operational issues to become more profitable, and advises governments on the economic impact of policies and regulations. Our two main services economic and management consulting are delivered by practice groups that focus on specific areas of expertise or industries.  Our Transfer Pricing practice offers comprehensive, world-class consulting services to companies in all industries. Our professionals have been involved in case work in more than 20 countries. We have the perspective and diverse set of skills required to assist in every phase of the tax cycle, including planning, documentation, and tax valuation. We also provide audit defense and support in litigation and alternative dispute resolution, and are often engaged in cases with pivotal, high-stakes outcomes. What does an Analyst do? Analysts at CRA work closely with both junior and senior staff on project teams.  Responsibilities:Creation of financial models and detailed financial statement analyses in ExcelReviewing and summarizing analyst reports, client documents, and industry trade pressConducting industry, market, and competitor researchAssisting in the production and development of detailed reports with the presentation of findingsQualifications:Completed BA/BS degree from an accredited college/universityGeneral accounting knowledgeProficient in excel modelingDemonstrated skills in economic and financial concepts, and quantitative and qualitative analysis methodsExceptional written and oral communication skills in EnglishHow to apply: To be considered for the Analyst role, submit your resume, cover letter, writing sample, AND unofficial transcript Charles River Associates is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer (EEO/AAE): Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst/Systems Analyst IITitle21 Health Solutions, a leading provider of Health and Life Science automation solutions, is seeking a customer facing BusinessSystems Analyst at its Pleasanton, CA location. This position is responsible for the successful project leadership and deployment of Workflow Management software into a customer's environment for the purpose of automating complex workflow processes in the Life Sciences space.Business Systems Analyst MissionTo translate customer requirements and objectives into a Title21 Health Solution within a targeted customer's environment, delivering complete customer delight throughout the process, while performing within project's scope, budget, and timelines.Responsibilities Deliver complete customer delight!As a key member of a Solution Deployment Team, you will be responsible for Assessing customer requirements, workflows, procedures, forms, systems and related information to provide implementation direction for the Solution Deployment Team in the configuration of the Title21 Health solution.Performing analysis of customer's business requirements, workflows, processes and expectations through interviewing customers Subject Matter Experts, management, IT, and related customer team members for the purposes of understanding their requirements.Leading meetings (both face-to-face and remote) as part of the gathering and development of requirements.Developing and managing all aspects of the requirements documentation at all levels of the deployment process (Customer Requirements (PRD), Data Dictionaries, Workflow Requirements, Test Requirements, Traceability Matrices, Interface specifications, etc.)Assessing gaps in customer requirements vis-à-vis the solution. Develop, evaluate and recommend satisfactory alternative configurations or approaches.Working with Title21 Health Application Specialists in the configuration of the solution.Helping track issues and problems through initiation, resolution and closure during the deployment process.Educating customer project team members in Title21’s product capabilities through configuration and demonstration of various design approaches.Participating in the validation of the configured software solution.Participating in marketing and pre-sales efforts. Participating in user group conferences and webinars, conference calls, tech talks, etc. Help translate the key customer benefits to the market (Webinars, speaking engagements, etc.).Conducting all levels of training (Power User Training, Casual User Training, Level 1 Admin, and Level 2 Admin, Crystal Reports, etc.) both at customer site and Title21 locations. Minimum Required Experience and Skill Set A minimum of 3-7 year’s experience in either a customer facing (not internal IT development) BusinessSystems Analyst position within the Life Sciences space, or as a Subject Matter Expert (with a strong IT background inclination). Experience in either area must have been in one or more of the following domains: LIMSLIS implementationCellular Therapy ManufacturingClinical DataInformation ManagementClinical Trials Data ManagementCIBMTR Data ManagementBPM in the Life Sciences DomainContent ManagementLMSQuality Management SystemsRisk Management SystemsAbility to learn the Title21 SolutionAbility to interface with customers from entry-level positions through Senior Management during the project deployment.Ability to communicate simply and effectively the capabilities and functionality of Title21 Health Solutions as it is relates to the customer's processes and objectives.Demonstrated understanding of the compliance challenges, regulations and processes of the target domains.Demonstrated verbal/written communication and public speaking skills.Demonstrated ability to deliver clear, concise instructions, communicate difficult concepts simply and effectively, and maintain professional presentation skills.Demonstrated ability to listen, comprehend and effectively document communications.Highly detailed oriented, extremely good follow-up.Ability to effectively manage and motivate team members to achieve desired results through others.Excellent interpersonal skills with a genuine enthusiasm for healthcare, quality and BPM fields.Strong familiarity with Microsoft Windows Systems with a good computerIT background.Self-motivated with the ability to thrive in self-directed work teams.Good critical thinking skills with the capability to learn new systems, synthesize information, formulate recommendations and perform within cross-functional and cross-organizational teams. Desirable Experience Experience working within, or implementing, CLIA, CAP, JCAHO, FDA, GxP regulations, AABB, 21 CFR Part 11, ISO 9000, and similar regulations/standards.Experience in training customers on Business Applications.Hands-on experience troubleshooting and analyzing system issues.Proficiency in Microsoft Office 2010/2013.Experience working in an entrepreneurial environment. Soft Skills Enjoy working on a team with enthusiastic, talented professionals; being a team player and enjoying a collaborative environment is essential.Ability to be agile in a high growth, fast-paced environment.Willingness to learn, grow and take on more responsibilities.Desire to learn and master the software system.Self-starter, reliable, conscientious, hardworking, customer-focused team member.Must work well with in an entrepreneurial, dynamic environment. Other This position requires 20-30% travel. Some international travel possible (must have a valid passport).Must have permanent U.S. residency. Position TypeFull-Time EmploymentLocationThis position is located in Pleasanton, California.CompensationTitle21 Health Solutions provides a highly competitive compensation and benefits package including: Competitive salary commensurate with experienceMedical/Dental/Vision plan401(k) with company match and 100% Immediate VestingPaid Holiday/Vacation/Sick days

Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. Name: Project Analyst - Associate Project Manager

Name: Business Systems Analyst, Pricing
Description: Job Description Summary:This position is for PayPal’s payment data services with focus in the pricing domain. This team is responsible for making all PayPal pricing data available to different business functions, like pricing, payments, sales, marketing, risk, analytics, and Finance. The scope of the organization is global, and its data platforms serve a wide array of functions including the life cycle of pricing services. We are committed to bringing innovation, passion and customer focus to the payment business and build a high-performance data platform that enables critical business decisions and analytical use cases. Our team works closely with numerous stakeholders to prioritize engineering tasks and collaborates with multiple engineering teams throughout the product development life cycle.  We are looking for a full time experienced, customer-oriented, business-focused, and analytically-driven Business System Analyst who can understand business needs and translate them to technical data platform solutions. The ideal candidate should have the ability to understand the functions of the payment system and pricing system, conduct payment and pricing data analysis, as well as the ability to prioritize and provide a proper impact assessment across work streams. This role requires execution from end-to-end: including internal testing, user acceptance testing, data quality, launch support, bug management, etc. It also requires an individual who is comfortable working in cross-functional teams with a very high degree of analytical and technical skills.Job Description: Responsibilities Pricing Data Ownership: Go to person for the data pertaining to a feature or a subject area within the pricing domain. Build expertise on data relevant to the subject area. Analyze and understand current state of the implementation to ensure that the context and implications of change are understood by the users and the project team.  Requirements: Engage with product managers and analysts to understand data needs and provide recommendations based on domain knowledge. Create and document solution(s) of medium to high complexity to meet end user requirements, including documentation of systems specifications. Conduct and coordinate user acceptance testing.  Execution: Manage project work through completion of delivery on assigned projects and ad hoc efforts. Support multiple projects simultaneously. Coordinate with internal teams and customers to launch solutions, ensuring execution of training and communication plans. Measure and document results of implemented solutions  Data Analysis & Problem Solving: Ability to understand business problem and provide feasible solution meeting PayPal domain & technology requirements. Engage with business users on proof of concept efforts  Technical Expertise: Facilitate / Engage technical discussion for their product. Proficient in the use of analytics tools/coding necessary to build prototypes and requirements documents. Adequate knowledge of reporting and Business Intelligence concepts. Knowledge of Hadoop stack tools (Hive, Spark, etc.) QualificationsA computer science graduate or undergraduate degree or equivalent with 6+ years of industry experience with 3+ years in business systems analysis.Experience in querying data from Oracle/Teradata/Hadoop systems and building solutions with strong knowledge of SQL; Experience in building large scale data aggregation is a plus.Experience in Insights from data - associations among data, business rules/logics, data flows, data usages.Track record of working within a fast paced, dynamic, team-oriented environment.Experience working with cross-functional teams and geo locations.Exceptional collaboration skills, within function and across peer stakeholders.Demonstrate excellent and effective interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal and listening).Experience with Tableau or other visualization tools is a plus.Experience in financial services industry preferred. Name: Business Analyst

The Product Analyst is responsible for defining, researching and documenting the specific product requirements that meet the market and strategy needs. The Product Analyst will work on Encompass with a specific focus on the next generation solution. You will work closely with Product Managers, UX, Engineering, Compliance, Technical support, and Clients to analyze current functionality, identify additional requirements that address compelling business challenges, and define detailed requirements. Key responsibilitiesDevelop a deep understanding of the product area that they are supporting.Conduct research to solidify detailed feature requirements through user stories and/or functional specifications.Convert large epics or user stories into smaller, detailed user stories that developers, user experience, and quality assurance resources can digest.Coordinate with sprint team to ensure understanding of product requirements, prioritization of work to be developed, tested and ultimately released, deliver enhancements and bug fixes.Maintain up to date knowledge regarding Logistics and transportation industry and technology trends as well as the REZ-1 product line and competitor products.Create the stories and Epics as well as the associated use cases that will form the basis for the release content.Ensure that UX counterparts always have the latest and concise list of requirements which they can use to create a corresponding UX Strategy that executes on the product plan.Write consistent, clear, and concise EPICS and user stories for each item referenced in the release plan, working closely with their UX counterparts to ensure UX-specific requirements are included as well.Collaborate almost daily with UX counterparts and Dev / QA team to ensure stories are aligned with the evolving user interface and technical design.Participate in scrum teams to answer team questions, ensure the requirements are understood and assist in providing any additional documentation to ensure a successful development and work closely with engineering and user experience teams and escalate key issues as needed.Support Sales, Client Management and Technical Support with escalations.Assist Technical Publications with the generation of client support documents.Work with sales, customer service, and customers to understand issues and minor enhancement requests as needed.Report status of features in progress, adjust focus and attention as priorities changeDemonstrate functionality while in development and once completed.Skills and Qualifications3+ years of Product/Business Analyst experience required.Must have experience in supply chain and logistics domain.Experience with consumer facing applications AND enterprise-class applications required.Must have experience developing and detailing software product requirements & user stories in an agile environment.Solid understanding of software development lifecycle and experience working with enterprise-class solutions.Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or an engineering discipline required.Detail-oriented, with an eye for user-centric design, and a passion for technology & how it impacts end-user workflowAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Experience working with cross-functional teams, including product management, development, quality assurance, support, marketing and sales.Flexible and able to adapt within a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst/Systems Analyst IITitle21 Health Solutions, a leading provider of Health and Life Science automation solutions, is seeking a customer facing BusinessSystems Analyst at its Pleasanton, CA location. This position is responsible for the successful project leadership and deployment of Workflow Management software into a customer's environment for the purpose of automating complex workflow processes in the Life Sciences space.Business Systems Analyst MissionTo translate customer requirements and objectives into a Title21 Health Solution within a targeted customer's environment, delivering complete customer delight throughout the process, while performing within project's scope, budget, and timelines.Responsibilities Deliver complete customer delight!As a key member of a Solution Deployment Team, you will be responsible for Assessing customer requirements, workflows, procedures, forms, systems and related information to provide implementation direction for the Solution Deployment Team in the configuration of the Title21 Health solution.Performing analysis of customer's business requirements, workflows, processes and expectations through interviewing customers Subject Matter Experts, management, IT, and related customer team members for the purposes of understanding their requirements.Leading meetings (both face-to-face and remote) as part of the gathering and development of requirements.Developing and managing all aspects of the requirements documentation at all levels of the deployment process (Customer Requirements (PRD), Data Dictionaries, Workflow Requirements, Test Requirements, Traceability Matrices, Interface specifications, etc.)Assessing gaps in customer requirements vis-à-vis the solution. Develop, evaluate and recommend satisfactory alternative configurations or approaches.Working with Title21 Health Application Specialists in the configuration of the solution.Helping track issues and problems through initiation, resolution and closure during the deployment process.Educating customer project team members in Title21’s product capabilities through configuration and demonstration of various design approaches.Participating in the validation of the configured software solution.Participating in marketing and pre-sales efforts. Participating in user group conferences and webinars, conference calls, tech talks, etc. Help translate the key customer benefits to the market (Webinars, speaking engagements, etc.).Conducting all levels of training (Power User Training, Casual User Training, Level 1 Admin, and Level 2 Admin, Crystal Reports, etc.) both at customer site and Title21 locations. Minimum Required Experience and Skill Set A minimum of 3-7 year’s experience in either a customer facing (not internal IT development) BusinessSystems Analyst position within the Life Sciences space, or as a Subject Matter Expert (with a strong IT background inclination). Experience in either area must have been in one or more of the following domains: LIMSLIS implementationCellular Therapy ManufacturingClinical DataInformation ManagementClinical Trials Data ManagementCIBMTR Data ManagementBPM in the Life Sciences DomainContent ManagementLMSQuality Management SystemsRisk Management SystemsAbility to learn the Title21 SolutionAbility to interface with customers from entry-level positions through Senior Management during the project deployment.Ability to communicate simply and effectively the capabilities and functionality of Title21 Health Solutions as it is relates to the customer's processes and objectives.Demonstrated understanding of the compliance challenges, regulations and processes of the target domains.Demonstrated verbal/written communication and public speaking skills.Demonstrated ability to deliver clear, concise instructions, communicate difficult concepts simply and effectively, and maintain professional presentation skills.Demonstrated ability to listen, comprehend and effectively document communications.Highly detailed oriented, extremely good follow-up.Ability to effectively manage and motivate team members to achieve desired results through others.Excellent interpersonal skills with a genuine enthusiasm for healthcare, quality and BPM fields.Strong familiarity with Microsoft Windows Systems with a good computerIT background.Self-motivated with the ability to thrive in self-directed work teams.Good critical thinking skills with the capability to learn new systems, synthesize information, formulate recommendations and perform within cross-functional and cross-organizational teams. Desirable Experience Experience working within, or implementing, CLIA, CAP, JCAHO, FDA, GxP regulations, AABB, 21 CFR Part 11, ISO 9000, and similar regulations/standards.Experience in training customers on Business Applications.Hands-on experience troubleshooting and analyzing system issues.Proficiency in Microsoft Office 2010/2013.Experience working in an entrepreneurial environment. Soft Skills Enjoy working on a team with enthusiastic, talented professionals; being a team player and enjoying a collaborative environment is essential.Ability to be agile in a high growth, fast-paced environment.Willingness to learn, grow and take on more responsibilities.Desire to learn and master the software system.Self-starter, reliable, conscientious, hardworking, customer-focused team member.Must work well with in an entrepreneurial, dynamic environment. Other This position requires 20-30% travel. Some international travel possible (must have a valid passport).Must have permanent U.S. residency. Position TypeFull-Time EmploymentLocationThis position is located in Pleasanton, California.CompensationTitle21 Health Solutions provides a highly competitive compensation and benefits package including: Competitive salary commensurate with experienceMedical/Dental/Vision plan401(k) with company match and 100% Immediate VestingPaid Holiday/Vacation/Sick days

Name: Senior Business Analyst - Decision Support
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Our team is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the Decision Support function to support delivering insights and dashboard development for the Operations organization.  You will have a combination of business insight and technical knowledge, used to develop and deliver Dashboards, insights and reports in support of rapid decision-making. You will focus on supporting the growth of Apple’s products, routes to market and key Operations initiatives. Your role is highly visible, interacting with executives and networking throughout Apple’s organization. We want you to help drive Apple’s reporting strategy.  5 - 10 years meaningful experience  Ability to quickly translate ambiguous business requirements into analytical insights  Expertise with Tableau and data visualization  Experience presenting and sharing insights with various business functions  Advanced knowledge of SQL  Experience with ETL tools used to automate manual processes  Familiarity with Operations and various functions (primarily Retail, Online. Logistics, Supply Chain a plus)  Demonstrable experience developing reports using SAP BOBJ, or similar tool  Experience with Python a plus The individual should demonstrate: Sound critical thinking, work ethics and passion to go beyond what is expected ongoing.  Possess a very high degree of natural curiosity to drive the next levels of business questions and insights  Solid teammate - driving new insights across technical and business domains for self and team ongoing  Demonstrates resilience and flexibility in the face of ambiguity to drive business impacting change Design, develop, and support dashboards and reports. Drive deep data profiling and analysis for insights. Define and enforce to established Data Governance principles and practice.Develop very strong business partnerships, deliver solutions to enable deep analysis and support business management and executive decision-making.You will work with Apple’s IS&T team to drive development of tools to better support business analytics and will partner with other Apple organizations on data governance, reporting tools, hierarchy management and critical metrics.Constantly steer business outcomes using established management systems to ensure alignment across WW and Regional teams.Education & Experience BS/MS/MBA in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Finance, Marketing or related field.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Summary NetApp Business Systems Analysts work as part of a team that supports and enhances NetApp's business processes and systems. You will utilize your strong technical competencies and functional business expertise to identify, evaluate and develop systems and procedures that meet business user requirements. To do this successfully you will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs; and IT development to provide automated solutions. This is a more senior position in the department, focusing on complex issues that require in-depth analysis of variable factors and the development of creative and cost effective solutions. An ability to understand complex business process issues and communicate technical solutions to the internal client, and to Management, is essential for your success in this role. This role requires demonstrated expertise in an outsourced manufacturing model for supply chain fulfillment, demand forecasting, supply planning, inventory management, S&OP processes and related system applications. Essential Functions: You will work as part of a team that is tasked to: Recommend improvement/solutions to business processes and systems based on an understanding of business needs.Lead systems and process improvement projectsLead design of business process and business system solutions for supply chain domainLead scope and definition for business process and system testing for high quality results for system implementationsProduce and maintain project schedules, meeting minutes and action plans. May act as the project leader on complex projects, or where your skills exceed those of the functional business team.Research emerging technologies and suppliers that could provide potential value-add to current or planned tools and processes.Lead people and projects on behalf of operations management and drive process improvement. This may include representation of the operations function on cross-functional teams, as assigned.Provide training to the super user community on systems and/or process improvement techniques. Coordinate any needed systems training for the BA team with the IT group.Document and establish business controls or functional policies in the form of ISO procedures or desk instructions.Participate in or lead technology/tool supplier assessments, including the audit and selection process.Develop metrics that provide data for process measurement.Understand and monitor the product roadmap to stay ahead of emerging trends that will challenge existing processes or tools.Job Requirements- Good oral and written communication skills; including process documentation.Strong analytical, problem-solving, negotiation, task and project management, and organizational skills.Knowledge of tools, processes, and operations planning.Experience working with IT development staff on complex projects.Good understanding of engineering principles and practices.Strong technical background with advanced personal computer skills including: MicroSoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Oracle. Experience with advanced analytics tools ie Tableau, Alteryx desiredExperience with full lifecycle implementation of advanced planning systems (ie cloud based technologies)  -Demonstrated experience with successful process and system transformation in high technology market with measurable business metrics  -Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment of other Operations Business Systems Analysts and cross functional peers to support deadlines.Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.Responsibility and Interaction:Responsibility:The tasks this individual is responsible are often unstructured and the issues addressed are less defined requiring new perspectives and creative approaches.This individual will apply attained experiences and knowledge in solving problems that are complex in scope requiring in-depth evaluation.Demonstrate good judgment in solving problems as well as identifying problems in advance, and proposing solutions.Interaction:This individual must work effectively with Staff to Vice President level employees within the function, across functions and with external parties.Limited supervision and direction is provided, as this individual can operate and drive results and set priorities independently.The ideal candidate will be a proactive contributor and subject matter expert.To be successful, this individual must demonstrate favorable results through regular leadership and influencing others.Education - A minimum of 8 years of experience is required; 9 to 11 years of experience is preferred.A Bachelor of Arts or Sciences Degree required; Business Management, Operations or Information Technology, or related technical field is preferred.Advanced degree preferred (MS)Demonstrated ability to design business process and system applications with track record of measurable business resultsDemonstrated ability to have completed multiple, complex technical projects.

Name: Summer Intern: Associate Business Analyst (BS/MS)
Description: As a Business Analyst, you will apply your quantitative skill set to create insights which directly influence product design and player experience. This internship will be part of analytics team for subscription, service and player network, based in Redwood City, CA. In this role, you will have the opportunity to: Influence development decisions and marketing strategies through fact-based data-driven insights and analysisPerform advanced statistical/machine learning analyses using all available sources of information (internal consumer data, consumer insights, research data, industry sources)Identify important user segments and help design personalized experienceCommunicate and present actionable results and findings derived from data throughout the organization in a clear, concise wayBuild visualizations and tools to help the studio and teams make rapid, informed decisionsGain hands-on experience extracting, cleaning, transforming, and analyzing massive amounts of raw telemetry data across several different platformsServe as an analysis point of knowledge for product initiatives and empowering the business partners in framing their future initiativesDesired Skills and ExperiencePursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in in a quantitative related field, such as: Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing (with a quantitative focus)Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skillsAbility to communicate insights using PowerPoint, Word and Excel to technical and non-technical audienceExperience with or a strong desire to learn SQL to extract and clean data for analysisFamiliarity with R (preferred), Python, SAS, or similar tools used to do data visualization, analysis, prediction and modellingKnowledge of probability, statistics, and descriptive and predictive modeling techniques preferredExperience with data visualization tools or packages, such as: Tableau, Dundas, Qlikview, ggplot

The Worldwide Distribution group has a unique vantage point on the business activity and data that drives predictive analytics to determine future revenue. The candidate must enthusiastically embrace the quest for future revenue predictability, not only through data, trends, and analysis, but be able to communicate effectively with key Cypress team members around the globe to meld analysis with the input and assessment of business activity from Cypress geography (GEO) leaders and personnel. Name: Business Process Analyst 2
Description: Responsible for the delivery of Product Specifications Documents to supplier partner(s) or delivery of process specifications to meet business specifications.  May be done in partnership with business partner(s) or via guidance to business partner(s) for execution. Defines system specifications needed to roll out flexible business models. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. 2 years relevant experience and BA/BS degree preferred. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.Department Description  The Business Process Green or Black Belt will be an integral part of the Supply Chain Operations, Global Supplier Management - Process, Automation,Compliance and Analytics department that is focused on streamlining and automating business processes. The Green/Black Belt will lead several complex cross-functional business process efficiency projects and drive the vision, strategy, execution and return on investment.
