Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Nextgen Technologies Inc. has openings for Business Intelligence Analyst (NG - 2018-1) in San Jose, CA.Job TitleBusiness Intelligence Analyst  Skill Set:Tableau Desktop 9.x/10.x, Tableau Server 9.x/10.x, JavaScript API, SQL queries, ETL, Datawarehousing, Hadoop, Big Data, HBase, HIVEQL (Query Language), Google Analytics, SAP Business Objects DataServices 4.1, BO 4.x, Rapid Marts, Web Intelligence (WEBI Reports), WEBI Rich client, Dash Board Designer, Information Design tool, SQL SERVER 2008/10/12/16.Educational RequirementsBachelor’s degree or its foreign equivalent in Computer Science, CIS, MIS, Engineering (any) or related field.Certifications:Tableau Desktop 10 Qualified AssociateProject Overview:The project is a Google Visual Analytics solution for Text and Google Analytics on Social Media. Internet-based social media have changed the idea of people’s communication, interaction and made the word more open and connected. This project involves extracting data from both structured and unstructured data writing Complex SQL codes and by using proprietary Google’s internal ETL tools.  This project aims in analyzing metrics on Invoice amounts of the Google products and helping organizations whose business, marketing or advertising goals are based on social media as well as organizations that want to know user reviews on their products from social media by turning structured data from different source systems and unstructured big-data into a meaningful, actionable and user-friendly web based interactive dashboards using Tableau dashboard design tool.Technologies required for the project are:Tableau Desktop 9.x/10.x, Tableau Server 9.x/10.x, JavaScript API, SQL queries, HIVEQL (Query Language), ETL, Datawarehousing, Hadoop, Big Data, HBase, HDFS files, Google Analytics, JAVA, SQL Server 2016.  The project will be developed in 8 different phases. Requirement Gathering (Duration: 2-3 months)Software Design (Duration: 3-4 months)Platform Setup (Duration: 2-3 months)Implementation and Integration (Duration: 12-15 months)Testing (Duration: 6-8 months)Deployment (Duration: 3-4 months)Performance and Optimization (Duration: 4-5 months)Future ScopeSpecific job responsibilities:• Analysis on the business requirements. Designing the ETL modules and creating data models to develop ETL jobs to extract data from different source systems (databases, Google sheets data, HDFS files & other file systems).Analyzing different KPI's (Key Performance Metrics) and data as per the business requirements.Creating Technical Specification Documents (TSD’s) to map source and target attributes applying business rules and mapping logics to provide best-fit solutions. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 20% Develop ETL (extract, Transform & Load) jobs to extract structured and unstructured data from different source systems and sites, cleanse the data, transform it and load it to the Datawarehouse using Google’s internal tools.Writing complex SQL queries to pull data from databases as per the business needs and provide business intelligence solutions. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 25% Creating new instances (virtual machines) and installing, configuring, migrating Tableau suite 10.x. maintaining and troubleshooting any technical issues.Develop reports & operational dashboards using Tableau Dashboard desing as per the business requirements once data is loaded into the target datawarehouse.Developing, publishing & scheduling interactive reports and organization's dashboards using Tableau Desktop/Server.Creating Forecasting & Financial modeling dashboards on time-series data using exponential smoothing models of Tableau Desktop. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 30% Perform testing of all the modules – Functional, ETL (Extract, Transform & Load) code developed and Integration of back-end components with the front-end (Tableau reports & Dashboards) to meet the functionalities/deliverable's in the project documentation and specifications.Managing end to end Projects from requirements gathering to production go live. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 15% Performance tuning of the ETL jobs, Tableau reports & dashboards developed, tuning the database tables, creating explain plans, creating indexes and tuning the reports developed.Performing administration tasks such as creating and managing users, sites, setting permissions, managing ownership's, providing access to the users using user filters and adding them to the specific group. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 10%Location:1667 Plymouth Street, Mountain View, CA - 94043.  To apply please send resumes to HR Manager, Nextgen Technologies Inc.,1735 North 1st Street #308, San Jose, CA 95112.,or email to resumes@nextgentechinc.com.

Name: Business Analyst/Program Manager

Excellent written and verbal communication Sound business judgment and ability to communicate technical concepts effectively Ability to translate queries and numbers into business insights Have a strong sense of ownership and a desire to develop new skills Problem solver by nature, a self-starter, and a diligent team player Comfortable with ambiguity. Ability to interact with a diverse set of internal stakeholders and navigate through ambiguity to solve operational challenges.Conference Call Notes:They need candidates with strong data analytics experienceData manipulating experience requiredStrong knowledge of SQL is requiredThey need someone who has extensive experience in creating Dashboards.Sound business judgement , ownership and excellent communication skills requiredThey would strongly prefer candidates who have prior MSP or VMS experiencePrior experience with IT/Outsourcing companies will be highly preferred.Heavy Data metrics and BI experience requiredThey would like to see some dashboard samples if possible.Candidate would by analyzing cycle time of recruitmentSDL2017

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst (PA)
Description: ** This position is open at both our Copenhagen (Denmark), Berlin (Germany) and Palo Alto (USA) offices - please let us know in your application, which location you are seeking **At Issuu, Business Intelligence Analysts partner with Product and Marketing to lead our data-informed decisions. This position will execute a company-wide strategic vision to consistently leverage data, tools, and applications for optimal business processing, adoption of data and critical decision making within Issuu and external partners. It takes an informed view to anticipate new trends and customer needs, and find innovative ways to solve complex challenges as the team implements its internal and external BI initiatives.While reporting to the Director of BI, this position will be part of a 3-person team focused on driving key strategic decisions throughout Issuu (Product, Marketing, Ad Operations, Business Development, Budgeting etc.) with insightful, data-driven analyses and analytics products. You’ll work on high impact questions like:What are the key KPIs that really drive Issuu's health?What is valuable content?What is the right life cycle for each publisher?Key Responsibilities Develop and prove hypotheses that generate critical insights and inform Issuu strategyConduct in-depth analysis and develop deep understanding of key value drivers to identify improvement areas and opportunitiesManage the board presentation process & deadlinesWork across the organization to deliver financial forecastsCommunicate the team's insights to the management teamBuild robust and highly actionable analytics products (tables, dashboards, algorithms, etc.) that are used every day by IssuuHelp drive the analytical rigor, quality, and culture within all of IssuuSome travel may be required, depending on the needQualifications for the ideal candidate 2+ years in a highly analytical role at a fast growing company (preferably SaaS experience)Fluent in SQL / Big QueryTeam oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individualsStrong (English) communication skills: Has experience clearly explaining complex concepts to people at all levels of an organization and across business and engineering teamsExperience prioritizing requests from many stakeholdersCurious nature and not hesitant in asking questionsStrong statistical foundation with experience using advanced statistical techniques and predictive modelingThe role of BI at IssuuBI plays a crucial role in ensuring that we are understanding customers through observed behavior. Their core job is to look at aggregate trends and highlight patterns that will increase our understanding of what publishers want through what is working and what is not. This observation and analysis ranges from the macro - is our business returning the results that we need - to the micro - what features are being used and why. They make recommendations of changes that need to be made to achieve desired results and determine what data needs to be collected, how it is defined and how it is reported.They perform the crucial function of looking at the reality of what people do, not what they say they do.In addition, the BI team has a duty to gather data for use in Board reports, ensuring that we provide consistent insight into the health of Issuu as a business.The BI organizationThe BI organization will be comprised of three analysts across Copenhagen, Palo Alto and/or Berlin. While the roles are interchangeable, we expect very strong collaboration and sharing of learnings for a collective success. Some travel may be required between the sites, depending on the need.Would You Like to Join?We're looking for the right person to join our team in Palo Alto full-time. In our Palo Alto office, you’ll find members of all parts of Issuu, including Product, Design, Customer Success, Data Analytics, Marketing and Management.We are conveniently close to the Palo Alto Caltrain Station and we provide delicious catered lunches, but we also offer regular outings and hackathons, healthy drinks and snacks, and a friendly, creative, welcoming atmosphere in a cool office set-up.Details: A valid US work permit is required.Dig deeper.Most of our content creators are on a mission to change their world in some way. They are passionate and driven and we consider ourselves the same. Check some of them out:The avantgarde Italian kids fashion magazine: https://issuu.com/kidswearmagazineThe Danish outdoor garage start-up magazine: https://issuu.com/outsite.orgThe Polish/Irish photographer: https://issuu.com/thefix-analogue-magazineThe Aussie LGBT wedding magazine: https://issuu.com/dancingwithherWe encourage everyone to apply regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran or disability status.

Name: Program Manager/Business System Analyst, Payments
Description: Summary Apple is looking for a talented professional to lead program management and analysis for new and ongoing initiatives for our global Payments Team.  As an integral member of our Payments team you will be working with regional and global teams around the world to ensure a world-class customer experience and industry leading system implementations.  You are a creative thinker, you love to understand the ins and outs of an implementation, and you love finding winning resolutions. You have a high level of integrity and sense of urgency to “make things happen”. You can balance the needs of multiple teams and maintain a strong sense of empathy for your partners. You are able to clearly communicate to a group of senior leaders. You want to join a strong team that’s growing quickly to craft the international expansion of Apple’s payments initiatives. Work closely with the Engineering Program Managers throughout execution.Serve as a partner and point of contact/escalation between the payment integrators and/or acquirers and the Apple internal teams (i.e.AMP engineering team, iTunes Operations, Apple Care).Work and collaborate with the iTunes Payment Operations and Apple Care teams to identify system and/or process improvements.Review contract-details with the appropriate teams to ensure all contractual requirements are covered in the business requirements documents, and in the implementationsEducation & Experience BA/BS degree required

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: The Company Hitachi Vantara combines technology, intellectual property and industry knowledge to deliver data-managing solutions that help enterprises improve their customers’ experiences, develop new revenue streams, and lower the costs of business. Hitachi Vantara elevates your innovation advantage by combining IT, operational technology (OT) and domain expertise. Come join our team and our employee-focused culture and help drive our customers’ data to meaningful customer outcomes. Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Company OverviewAt Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to:Build and enhance our proven security platformBlend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architectureAnalyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intelCollaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.The RoleWe are seeking a highly motivated professional with exceptional analytical skills to join us as a Business Operations Analyst. The successful candidate will be a self-motivated, experienced, and a highly analytical, strategic thinker – a candidate with the ability to solve business problems of moderate scope and deliver insights that enable timely and effective operational decision-making.  The position will report to the Director, Financial Planning & Analysis, and will work cross-functionally across the organization (FP&A, Accounting, Marketing, Product Management, and Sales Operations) to develop, manage, and refine the design of company-wide revenue, bookings, and performance related reporting processes. The role requires a candidate who can quickly become familiar with our SaaS business, associated metrics, and is able to support business decisions through in-depth analysis coupled with sound business judgment. This individual will analyze and report financial and operational results, monitor performance, assist with the corporate planning/forecasting processes, and improve existing processes. Your day-to-dayGather, consolidate, and analyze key operating, financial, and sales performance results – including in-depth analysis of revenue and bookings trends, sales team and product performance metrics, quarterly variances, and customer retention ratesWork cross-functionally to highlight, develop, refine, and distribute key, company-wide operating metrics by using existing knowledge of CRM/Salesforce systems, Business Intelligence (PowerBI) tools, and processes to drive valuable business insightsBuild and maintain complex business and forecast models used to drive business insights and help support informed recommendations to c-level executives – deliver the right information, to the right people, at the right timeContribute to annual and quarterly expense planning and forecasting processes and long range strategic planning as neededPrepare cyclical reporting and presentations for executive management and Board of Directors meetingsProactively initiate, develop, and maintain effective working relationships with various cross-functional leadership teams across the companyField ad hoc analytical requests on an as needed basis from the executive teamWhat you bring to the teamBA/BS degree in Finance, Economics, or other business related field; FP&A, Business Analysis, Sales Operations or relevant experience required, experience interacting with c-level executives a strong plus1-3+ years of experience in financial analysis or business analytics at a high growth public tech company (preferably SaaS)Proven experience in managing large datasets, developing insights from ambiguous data and facilitating team decisionsSuperior analytical and modeling skills including advanced proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, Vlookups, Index/Match, etc.) and the ability to quickly manipulate and analyze large data sets and build reports using a BI toolExperience in CRM/Salesforce a plusExperience in Microsoft PowerBI and/or SQL a huge plusStrong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills a mustWhy Proofpoint As a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!  #LI-JR1

Name: Summer Intern: Associate Business Analyst (BS/MS)
Description: As a Business Analyst, you will apply your quantitative skill set to create insights which directly influence product design and player experience. This internship will be part of analytics team for subscription, service and player network, based in Redwood City, CA. In this role, you will have the opportunity to: Influence development decisions and marketing strategies through fact-based data-driven insights and analysisPerform advanced statistical/machine learning analyses using all available sources of information (internal consumer data, consumer insights, research data, industry sources)Identify important user segments and help design personalized experienceCommunicate and present actionable results and findings derived from data throughout the organization in a clear, concise wayBuild visualizations and tools to help the studio and teams make rapid, informed decisionsGain hands-on experience extracting, cleaning, transforming, and analyzing massive amounts of raw telemetry data across several different platformsServe as an analysis point of knowledge for product initiatives and empowering the business partners in framing their future initiativesDesired Skills and ExperiencePursuing undergraduate or graduate degree in in a quantitative related field, such as: Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Marketing (with a quantitative focus)Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skillsAbility to communicate insights using PowerPoint, Word and Excel to technical and non-technical audienceExperience with or a strong desire to learn SQL to extract and clean data for analysisFamiliarity with R (preferred), Python, SAS, or similar tools used to do data visualization, analysis, prediction and modellingKnowledge of probability, statistics, and descriptive and predictive modeling techniques preferredExperience with data visualization tools or packages, such as: Tableau, Dundas, Qlikview, ggplot

Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: SummaryImagine what you could do here. At Apple, we pride ourselves in building great products, services, and customer experiences. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you can accomplish. The IS&S Marketing Group has an opportunity to redefine how consumers engage with great content and services. We are looking for a Product/Business Analyst, who will be supporting the CRM platform at Apple. As an analyst, you will work closely with partners for optimal definition, delivery, training and advocacy of premier CRM and growth enablement solutions. Work collaboratively with a team of cross-functional business partners to obtain and define business needs/requirements, develop product roadmap(s), achieve optimal design, ensure effective prioritization, establish critical metrics and ensure effective delivery of partner requirements. Ability to adapt to change, self-driven, and multitasking in a very fast paced environment are key success factors for the right candidate. Technical background and strength, especially in CRM. Strong social skills, with ability to collaborate and communicate at all organizational levels. Ability to anticipate and effectively solve complex problems. Strong project management and organization skills, with the ability to seamlessly multi-task. Ability to build consensus and alignment, act with urgency, drive results and take educated risks. A do-er and self starter who works well in a face-paced, dynamic, team environment. Highly responsive and adaptable. •Responsible for creation of prioritized, actionable product roadmaps, requirement documents and delivery of solutions in alignment with Apple’s needs and goals with a specific focus on premier CRM, self-service, reporting and marketing automation solutions. •Ensure clarity of expectations and accountability via measurable goals and objectives. •Develop and maintain subject matter expertise, best-practice insight, and optimal solution utilization. •Assist the Campaign Operations to improve and enhance the CRM system. •Manage the prioritization of work, helping to ensure quality and on time delivery within budget; maintain product roadmap(s), initiative and feature definition and work with the product stake-holders to deliver executable user stories to the engineering team(s). •Prioritize day to day requests and strategic roadmap work to achieve optimal benefit to the business. •Ensure and manage an effective user acceptance testing framework in place for all product releases. •Maintain close, positive relationships with internal clients to continuously understand challenges and identify new opportunities. •Help build standard reports / dashboards for reporting across the business, ensuring that complex information is presented clearly and in easy-to-use formats. •Manage the quality and consistency of data capture across all customer touch points. •Establish processes to ensure the quality of all data is good at and current. •Communicate frequently and effectively with all internal partners to ensure that platform product development, usability and its impact on the business is understood.Education & ExperienceBS/BA required.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst (PA)
Description: ** This position is open at both our Copenhagen (Denmark), Berlin (Germany) and Palo Alto (USA) offices - please let us know in your application, which location you are seeking **At Issuu, Business Intelligence Analysts partner with Product and Marketing to lead our data-informed decisions. This position will execute a company-wide strategic vision to consistently leverage data, tools, and applications for optimal business processing, adoption of data and critical decision making within Issuu and external partners. It takes an informed view to anticipate new trends and customer needs, and find innovative ways to solve complex challenges as the team implements its internal and external BI initiatives.While reporting to the Director of BI, this position will be part of a 3-person team focused on driving key strategic decisions throughout Issuu (Product, Marketing, Ad Operations, Business Development, Budgeting etc.) with insightful, data-driven analyses and analytics products. You’ll work on high impact questions like:What are the key KPIs that really drive Issuu's health?What is valuable content?What is the right life cycle for each publisher?Key Responsibilities Develop and prove hypotheses that generate critical insights and inform Issuu strategyConduct in-depth analysis and develop deep understanding of key value drivers to identify improvement areas and opportunitiesManage the board presentation process & deadlinesWork across the organization to deliver financial forecastsCommunicate the team's insights to the management teamBuild robust and highly actionable analytics products (tables, dashboards, algorithms, etc.) that are used every day by IssuuHelp drive the analytical rigor, quality, and culture within all of IssuuSome travel may be required, depending on the needQualifications for the ideal candidate 2+ years in a highly analytical role at a fast growing company (preferably SaaS experience)Fluent in SQL / Big QueryTeam oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individualsStrong (English) communication skills: Has experience clearly explaining complex concepts to people at all levels of an organization and across business and engineering teamsExperience prioritizing requests from many stakeholdersCurious nature and not hesitant in asking questionsStrong statistical foundation with experience using advanced statistical techniques and predictive modelingThe role of BI at IssuuBI plays a crucial role in ensuring that we are understanding customers through observed behavior. Their core job is to look at aggregate trends and highlight patterns that will increase our understanding of what publishers want through what is working and what is not. This observation and analysis ranges from the macro - is our business returning the results that we need - to the micro - what features are being used and why. They make recommendations of changes that need to be made to achieve desired results and determine what data needs to be collected, how it is defined and how it is reported.They perform the crucial function of looking at the reality of what people do, not what they say they do.In addition, the BI team has a duty to gather data for use in Board reports, ensuring that we provide consistent insight into the health of Issuu as a business.The BI organizationThe BI organization will be comprised of three analysts across Copenhagen, Palo Alto and/or Berlin. While the roles are interchangeable, we expect very strong collaboration and sharing of learnings for a collective success. Some travel may be required between the sites, depending on the need.Would You Like to Join?We're looking for the right person to join our team in Palo Alto full-time. In our Palo Alto office, you’ll find members of all parts of Issuu, including Product, Design, Customer Success, Data Analytics, Marketing and Management.We are conveniently close to the Palo Alto Caltrain Station and we provide delicious catered lunches, but we also offer regular outings and hackathons, healthy drinks and snacks, and a friendly, creative, welcoming atmosphere in a cool office set-up.Details: A valid US work permit is required.Dig deeper.Most of our content creators are on a mission to change their world in some way. They are passionate and driven and we consider ourselves the same. Check some of them out:The avantgarde Italian kids fashion magazine: https://issuu.com/kidswearmagazineThe Danish outdoor garage start-up magazine: https://issuu.com/outsite.orgThe Polish/Irish photographer: https://issuu.com/thefix-analogue-magazineThe Aussie LGBT wedding magazine: https://issuu.com/dancingwithherWe encourage everyone to apply regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran or disability status.

Were on a mission to improve peoples health and happiness through our digital health coach. We are the only A.I. nurse ever to become fully medically reimbursed to 100% replace a live nurse because we achieved equivalent health outcomes to live healthcare professionals - which allows for infinitely scalable healthcare. Since launch Lark has continued to receive awards and accolades for both our product, and our leadership. Apple's Top 10 Apps in the WorldBusiness Insider's most innovative companies in the world along with Uber and SnapchatBiz Journals 100 Women of Influence We are looking for a talented Business Analyst to join our growing team in Mountain View, CA, where you'll successfully execute on your objectives, and take a deep dive into all facets of our business, driving and contributing towards meaningful projects with diverse teams across the organization.ABOUT THE ROLEWhat Youll Do: Assist your manager and other team leaders with new project initiatives, to ensure projects are delivered on time, on budget, and with all agreed upon deliverables Work with stakeholders across the business to establish and implement new operational processes that enable Lark to scale successfully Communicate and collaborate with several cross-functional internal groups to identify and support organizational needs Continually evaluate current processes, identifying gaps, issues, and opportunities for making with focused and insightful data, allowing stakeholders to weigh pros and cons Facilitate communication and meetings with stakeholders Interface with external vendors, as required, to ensure appropriate engagement and accountability in conjunction with internal resources and activitiesWhat Youll Need: 4-6+ years experience leading or participating in cross-functional projects in a rapidly evolving environment A passion and aptitude for problem solving, with a continuous-improvement mindset Demonstrable experience improving processes and leading change A big-picture approach, with the ability to also organize and manage details Strong communication and relationship-building skills, with the ability to convey information, ideas, and action items clearly and concisely Experience and success analyzing large sets of data to identify trends The ability to thrive in a dynamic environment with rapidly-changing priorities and tight deadlines Grace and enthusiasm under fire Excellent business sense and good judgment Enthusiasm for learning, growing, and improving, quickly Inherent curiosity, with a passion for brainstorming, asking the right questions and figuring out solutions A Bachelors degree Bonus Points Experience in the healthcare industry Project Management Professional certification (PMP) A Six Sigma Green Belt, or similar certification Consulting experience A Masters degree in a related fieldJOIN US Our team works with cutting edge tools and technology related to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. We are using NLP to process millions of meals, and accelerometer data to compute activity and sleep amounts from users' phones. Our chat AI is the most sophisticated digital health engagement tool in the world. Join us and make it even better! Lark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Lark does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Name: Finance Business Analyst
Description: Nutanix is building a world class organization and is looking for a top notch Finance Business Analyst to add to the team. The position requires a highly dedicated individual who can deliver results in a high growth, ever-evolving environment. This person will be responsible for the functional design and support of SaaS solutions for Finance.  The candidate will be part of the SaaS Engineering team and will be supporting various business groups like finance, accounting, FP&A, Tax, Professional Services. The candidate will act as a liaison between finance and the delivery teams to help drive and implement process, systems and change adoption within the organization. The ideal candidate will have worked in fast paced organizations with rapid growth and frequent change, helping to drive and execute on change initiatives. This person will work closely with finance business partners and build strategic relationships with IT, finance and business operations teams. The candidate must have experience in Netsuite ERP and must have deep understanding of all financial modules and processes. Strong experience required in General Ledger, Receivables, Payables, Project Accounting, Fixed Assets, Inventory (from a period close standpoint) etc. Candidate must have experience with month end activities in the financial systems. Must have worked with Advanced Revenue Management module in Netsuite. Must have a good understanding of the Netsuite Technology stack and how all the different components work in tandem to build good solutions. Must have experience in the payment processing module in Netsuite. Experience required in Tax calculations leveraging systems like Avalara, Vertex etc. Must be able to build Saved searches, customize reports in Netsuite to address business reporting needs. productivity in business groups.Design new business processes that will scale and help business teams across the company.Must have the ability to train and help business users complete their daily tasks effectively.Effectively communicate business requirements to the technical organizations, and vice versa.Provides regular communication regarding the status of specific projects and interfaces with all areas affected by the project.Interact extensively with development teams to communicate business requirements in order to deliver efficient solutions in a timely manner.Provide support to the Finance organization at all times, especially during month end and quarter end.Minimum Job QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent in a Finance, Accounting or Info Systems discipline.Minimum of 8+ years of related work experience in an operational role and some experience with project and or change management.Experience working with Auditors both internal and external ensuring that business processes and Change control processes are SOX compliant is mandatory.Experience in a high change, rapidly growing business is a plus.Experience with ARM module of Netsuite to implement ASC 606 is a big plus.Experience with Adaptive insights or Hyperion will be a big bonus.Soft skillsStrong relationship building.Effective communicator that works well in a collaborative team setting.Exceptional ability to gather organize and evaluate any information or data needed as input from stakeholders and development team to determine requirements and specifications.CAN DO attitude.Ability and desire to work in a fast paced and continually evolving environment.Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects, priorities and complete objectives on time.Excellent communication skills, including both verbal and written.Excellent problem solving skills, conflict/resolution management, active listening, time management and excellent interpersonal skills.Exposure to process development and change execution.Ability to interact with all levels of business users (end-users/executives).

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: HR Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The HR Business Analyst acts as a facilitator and liaison between the HR functional teams and ANSYS IT for all aspects of business and product changes. This role requires an understanding of business, technology, and requirements gathering/documenting concepts. The role will partner with the PMO, Application, Functional, and Business Relationship Manager teams to drive the design, testing, and implementation of business processes and enterprise technology solutions. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain strong partnerships with key business stakeholders and team members.Develop common processes and standards.Conduct business process modeling and document AS-IS and TO-BE models.Responsible for discovering, gathering, documenting, and vetting business and functional requirements for new projects and processes.Design test plans and manage test plan execution / issue resolution; evaluate test results with functional owners.Develop production cutover plans and manage all project implementation activities.Support and participate in end user training; transition application administration and configuration to the appropriate system analyst and/or team.Participate in Incident Management, Root Cause Analysis and High Risk reviews.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degreeMinimum 5 years of experience in Human Resources, IT, and/or Business AnalysisMinimum 5 years developing Functional Specifications, Process Flows, Use Cases, Test Plans, and other SDLC deliverablesMinimum 5 years of experience conducting requirement analysis, solving business problems, assessing technical capabilities, and documenting solutionsExperience with the design, implementation, and support of HR Information Systems (e.g. SAP SuccessFactors, Workday, etc.)PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSound analytical and problem solving skillsStrong presentation and communication skills which will include organizing meetings with varied participants from multiple functions across the businessMinimal travelCULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company: Customer focusResults and AccountabilityInnovationTransparency and IntegrityMasteryInclusivenessSense of urgencyCollaboration and Teamwork ANSYS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business Analyst Company Summary:Personal Capital is the pioneer and market leader in digital wealth management, disrupting the traditional $30 trillion U.S. wealth management market. The company is a hybrid of technology driven advice complemented with human advisors, delivered virtually and directly to the consumer. Our free personal finance app is utilized by over a million users helping them track over $500 billion of their personal finances, all in one place. Our award-winning apps paved the way for our advisory firm, which now manages over $8 billion in personalized investment portfolios for families in the U.S. Personal Capital has raised over $200 million in capital from accomplished financial and strategic investors (IVP, Venrock, Crosslink, Corsair, Blackrock, BBVA, USAA, IGM/Power) to execute on its vision.The Role:The Advisory Services Business Analyst is responsible for driving, coordinating, and executing data analytics and efficiency initiatives across multiple departments including Advisory, Product, Marketing, Data, and Finance with a core focus Personal Capitals Advisory Services group.The Advisory Services Business Analyst should desire to work on multiple projects simultaneously with the ability to change focus quickly. They must love extracting and transforming large amounts of data into actionable business information, making it readily available to stakeholders in an easy to understand format.Specific duties include, but are not limited to:Conduct the full suite of data analyses to uncover insights about our product and users: Cohort Analysis, Funnel Analysis, Data/User Segmentation, etc.Conceptualize and maintain key performance reports and dashboards through deep data analysis with an emphasis on automation and scalability.Detect trends, identify opportunities, and provide actionable insights to department leaders allowing them to make informed data-driven decisions to drive the core business.Design and analyze A/B tests to drive KPI improvements.Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to tell the story behind the numbers.Partner with Engineering to optimize data tracking / quality and drive data warehouse improvements.Work closely with business partners to identify and analyze practical solutions through existing or new business systems.Qualifications:Must have in-depth knowledge of and passion for business analytics and insights.Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics or related quantitative field.4+ years business focused analysis experience in a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence focused role.Familiarity with data analytics and reporting systems including Tableau, Redshift, Salesforce, Qualtrics.Experience with SQL, R, or Python is a plusExpert knowledge in analysis of business process, workflow, and modeling.Ability to work closely with Senior Management and maintain strict levels of confidentiality.Ability to take direction and work with autonomy.Ability to exhibit strong decision making supported by quantitative data and qualitative rationale.Exceptional verbal, written and listening communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills, team-oriented, and collaborative.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Job DescriptionABOUT THE ROLEThe Information Technology group at Arm provides a variety of services to support existing and future commercial activities through working closely with the global enterprise to develop business change initiatives. Within this group, the Architecture, Planning and Delivery team works to deliver valuable business change to support Arms growth in an agile, resilient and scalable way.We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Business Systems Analyst to join a brand new developement team to support our Enterprise Marketing group in San Jose. With an exciting road map of marketing led projects you will work day to day alongside Product Owner, Marketers, Developers, Testers, UX and Architects whilst partnering with business groups and IT delivery teams, translating requirements into technology solutions that meet our strategic goals. We are making a strategic shift towards a more agile environment, as an integral part of the IT delivery capability, the Business Analyst will have a key part to play in this transformation.Do you work well with people at all levels? Are you highly motivated, with strong organisational and analytical skills to help support your decisions? Do you have a “can do” attitude and comfortable taking ownership to help drive a project forward? WHAT WILL YOU BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR?You will be the internal business proxy, taking ownership of detailed investigation, scoping, planning and execution of business analysis activities and deliverables for specified projects and productsYou will produce requirements and other documentation, as needed for individual projects, in accordance with internal standards and proceduresDrawing on experience to guide partnering with UX/UI specialists, facilitating the development of customer requirements, intuitive user stories, prioritising and de-conflicting where necessaryActive leadership role from vision through to execution; understanding business requirements, communication to internal IT, providing stakeholder awareness to close gaps in delivery. Top-tier skills in follow through is strongly preferred.Contribute to communities of practice to promote and develop of the function within ArmWHO YOU AREExcellent at influencing and motivating individuals and teamsComfortable working with ambiguity in a dynamic environmentSuperb communication skills and confident interacting at multiple levels of the organisationYou demonstrate drive, energy and resilience to workYou are approachable, confident and friendly manner, able to challenge appropriately Job RequirementsWhat skills, experience and qualifications do I need?3-5 year+ experience as a Business AnalystYou will have significant experience of sales and marketing operations, automation and workflow processes.You can apply your understanding of Marketing and CRM platforms (Marketo, Dynamics or Salesforce, Eloqua, Sitecore and Marketing Analytics/Reporting tools) to business challengesProven experience of delivering in an agile environment and passionate about the methodologyYou have superb interpersonal skills, with an ability to influence and motivate, as well as communicate high level concepts to leadersYou are self-motivated, with a "can do" attitude and able to make progress when faced with ambiguityYour experience may include working across cultures and timezonesExposure to Lean/Agile methodologiesExperience of creating user stories with acceptance criteria, process mappingJira and confluenceWhat are the desired behaviors for this role?At Arm, we have a set of behaviors that reflect our rare culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to "defy ordinary and shape extraordinary". These behaviors are assessed as part of the recruitment process:Partner and customer focus – Your tendency to put your partners and customers first in all that you do by understanding their needs and striving to achieve wining solutions.Collaboration and communication – Your ability to craft positive relationships which are built upon trust, communication and sharing of information and success.Creativity and innovation – Possessing a passion for driving improvement through spotting opportunities and seeking the views of others.Team and personal development – You take time to drive your own development, whilst also encouraging team members and partners to do the same.Impact and influence – You listen to different perspectives, evaluate, persuade and carefully shape your work to deliver truly impactful results.Deliver on your promises – You demonstrate a can-do attitude and you aim to overcome obstacles, acting with a sense of urgency because you’re passionate about what you do.#LI-SC2 BenefitsYour particular benefits package will depend on position and type of employment and may be subject to change. Your package will be confirmed on offer of employment. Arm’s benefits program provides permanent employees with the opportunity to stay innovative and healthy, ensure the wellness of their families, and create a positive working environment.Annual Bonus PlanDiscretionary Cash Awards401(k), 100% matching on first 6% eligible earningsMedical, Dental & Vision, 100% coverage for employee only, shared cost for dependentsBasic Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (AD&D)Short Term (STD) and Long Term (LTD) Disability InsuranceVacation, 20 days per year with option to buy 5 more.Holidays, 13 days per yearSabbatical, 20 paid days every four-years of serviceSick Leave, 7 days per yearVolunteering, four hours per month (TeamARM)Office location dependent: café on site, fitness facilities, team and social events Additional benefits include: Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care, EAP, Health Advocate, Business Travel Accident Program & Commuter programs.  ARM, Inc. (USA) participates in E-Verify. For more information, please refer to www.dhs.gov/E-Verify  About Arm Arm® technology is at the heart of a computing and connectivity revolution that is transforming the way people live and businesses operate. From the unmissable to the invisible; our advanced, energy-efficient processor designs are enabling the intelligence in 86 billion silicon chips and securely powering products from the sensor to the smartphone to the supercomputer. With more than 1,000 technology partners including the world’s most famous business and consumer brands, we are driving Arm innovation into all areas compute is happening inside the chip, the network and the cloud. With offices around the world, Arm is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace. About the office The Arm San Jose office is nestled in California's Silicon Valley, just south of San Francisco. Serving as Arm’s North America headquarters, the office houses employees serving all divisions of Arm. World-renowned Stanford University is seen as a hub of innovation, helping to make San Jose one of the US’s fastest growing cities. Name: Business Systems Analyst, Pricing
Description: Job Description Summary:This position is for PayPal’s payment data services with focus in the pricing domain. This team is responsible for making all PayPal pricing data available to different business functions, like pricing, payments, sales, marketing, risk, analytics, and Finance. The scope of the organization is global, and its data platforms serve a wide array of functions including the life cycle of pricing services. We are committed to bringing innovation, passion and customer focus to the payment business and build a high-performance data platform that enables critical business decisions and analytical use cases. Our team works closely with numerous stakeholders to prioritize engineering tasks and collaborates with multiple engineering teams throughout the product development life cycle.  We are looking for a full time experienced, customer-oriented, business-focused, and analytically-driven Business System Analyst who can understand business needs and translate them to technical data platform solutions. The ideal candidate should have the ability to understand the functions of the payment system and pricing system, conduct payment and pricing data analysis, as well as the ability to prioritize and provide a proper impact assessment across work streams. This role requires execution from end-to-end: including internal testing, user acceptance testing, data quality, launch support, bug management, etc. It also requires an individual who is comfortable working in cross-functional teams with a very high degree of analytical and technical skills.Job Description: Responsibilities Pricing Data Ownership: Go to person for the data pertaining to a feature or a subject area within the pricing domain. Build expertise on data relevant to the subject area. Analyze and understand current state of the implementation to ensure that the context and implications of change are understood by the users and the project team.  Requirements: Engage with product managers and analysts to understand data needs and provide recommendations based on domain knowledge. Create and document solution(s) of medium to high complexity to meet end user requirements, including documentation of systems specifications. Conduct and coordinate user acceptance testing.  Execution: Manage project work through completion of delivery on assigned projects and ad hoc efforts. Support multiple projects simultaneously. Coordinate with internal teams and customers to launch solutions, ensuring execution of training and communication plans. Measure and document results of implemented solutions  Data Analysis & Problem Solving: Ability to understand business problem and provide feasible solution meeting PayPal domain & technology requirements. Engage with business users on proof of concept efforts  Technical Expertise: Facilitate / Engage technical discussion for their product. Proficient in the use of analytics tools/coding necessary to build prototypes and requirements documents. Adequate knowledge of reporting and Business Intelligence concepts. Knowledge of Hadoop stack tools (Hive, Spark, etc.) QualificationsA computer science graduate or undergraduate degree or equivalent with 6+ years of industry experience with 3+ years in business systems analysis.Experience in querying data from Oracle/Teradata/Hadoop systems and building solutions with strong knowledge of SQL; Experience in building large scale data aggregation is a plus.Experience in Insights from data - associations among data, business rules/logics, data flows, data usages.Track record of working within a fast paced, dynamic, team-oriented environment.Experience working with cross-functional teams and geo locations.Exceptional collaboration skills, within function and across peer stakeholders.Demonstrate excellent and effective interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal and listening).Experience with Tableau or other visualization tools is a plus.Experience in financial services industry preferred. Subsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:San Jose, California, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations: We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Business Process Analyst 2
Description: Responsible for the delivery of Product Specifications Documents to supplier partner(s) or delivery of process specifications to meet business specifications.  May be done in partnership with business partner(s) or via guidance to business partner(s) for execution. Defines system specifications needed to roll out flexible business models. Responsible for understanding business objectives. Performs process or functional analysis to identify gaps compared to specifications, confers and/or drives issues with management for resolution, and ensures overall fulfillment of business specifications. Responsible for day-to-day engagement with business and/or process subject matter experts. Advises and consults with business teams prioritizing allocation of people resources, addressing project team problems ensuring that all team deliverables are met, and developing and presenting proposals of project plan and getting agreement from appropriate stakeholders. Understands and applies theories to policies and operating environment needed to effectively and efficiently complete assignments.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. 2 years relevant experience and BA/BS degree preferred. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.Department Description  The Business Process Green or Black Belt will be an integral part of the Supply Chain Operations, Global Supplier Management - Process, Automation,Compliance and Analytics department that is focused on streamlining and automating business processes. The Green/Black Belt will lead several complex cross-functional business process efficiency projects and drive the vision, strategy, execution and return on investment. The Green/Black Belt will also act as a liaison between Global Supplier Management and other functional organizations to obtain alignment and support to complete the projects.  What will I do? technical background with Kaizen or process re-engineering experience preferred.Lean Six Sigma Green/Black Belt and/or PMP certification.Highly motivated, results oriented leader with strong desire to make an impact, and the ability to transform ambiguity into clarity.Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate staff/project team, inspire teamwork.Solid understanding and application of project management methodology including the ability to identify and resolve issues, manage risk, develop detailed work plans and specifications, perform resource allocations and facilitate customer/stakeholder/team meetings.Demonstrated ability to assume a leadership role in defining and managing projects, risks, schedules, reporting, priorities, and escalations.Ability to work on multiple projects and successfully manage/influence multiple stakeholders.Strong organizational acumen - ability to thrive in a matrix environment where success depends on a high degree of cross-functional collaboration.Experienced negotiator with prioritization and conflict resolution know-how.Excellent interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills.Successful track records of products or projects meeting the requirements, budgets and schedule.Knowledge of the Oracle E-Business Suite is a plus.Experience with supplier management functions such as supplier selection, sourcing, costing, compliance, contract negotiation and performance management.Job code may be adjusted based upon education, skills and relevant experience. Essential candidate skills: Bachelor's degree required; technical background with Kaizen or process re-engineering experience preferred.Lean Six Sigma Green/Black Belt and/or PMP certification.Highly motivated, results oriented leader with strong desire to make an impact, and the ability to transform ambiguity into clarity.Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate staff/project team, inspire teamwork.Solid understanding and application of project management methodology including the ability to identify and resolve issues, manage risk, develop detailed work plans and specifications, perform resource allocations and facilitate customer/stakeholder/team meetings.Demonstrated ability to assume a leadership role in defining and managing projects, risks, schedules, reporting, priorities, and escalations.Ability to work on multiple projects and successfully manage/influence multiple stakeholders.Strong organizational acumen - ability to thrive in a matrix environment where success depends on a high degree of cross-functional collaboration.Experienced negotiator with prioritization and conflict resolution know-how.Excellent interpersonal and written and verbal communication skills. Name: Business Analyst

Technology is at the core of our business we don't just sell technology, we use it. The power of digital interviewing allows you the flexibility of using your computer or mobile device to record your interview on your own schedule in the comfort of your home. Our recruiting process allows you to tell your story in a stress-free way that is interactive and fun, so if you receive a link to Share your Story with us, we hope you have an awesome digital experience.  Business Analyst  Get Inspired by the Work You'll Do  The successful incumbent will act in the capacity of systems engineer and will be involved in the full cycle of development in CLOUDSolv that includes:  Collect and document business requirements by working with business team or external partners  Design new features or functions to meet business requirements in CLOUDSolv  Provide implementation specification to development team  Develop prototype POC program for key functions  Work with offshore team on daily basis to explain system development requirement or get support on production issues  Test and review programs delivered from development team  Support urgent production issues by data fix or configuration update Your passion is sparked by: Fluent in both English and Chinese  Five plus years of Software Development in Java or .NET  Strong communication skill verbally and in writing  Strong analytic capability to find solutions for complex problem  Computer Science or related bachelor's degree  Java, SQL, Node.js, REST API, C# is a huge plus, knowledge of Azure, IoT is a plus  We have great Perks - Every Day is Casual Day • Company Discounts • Community Involvement Opportunities • Profit Sharing • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance • 401k • FSA & HSA • Paid Vacation, Holiday & Sick Days • Employee Stock Purchase Plan • Tuition Reimbursement • Live Well Work Well Program • And More  Be Inspired In Your Career.  @ SYNNEX Corporation, we believe employees are our greatest asset and we empower them to make a difference in our business. Diversity and inclusion makes us all better. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.  @ SYNNEX Canada Limited, we are committed to supporting accommodation and inclusivity for persons with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and employment lifecycle. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know; we will work with you to meet your needs. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.SDL2017

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Nextgen Technologies Inc. has openings for Business Intelligence Analyst (NG - 2018-1) in San Jose, CA.Job TitleBusiness Intelligence Analyst  Skill Set:Tableau Desktop 9.x/10.x, Tableau Server 9.x/10.x, JavaScript API, SQL queries, ETL, Datawarehousing, Hadoop, Big Data, HBase, HIVEQL (Query Language), Google Analytics, SAP Business Objects DataServices 4.1, BO 4.x, Rapid Marts, Web Intelligence (WEBI Reports), WEBI Rich client, Dash Board Designer, Information Design tool, SQL SERVER 2008/10/12/16.Educational RequirementsBachelor’s degree or its foreign equivalent in Computer Science, CIS, MIS, Engineering (any) or related field.Certifications:Tableau Desktop 10 Qualified AssociateProject Overview:The project is a Google Visual Analytics solution for Text and Google Analytics on Social Media. Internet-based social media have changed the idea of people’s communication, interaction and made the word more open and connected. This project involves extracting data from both structured and unstructured data writing Complex SQL codes and by using proprietary Google’s internal ETL tools.  This project aims in analyzing metrics on Invoice amounts of the Google products and helping organizations whose business, marketing or advertising goals are based on social media as well as organizations that want to know user reviews on their products from social media by turning structured data from different source systems and unstructured big-data into a meaningful, actionable and user-friendly web based interactive dashboards using Tableau dashboard design tool.Technologies required for the project are:Tableau Desktop 9.x/10.x, Tableau Server 9.x/10.x, JavaScript API, SQL queries, HIVEQL (Query Language), ETL, Datawarehousing, Hadoop, Big Data, HBase, HDFS files, Google Analytics, JAVA, SQL Server 2016.  The project will be developed in 8 different phases. Requirement Gathering (Duration: 2-3 months)Software Design (Duration: 3-4 months)Platform Setup (Duration: 2-3 months)Implementation and Integration (Duration: 12-15 months)Testing (Duration: 6-8 months)Deployment (Duration: 3-4 months)Performance and Optimization (Duration: 4-5 months)Future ScopeSpecific job responsibilities:• Analysis on the business requirements. Designing the ETL modules and creating data models to develop ETL jobs to extract data from different source systems (databases, Google sheets data, HDFS files & other file systems).Analyzing different KPI's (Key Performance Metrics) and data as per the business requirements.Creating Technical Specification Documents (TSD’s) to map source and target attributes applying business rules and mapping logics to provide best-fit solutions. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 20% Develop ETL (extract, Transform & Load) jobs to extract structured and unstructured data from different source systems and sites, cleanse the data, transform it and load it to the Datawarehouse using Google’s internal tools.Writing complex SQL queries to pull data from databases as per the business needs and provide business intelligence solutions. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 25% Creating new instances (virtual machines) and installing, configuring, migrating Tableau suite 10.x. maintaining and troubleshooting any technical issues.Develop reports & operational dashboards using Tableau Dashboard desing as per the business requirements once data is loaded into the target datawarehouse.Developing, publishing & scheduling interactive reports and organization's dashboards using Tableau Desktop/Server.Creating Forecasting & Financial modeling dashboards on time-series data using exponential smoothing models of Tableau Desktop. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 30% Perform testing of all the modules – Functional, ETL (Extract, Transform & Load) code developed and Integration of back-end components with the front-end (Tableau reports & Dashboards) to meet the functionalities/deliverable's in the project documentation and specifications.Managing end to end Projects from requirements gathering to production go live. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 15% Performance tuning of the ETL jobs, Tableau reports & dashboards developed, tuning the database tables, creating explain plans, creating indexes and tuning the reports developed.Performing administration tasks such as creating and managing users, sites, setting permissions, managing ownership's, providing access to the users using user filters and adding them to the specific group. Percentage of time (on weekly basis) - 10%Location:1667 Plymouth Street, Mountain View, CA - 94043.  To apply please send resumes to HR Manager, Nextgen Technologies Inc.,1735 North 1st Street #308, San Jose, CA 95112.,or email to resumes@nextgentechinc.com.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Brief Description Cohesity is seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst with experience serving as an advocate for business and functional organizations relative to IT applications and services. The Senior Business Analyst will develop a deep understanding of the business rules and processes for the functional teams in their purview. This intelligence will be applied to the design and implementation of an IT roadmap to accomplish business objectives. Description The Senior Business Analyst owns the process of documenting operational objectives and requirements for Cohesity business systems. The selected individual will interface with all levels of management and business operations, will work with IT and various business teams to design, develop, and deploy new systems or enhancements for internal and external facing systems. This position reports to the Director of Business Applications. RequirementsDemonstrated experience in business analysis, project management, data mapping, ETL process development, object-oriented design methodologies and multi-tier client/server applications.Extensive CRM & ERP experience, with at least 3 years using NetSuite ERP and Salesforce CRM to accomplish business objectives across the enterprise.Well-versed in the lead to cash workstream for the Manufacturing industry with special focus on the lead to quote, order to cash, B2B EDI for supply chain management process segments.Experience with marketing automations, operations and workflows highly desirable.Demonstrated data analysis and troubleshooting skills; candidates must be power users of SQL query tools for ODBC, MS Office Suite, and Visio.A fluent English speaker with a deep understanding of the software development lifecycle, excellent written and verbal communication skills and extensive project management experience.Candidates invited for onsite interviews must provide a technical writing sample from their portfolio (use cases, system or functional specifications, etc.).ResponsibilitiesWork closely with IT to develop a deep knowledge of applications and organizational capabilities.Leads customer discovery, business process analysis & re-engineeringOperates as translator between customer and the development teamsDrives ongoing process improvement to resolve organizational information problems.Provide best practice recommendations to meet operational, program and compliance objectives.Analyze business processes, requirements, success factors and KPIs, and translate this information into actionable specifications for development teams.Facilitate iterative specification development with end users by creating rapid prototypes such as system mock ups, logic flows and use cases to establish acceptance criteria, exception handling, and related reporting requirements.Work with stakeholders to review requirements, design and develop solutions and establish project plans.Collaborate with on-site and remote developers through an iterative, agile development process.Author BRDs, use cases, functional specifications, technical specifications, test plans, project schedules, and detailed instructions.Develop, launch and manage in-depth KPI's, dashboards and reports for all team functions at both management and individual level.Take ownership of process and SDLC documentation from start to finish, gathering requirements, compiling associated technical solution descriptions and associated use cases, designing and executing comprehensive test plans, and structured UAT.Perform day-to-day process monitoring and post-release support activities.Maintain proper system access for all users and roles.

Name: Supply Chain Business Analyst, Platforms and Solutions
Description: What You'll DoWe need a phenomenal analyst who can transfer the business requirements into implementable User-Stories. You will help enable capabilities in support of the business processes. You'll guide development programs to graduate to RTB mode operations. You will utilize and improve the change dynamics, org adoption and rollout strategies to smoothen the transition. Your goal is to simplify the operations and digitize the experience.  You will play a meaningful role interacting with business and IT architects, engaging multi-functional teams, and influencing development / support teams. You possess strong leadership potential with background of good business understanding of Supply Chain processes and acumen.Who You'll Work WithYou be part of the Supply Chain Product Operations team which is leading Innovation initiatives. You will need to engage multiple teams across Operations, Supply Chain, Engineering, IT and Vendor teams.Who You AreYou clients and teammates consider you a blend of functional and technical knowledge-house. You know how to innovate, bringing to bear a wide knowledge of business processes and tools. You are able to work under stress and get results with minimal direction. You have a phenomenal passion to learn and embrace to changing business environments.  At a minimum, we expect you to have a BA/BS, 3+ years experience in an Analyst role. You should have knowledge of Supply Chain domain and have a proven track record as high potential leadership (CLEAD) skill.Why CiscoAt Cisco, each person brings their rare talents to work as a team and make a difference.  Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco  Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.  Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, all applicants who meet qualifications with arrest and conviction records.
