Name: Business Applications Analyst
Description: About Us Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.  The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure's technology literally in the driver's seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love. For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet here. IT Team at Pure Take a moment to think of some of the most amazing groups in history. The A-Team. The Avengers. The Eagles. The '95-'96 Chicago Bulls. What do these groups have in common?  They pale in comparison to Pure IT.  We've put together a diverse and elite group of nerds to manage all of Pure's technology, including helpdesk, systems, networking, AV, deployment, knowledge management, business applications, and security. We're looking for new additions to boost our team's skillset (and Nerf-Gun-war prowess) even more.  Pure's IT organization is a core part of Pure Storage's company-wide daily operations and has employees located across the US and EMEA, with a majority of the team residing in Mountain View, CA. What You Will Be DoingTranslate business requirements into technical processes and system solutions that are aligned with the strategic plan and industry best practicesDevelope requirements, specifications and documentation for business needsProvide subject-matter expertise and primary application administration including installations, upgrades and support on defined software applicationsContinued evaluation of assigned software systems to fully utilize system capabilitiesPerform and coordinate software testing prior to the roll-out of software upgrades and new enhancements or modulesProvide support and troubleshooting for software questions and issues; escalate to appropriate vendor as neededIdentify, research, test, and recommend solutions to user software problemsWhat You Bring to the teamBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related fieldMinimum 3 years' experience analyzing and evaluating business applicationsExperience with NetSuite requiredBackground working with key business applications such as Workday and SalesforcePrior experience partnering with Sales Operations, Finance and HR with knowledge of the transactional processesExperience with systems integrationProven analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detailsMust be willing and able to work in an open office, team environment.Pure creates opportunities for your development and career growth. At Pure, we believe that each Puritan is a leader contributing to the success of our business, regardless of role. We offer an assortment of learning options available to all Puritans, including workshops on leadership, management, career development and more! We're here to change the world and we hope you join us! Popular Perks Pure offers an unlimited vacation policy, free lunches, meditation rooms, free yoga classes and employee resource groups to inspire all of our employees to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back not only to the Bay Area, but across the globe. Pure is Committed to Equality Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at recruitingops@purestorage.com.

Name: SAP Business Analyst
Description: Our company creates and develops highly complex technologies with productive ALD and CVD systems. Our approach to customer solutions is innovative and revolutionary, and we see it as a personal progression. We collaborate with research centers, universities, and industry partners.  Our company is seeking an experienced SAP Business Analyst with a vast knowledge of the business process and SAP standard procedures. Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change.Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environmentProvide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Information Data Services
Description: Job Description The Challenge  Adobe's Information & Data Services team (IDS) is at the leading edge of data-driven solutions, responsible for delivering the data foundation and applications that power Adobe's strategic decision making and customer experiences. As part of the Cloud Technology organization, IDS delivers real-time, operational, and analytical data capabilities using a variety of technology platforms to meet the needs of data scientists, analysts, engagement marketers, and executives.  We are looking for an exceptional Senior Business Systems Analyst to join the team responsible for the Data Driven Customer Engagement. We partner with marketing, sales, product, and customer experience teams to activate streaming and batch data that scales with Adobe's increasing demand. We activate data from all subject areas (product usage, financial subscription/retention, web visit, marketing, and data science) to optimize product development and personalized customer experiences.  Your desire to make an impact and a hands-on approach is critical as you work closely with engagement marketing and engineering teams deliver data for enriched segmentation and personalization. The successful candidate must be able to pro-actively engage the business, build relationships and solve problems. You must also be able to independently drive analysis of data quality and problem solving and share recommendations with a broader solution delivery team. This position will provide thought leadership and continuous improvement to or delivery and operations cycles. This is not an 'order taker' position.  What you'll do Interact regularly with business communicating the project portfolio, technology roadmap, and planning on future business objectives.Understand capability of applications and their generated transaction and event data (SAP, Adobe's marketing tools, Hadoop/Kafka streams) in environment and effectively navigate the data domains to identify and inform business partners and engineering on best source for each use case.Provide thought leadership to the Information Data Services (IDS) organization and to business on how to achieve results.Serve as an intake and prioritization funnel for business engagement and developing clear requirements.Work within the program management and engineering teams to deliver business needs quickly.Assist Adobe business partners in all stages of process of defining key capabilities/requirements that will enable their strategy and participate in the gathering of functional requirements that lead to projects or enhancements.Prototype the solution to our business partners.Work with Enterprise Application Architecture, Project Management, and Development to plan, design and deliver of solutions that meet business needs.Participate in and/or lead various process improvement projects to increase operational efficiency.Work with Operations and Support Management to coordinate the handling/escalation of production support issues in a timely and efficient manner.Creating complex conceptual designs (including application interfaces and interactions) and dashboards.Collaboratively get work done by working with and inspiring high performing teams across multiple geographies.Responsible for driving adoption of delivered solutions. What you need to succeed Requires bachelor's degree. Master's degree in Business Analytics/Computer Science or MBA is a plus.3+ years of functional or data experience with attention to detail and strong understanding of how data solves for analytical and operational use cases in Marketing, Sales, Finance, Product development, or Customer CareYou bring a track record for clearly articulating real business problems, and can quickly build deep understanding of analytic and operational data needsKnowledgeable about the subscription business model, engagement and product usage metrics, and data requirements that drive personalized messaging and experiences (e.g. profile-based customer segmentation and A/B testing methodologies)Great interpersonal communication. You'll be interacting with everyone from senior leadership to program management, engineering, and client teams, and providing briefings and roadmap updates to influence stakeholder buy-in.Great presentation skills. You'll be sharing the product roadmap and strategy in front of large internal and external audiences; and need to distill complex issues into clear recommendations.Skilled in collecting, documenting and prioritizing requirements in an agile framework, and responding to input from multiple sources (customers, testers, engineering, competitive products, management, etc.)Strong understanding of big data platforms (Hadoop, Redshift, etc.) and both streaming & ETL processes, and familiarity with SQL/Python and experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau or Power BIProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment and to build and manage cross functional relationships. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you're looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the and explore the meaningful we offer.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionOverview It's an exciting time to join the Business Process Management Group! In a newly structured group, your process improvement, problem solving and fact driven analysis will be a key contributor to the success of the Private Client Group (PCG), a major business unit driving overall firm success. The Opportunity: The Business Process Management Group is seeking a Business Process Analyst to help drive measurable business process improvements aligned with PCG objectives. The Business Process Analyst works cross-functionally within PCG and the broader firm to understand and develop our primary value chain, unify our business process architecture, streamline key processes and sub-processes, and proactively identify and execute on operational excellence and measurable areas for improvement. The Day-to Day:Partner with the business and its’ leadership to develop the client life cycle, map business capabilities and key processes, and assess areas for improvement using Lean methodology and Agile tools.Collaborate with the Technology Group as a process owner and business expert in implementing engineered or vendor solutions that enhance client experience and meet business requirements.Drive process improvements through constant, iterative review of our business process architecture’s stability and scalability, developing lean workflows with high quality output, ensuring solutions meet current and future business objectives.Use industry standard methodologies to conduct root cause analysis formulating cogent problem statements, process assessment, modeling, and plan for improvement.Document requirements and manage changes from current (as-is) to target (to-be) design states.Lead process redesign & reengineering workshops with business end-users providing them adequate support and training.Maintain business processes and group artifacts.Your Qualifications:Minimum 5 years of experience as a Business Process Analyst or similar position.Owner of, or involved in, complex business processes, business process mapping, or business architecture modeling.Experience leading teams in process improvement projects in service industries with a demonstrable track record preferred.Certifications in Lean Sigma, Value Stream Mapping (VSM), BPM, or other continuous improvement/operational excellence methodologies a considerable plus.Experience in process workflow mapping using MS Visio or similar tools with BPMN or other notation standard.Experience with Atlassian Confluence, Jira and/or similar project & issue tracking software.Working knowledge of and applied experience with Waterfall and Agile methodologies, and SDLC.Experience with a Business Process Management Suite (BPMS) is a plus, but not required.Effective written and verbal communication skills to multiple audiences, including various levels of management.Strong technical aptitude (learns new processes and systems quickly) and ability to work independently, handle multiple priorities, and solve complex problems.Why Fisher Investments: Fisher Investments is a different kind of investment firm. We don’t come from Wall Street, nor do we believe we fit in with most of the finance industry, and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to innovative perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that enable us to offer the level of service that we do. And we invest in them accordingly, offering exceptional benefits like: 100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insuranceA 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidaysAnd much, much more We also provide a cumulative, continuous learning and development framework customized for every employee. This emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an award-winning work environment; we’re Great Place to Work Certified, and The Oregonian named us as a 2017 and 2018 Top Workplace.  But in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our employees want to make a difference in an industry that can do better.  * California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year.  FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: Business System Analyst  Salary Range:  Location: Nebraska, USAOmaha-Council Bluffs, Nebraska, USA Desired Skills:  Description: Talent Space is seeking a Business Systems Analyst for Omaha, NE to analyze business and all other data processing problems for application to electronic data processing systems. A typical Business Systems Analyst is responsible for analyzing user requirements, procedures and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations.  Job Responsibilities:  • Documents system parameters and formats, ensures hardware, and software systems compatibility and coordinates and/or modifies systems parameters.  • Assists in formulating and defining small project/system scope and objectives and developing detailed systems specifications from which programs will be written and that fit with the Bank's system architecture standards.  • Participates in evaluating existing systems and procedures to identify deficiencies and maintain more effective data handling, conversion, input/output requirements, and storage.  • Assists with analyzing, developing and revising existing system logic difficulties and documentation as necessary.  • Works with IT team through coding and implementation to ensure product matches envisioned result.  • Assists in conducting feasibility studies and may participate in recommending new or enhanced applications software to meet business needs.  • Provides basic coordination and analytical assistance to staff which may include interpretation of requirements.  • Provides assistance in developing detailed requirements with business partners and system definition.  • Reviews, drafts, and outlines simple systems specifications, screen designs, and reports from which programs will be written and that fit with the Bank's system architecture standards.  • May support development of test scripts and participate in functional testing.  • May support maintenance of business systems and interface applications.  • Ensures compliance to departmental and bank processes or procedures related to supported systems.  • Provides support as a subject matter expert to department or business units for small/less complex business applications or system processes.  Skills:  • Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills.  • Strong ability to work independently and manage one’s time.  • Strong leadership and mentoring skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback.  • Strong knowledge of design techniques and principals involved in production of drawings and models.  • Strong knowledge of computer software, such as Visual Basic, Java, SQL, etc. Education/Experience:  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required. MBA or other related advanced degree preferred.  • 8-10 years’ experience required. Additional Information: Proficiency in core banking applications and their interaction with upstream and downstream interfaces. Solid knowledge of COBOL, CICS, DB2 and JCL. Good understanding of middleware and interaction with back end core banking application suite. Proficiency in creating work flows/process flows. • Good understanding of file transfer protocols such as but not limited to C:D (NDM), any SFTP, TCP/IP etc • Excellent knowledge of system analysis If interested, please send a Word copy of your resume to ubhide@svtalentspace.com.

Name: Senior FP&A Analyst
Description: Qubole, the leading cloud-agnostic, big data-as-a-service provider, is passionate about making data-driven insights easily accessible to anyone. Qubole delivers the industrys first autonomous data platform. The cloud-based data platform, Qubole Data Service (QDS), removes the burden of maintaining infrastructure of multiple big data processing engines, and enables customers to focus on their data. Qubole customers process nearly an exabyte of data every month. Qubole investors include Charles River, Institutional Venture Partners, Lightspeed, Norwest, Harmony and Singtel Innov8. The Senior FP&A Analyst will report to the CFO and will be a key player in building out the financial and strategic planning function at Qubole. Were looking for a process-oriented doer and a problem-solver with the highest standard of personal and professional integrity. The right candidate will possesses the analytical rigor and strategic thinking to help our business scale smart and be able to grow and take the next step to manager. You need to embrace challenges and be able to approach complex problems in an organized and detail-oriented manner.As a Senior FP&A Analyst, your work is used by our executives to make strategic decisions that will have immediate impact on the company. You will join a small, growing finance team and have access to senior leadership across multiple departments. What you'll be doingProduce long and short term financial plans, ensuring strong linkage between both; to support critical expansion and operational strategiesImprove deal review processes and systems to enhance management visibility and decision-makingBuild, maintain, and automate complex and dynamic financial models to provide data driven, actionable insights to drive product growth and other strategic objectivesAssist in the preparation and presentation of weekly, monthly, Board of Directors and other financial reporting Take on ad-hoc projects and synthesize results into digestible summariesPartner with the management team to drive accurate financial forecastsLead special projects for the CFO and Management team as neededRequired experiences and skillsBachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or other quantitative fieldMBA and/or CPA a plus5+ years of Financial Planning and/or Forecasting experience in high growth technology companyStrong analytical skills, including superior financial modeling - need to have the ability and passion to build complex financial modelsAbility to thrive in a fast paced, quickly changing and highly collaborative team environment with the resourcefulness to solve ambiguous problemsAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint skills, G-Suite experience highly preferred Experience with NetSuite and Host Analytics is a plusExceptional communication and interpersonal skillsStart-up experience preferredQubole is hitting that growth inflection point where we need talented people to help us scale up. Our company culture is special, and we are looking for people to join us who want to continue building a great company while going after the big data activation market. Check us out on Glassdoor and LinkedInLearn more about us here, here, and hereIf you want to get technical, click here for a 5 min run down of how Qubole worksWatch a talk given by our CEO hereCulture at QuboleTrust and Autonomy: We absolutely pride ourselves on the lack of bureaucracy at work, and believe in delegating power and responsibility, aggressively to our employees.Transparency and Teamwork: Complete transparency in all our thoughts and actions is integral to our genetic character, and it helps us to stick together and function effectively as a team.Who Thrives: If you are a self-starter and thrive on complexity and independence and truly understand and live the tenets of humility, hunger and honesty and you will love Qubole.Qubole is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Qubole does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Qubole also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst II
Description: Overview: The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for working collaboratively cross-functionally to help design and optimize business processes, systems and analytical tools in Genomic Health’s Global Supply Chain organization. The Senior Business Analyst acts as the interface between business and technology teams. He/she will support process/system design and improvement projects and product launches through all phases of the project life cycle.  This position will specialize in assignments in our Global Supply Chain (procurement, inventory management, demand planning, sales order management, manufacturing, distribution), though support of other areas may be required and will be assigned as needed. The primary customers for this position include Supply Chain, Laboratory Operations, and IT.  Responsibilities: Business Process, Systems, and Analytics - Analysis & Support • Work with Supply Chain Department Leads across geographies and Platform Lifecycle Manager to analyze existing business processes, systems, and analytical tools to identify and document pain points and opportunities for improvement.  • Develop detailed documentation (gap analyses, process flowcharts, decision tables, etc.) to aid in the understanding of business requirements and potential solution options. • Consult a broad group of stakeholders to understand all requirements; negotiate a process/system solution that will meet the needs of the broader group. • Provide input into the usability and performance needs to assist technical teams in establishing the technical solution for the project.  • Document business requirements in the form of user stories and in other written documentation as required. • Lead meetings to ensure business requirements are communicated to and understood by software developers.  • Collaborate with IT and business to propose and provide input on system design solutions and process changes. • Serve as Product Owner on the Agile implementation team. Change Management • Summarize and communicate implementation solutions to business. • Provide input and support to business during the implementation phase, including carrying out software user testing, composing SOPs, and/or conducting user training and implementation. • Serve as frontline support in troubleshooting process and systems issues, and provide ongoing operational support as required. Project and Portfolio Management • Provide project status updates in both verbal and written format. • Assist the Scrum Master/Project Manager in developing detailed project timelines to ensure analysis and change management activities are accounted for. • Collaborate with the ERP Portfolio Management Team and/or Platform Lifecycle Manager to maintain a backlog of projects and features. Propose phasing strategies to efficiently implement projects. Essential Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: • Works with minimal guidance from manager to deliver on medium and high complexity projects: o Quickly develops a detailed understanding of the processes, systems, and analytics utilized by the business area o Consolidates input from business and technical stakeholders. Negotiates solutions to ensure a broad range of stakeholders’ needs are met o Overcomes challenges to move projects forward o Efficiently manages multiple projects with competing deadlines • Demonstrates effective analysis and communication skills: o Mines data to inform business process flow decisions o Documents complex business processes o Demonstrates outstanding written and verbal communication skills o Delivers well-organized, informative presentations and requirements documents • Excellent team player, demonstrating strong interpersonal and collaborative skills • Courageous, curious, and articulate. Qualifications: • BS/MS degree  • 8+ years of business process improvement experience, either as a Business Analyst or in a functional role. • Prior experience working with ERP and CRM systems with a focus on Supply Chain processes and functionality. Name: Sr. NetSuite Functional Consultant
Description: DescriptionThe majority of the Senior NetSuite Consultant's time will be spent executing tasks related to customer solution delivery and supporting pre sales function for new op. The Senior NetSuite Consultant ensures that all activities are carried out in an efficient, cost-effective manner and will also have responsibility for leading/managing a portion of the practice or project team including team member development and coaching, resource management, and administrative tasks related to those team members. The Senior NetSuite Consultant acts as a bridge between all departments within the NetSuite Practice, including Sales, Customer Support, and Partners. The Senior NetSuite Consultant serves as an internal subject matter expert and supports all company activities including but not limited to system implementations, integrations, and process consultations. The Senior NetSuite Consultant will be expected to participate in team building and to develop team and customer relationships. The Senior NetSuite Consultant will proactively look for ways to keep all time productive and will use non-customer time for personal training, internal projects and administrative tasks. The Senior NetSuite Consultant will be expected to coach, train or be a Peer Partner to newly hired team members. Name: Senior Business Operations Analyst
Description: At BlueVine, we’re transforming how businesses get access to working capital financing. Founded in 2013, our online lending platform has helped 10,000+ business owners simplify their cashflow management, boost growth, and take advantage of new opportunities. As a leading FinTech company, we’re backed by Menlo Ventures, LightSpeed Ventures, 83North, Silicon Valley Bank, Citi Ventures, M12 and Nationwide Insurance among other notable investors. Our clients love us, the market we’re going after is huge, and we’re just getting started.As a Business Operations Analyst, you will help architect how BlueVine goes to market. You will drive the strategy and growth of our Sales, Account Management, Marketing, and Partnerships teams through automation, incentive plan design, and process development. You will have the opportunity to own team projects across multiple business functions. You will own projects end to end, from evaluation and analytics, to support gathering and execution.WHAT YOU'LL DO: Partner with our risk, engineering, data science, and finance organizations to drive growthDrive product strategy for the business team to help evaluate, build, and launch new products for the companyOwn insights and analytics for the Revenue OrganizationDevelop the processes and systems relied on by our business teams to achieve our growth targetsBuild incentive plans to fuel our growth and maximize our customer experienceWHAT WE LOOK FOR:4+ years experience overall with 2+ in an operations/finance roleDemonstrable experience with SQL and scripting languages such as Python or RubyVery strong excel skills (Array/CSE formula familiarity, etc.)A proven self starter, setting your own deliverables, and then executing themEntrepreneurial mindset and a track record of finding problems and fixing themBA/BS degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Finance, Math) or equivalent work experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsApplicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.BlueVine’s mission is to help business owners succeed and thrive by making sure they have convenient access to capital for their everyday funding needs. We’ve helped thousands of businesses since we started in 2013, funding more than $1 billion in working capital through our pioneering online platform. Our invoice factoring product allows business to receive cash advances on their outstanding invoices, offering factoring lines of up to $5 million. Our business line of credit product, called Flex Credit, offers financing based on 6-month and 12-month payment terms, and credit lines of up to $250,000. Based in Redwood City, Calif., BlueVine is backed by leading venture capital firms.

Name: Data Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description: The Amazon Search team builds the largest shopping search engine in the world. Whenever a customer searches or browses using an Amazon website or application, we connect them to the products and services they are looking for. The Search Data and Machine Learning Engineering team designs, builds, and operates distributed infrastructure and applications to process and analyze the petabytes of data that flow through Amazon Search. Our systems power research, train machine learned models, deliver ranking data to our production systems, and provide customer insight into Amazons retail business. Our data powers live-site features, including search suggestions, query understanding, spelling, search result ranking, and personalization. We are located in downtown Palo Alto, a short walk from numerous shops and restaurants, and right across from the Cal-train station.  The Amazon Search Data and Analytics Team is looking for a passionate and solution-oriented Data Analyst to implement analytical solutions that deepen our collective understanding of customers, influence innovation, and deliver actionable insights to accelerate the growth and effectiveness of Search worldwide.  For this role, we're looking for an experienced analyst to join our central analytics team, which is focused on business intelligence, data quality, and governance and enabling business teams throughout Amazon to utilize Search Data to deeply understand our customers and business.  This position requires a deep quantitative domain expertise along with the ability to manage internal and external stakeholder teams. You will be responsible for delivering key insights from the search business, including the development of core KPIs and metrics, partnering to design appropriate delivery mechanisms, analyzing and providing guidance on search trending data, with a keen focus on data quality and completeness.  Amazon has a culture of data-driven decision-making and demands insights and recommendations that are timely, accurate, and actionable. At Amazon, you will be working in one of the largest and most complex data environments in the world. Though this position is embedded within the Search Data and Analytics team, you will work cross-functionality with economists, data engineers, business analysts, and other business intelligence engineers across the broader Amazon organization. The ideal candidate will: · Create and maintain the logic and processes to support trustworthy and efficient consumption of business data.  · Develop mechanisms to discover, monitor and improve data quality and completeness of Search Data.  · Investigate data sources across Amazon and expand existing search data infrastructure, identifying opportunities to expand our modeling and customer obsession efforts  · Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations that will help grow the search business internally and for partners worldwide  · Identify opportunities for developing new data sources and provide technical leadership around making those data sources high quality and broadly available  · Identify and partner with development teams to improve data quality.  · Develop a thorough understanding of customer behavior and external business drivers to inform decision making  · Analyze key insight trends and build models that predict customer behavior, using a balanced approach of statistical and business-focused methods Deliver automated metrics and KPI's into search QBR and MBR rhythms  · Represent Search Data with partners WW regarding business analytics, search performance related inquiries, and data delivery  tags: SearchData , #SearchDataJob

The candidate must enthusiastically embrace the quest for future revenue predictability, not only through data, trends, and analysis, but be able to communicate effectively with key Cypress team members around the globe to meld analysis with the input and assessment of business activity from Cypress geography (GEO) leaders and personnel. Name: Business Analyst – HW & SW Products
Description: What You'll DoThe Product Data Team (PDT) is part of the Supply Chain Product Operations /Innovation team. PDT plays a pivotal role managing product and service data for NPI offer enablement and lifecycle management. We are in transformation from focusing on data execution to proving valuable data management services to stakeholders. We are seeking talent who are passionate about data management to join us on this transformation journey.  You will be responsible for product offer enablement and lifecycle management, process optimization and transformation.  You will... Be responsible for delivering product configuration service to stakeholders and overseeing day to day PDT operationsManage PDT execution for NPI and sustaining offers, and ensure on-time service deliveryManage stakeholder relationships and be a trusted advisor to solve business problemsAnalyze effectiveness of operation process and identify areas needing improvementDrive operational process optimization and transformation for PDT configuration serviceWho You'll Work WithWorking in Product Data Team under Supply Chain Product Operation/Innovation team, you will work closely with stakeholders from the BUs, Supply Chain, and IT. You are the product configuration expert, providing operational expertise to cross-functional stakeholders to solve business problems.Who You AreStrong analytical skills and technical acumenCommunicates effectively with partners to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutionsAbility to build positive relationships with partnersResults driven and work orientedAbility to find opportunities for service improvement (optimization, automation, innovation)Excellent follow-through, flexible in a dynamic, changing environmentBA/BS with 5 + years of experience- preferred in Operations/IT Why CiscoAt Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.  Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Name: Sr. Business Analyst - end to end Sales Cycle
Description: Job DescriptionTHIS IS NOT IT SIDE BUSINESS ANALYST ROLE  THIS IS BUSINESS SIDE BUSINESS ANALYST ROLE.  NEED EXP WITH END TO END SALES CYCLE  The Senior Sales Business Process Analyst will directly drive efficiency, simplicity and intelligence to ServiceNow's sales processes and infrastructure to enhance business engagements. Partner closely with all major business functions across the sales deal lifecycle including sales, deal desk, sales operations, sales finance, order management, pricing, product management, invoicing, and revenue finance. Drive major cross-functional initiatives that are enabled through core CRM functionality. Responsibilities include functional expertise in the CRM, and other sales processes.  Essential Functions:  Partner with Sales, Business Operations, CRM, OTC, global business owners to address process improvement and drive efficiency  Take complete ownership of the business deliverables including any customizations and enhancements in the Sales CRM/CPQ areas. Reduce cycle time and improve through put and delivery of the IT development team  Ability to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT partners. Should be quickly able to understand and evaluate the challenges  Participate, influence and drive cross-functional projects that impact the Sales CRM processes.  Drive continuous process improvements and operational efficiencies across sales, primarily in CRM area. Also, drive Sales and Sales Operations initiatives in an effort to make the systems and processes more reliable, predictable and efficient  Good communication is a must. Dealing with business partner is very important aspect of this role.  Managing and coordination of the Regression and User acceptance testing with the users  Collaborate with key business stakeholders, IT, external partners and third-party software vendors to implement effective and resilient solutions  Able to juggle multiple projects & tasks and successfully prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interests  Proactively refine upstream solutions to avoid downstream business or IT process and data issues  Undertake post-implementation business support and troubleshoot and resolve systems issues working with the IT support team  Nice to have third party software experience related to CRM  Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills . Requirements: Requires 6-8 years of business operations experience of which at least 5 years mainly in CRM with a focus on gathering requirements, process improvements and solution design. Extensive experience as a business process analyst in the sales organization, with CRM as the core. Strong business partnership experience required, with proven track record of successfully driving cross-functional initiatives, enhancements and support issues. Exposure to a third party CRM (ie. Dynamics, SAP CRM, SFDC) is a must. Interested candidates submit your resume to preritas@abovoinc.com or call me at 669-231-0354.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Company OverviewAt Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to:Build and enhance our proven security platformBlend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architectureAnalyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intelCollaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challengesWe are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.The RoleThe Business Systems Analyst – Finance role will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, & documenting specifications & solutions for projects with focus on the ERP system. This position will also directly work with Global Accounting & Finance to respond to team inquiries on related Financial systems timely, troubleshoot financial system issues and analyze current business and financial practices. The Business Systems Analyst will act as a liaison between finance business groups and IT teams. This position requires a highly motivated individual with strong analytical skills, intellectual curiosity and excellent communication skills. The ability to work well in a dynamic environment, think creatively, work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously is required.Your day-to-dayResponsibilities include:ERP ResponsibilitiesDefine and document business processes, data maps, and consult with end users on requirements, functionality, & solutions; and specify system designs, data, workflow, & logical processes to meet organization objectives.Perform application configuration & management, customer relationship management, project coordination, and identify / evaluate / review innovative technologies for potential solutions; and will perform data extraction & analysis.Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from end-users and/or technical staff regarding application, system, & reporting issues, and train end-users and/or technical support staff on software applicationMust be able to identify, troubleshoot, solve, and manage systems problems under time constraints with minimal supervisionWill assist with providing end-to-end ERP systems support and functionalityWorks closely and collaboratively with the Accounting business groups (O2C, R2R, P2P) to solve business problems related to financial related systemsResponsible to work with 3rd party vendors to understand and resolve open system issues; work with vendors in upgrading cloud and on-premise systemsAssist users in modifying reports and parametersAdminister and support business applications: Concur, Ariett, Blackline, RevPro and other financial systems.What you bring to the teamQualificationsBA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.3+ years experience with Dynamics AX. Exposure to Dynamics 365 for Operation is required.Minimum 5 years of experience working with financial related applications and working with vendors/internal customers to resolve and respond to financial system issues and inquiries.Experience in multiple Finance functional areas (e.g. accounting, record-to-report, business intelligence, payroll, procure-to-pay, order-to-cash).Experience working with systems that handle sensitive data and with SOX controls and change management processesDatabase (Oracle, MSSQL) experience is required.Track record in working on cross-functional, team projects.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, strong analytical skills, and ability to deal with ambiguity in a rapidly changing business environment.Prioritize and manage projects.Develop cases and cost/benefit analysis for management evaluation.Oversee security policies and procedures to ensure compliance.Drive projects to completion, testing, and acceptance of project results.Preferred relevant work experience with ERP systems, Concur, Ariett, Blackline, RevPro and other financial systems,Ability to provide On-Call and After-Hours support.Why ProofpointAs a customer focused and driven-to-win organization with leading edge products, there are many exciting reasons to join the Proofpoint team. We believe in hiring the best the brightest and cultivating a culture of collaboration and appreciation. As we continue to grow and expand globally, we understand that hiring the right people and treating them well is key to our success! We are a multi-national company with locations in 10 countries, with each location contributing to Proofpoint’s amazing culture!#LI-JR1

Name: Scientific Data Analyst and Programmer
Description: Scientific Data Analyst and Programmer  Stanford University Duties and Responsibilities  The Scientific Data Analyst and Programmer responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Program and optimize pipelines for data quality control, imaging data preprocessing, and statistical and computational analyses pipelines for large-scale multimodal brain imaging data, including but not limited to resting state and task based fMRI, diffusion MRI, and volumetric data, behavioral data, and biological (e.g. hormonal, genetic data.Maintain detailed logs of work flow, generated codes and scripts, and documentation of processesCreate and manage best practices for data organization and workflow proceduresImplement publicly available processing and analyses pipelines such as the Human Connectome Project.Implement data visualization programs on neuroimaging, behavioral, and biological dataProcess and analyze neuroimaging, behavioral, and biological data working closely with other lab membersWork closely with lab members on data requests and system upgrades.Assist in the creation and maintenance of lab databases, query tools for data mining, coordination of data integration from multiple ongoing studies, and documentation of these tools.Train other lab members on quality control and preprocessing of neuroimaging data.Communicate and document all issues and concerns as they arise to PIs and other relevant research staff Required Qualifications B.A., B.S. required. Masters or PhD preferred with background in biomedical engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, computational neuroscience, quantitative psychology, or related subject.Salary will be commensurate with relevant experience and education.Strong programming skills and comfort with diverse computing environments (e.g. Matlab, Python, UNIX/BASH languages).Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting (e.g. R, Python).Experience with data visualization.Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization with careful attention to detail are absolutely required.High degree of motivation, organization, and selfŠ\sufficiency, although some training and supervision will be provided. Additional Qualifications Experience with databases (neuroimaging, biological, and behavioral) is an advantage.Experience with network analyses, machine learning and modeling confer a significant advantage.Familiarity with the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) is an advantage. Proficiency with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms (e.g. HCP Pipeline, FreeSurfer, SPM, FSL, AFNI, GIFT, TrackVis, CONN, etc.) is an advantage.  To view the full application and other opportunities, visit: https://med.stanford.edu/scsnl/faculty.html  Copyright ©2017 Jobelephant.com Inc. All rights reserved.  Posted by the FREE value-added recruitment advertising agency  jeid-ef41e3e4dffa9f47a0b0c07ba45ec84b

Name: Investments & Operations Analyst - Jemstep
Description: Investments & Operations Analyst - Jemstep(Job Number: 22259)DescriptionFinTech is a fast-paced, rapidly growing, and engaging space. Jemstep is a market-leading FinTech provider of digital advice solutions to investment advisory firms including banks, broker dealers, and independent advisors. Our Advisor Pro solution enables firms and their advisors to connect with investors digitally, delivering investment advice to help them achieve their financial goals. We are helping banks and financial advisors transform their business, making it more efficient for firms to serve their clients and onboard new ones. While most “robo” advice solutions in market have been designed to replace advisors, our solution is designed to help advisors by extending their reach and enriching their clients’ experience. We firmly stand behind our platform’s flexibility, ease of integration and adoption, and value in delivering measurable results with a full suite of technology solutions.  In this position, you’ll be joining a high-growth company brimming with intelligent people, optimism, collaboration, and passion for progress, with ties to Invesco, a globally recognized and established asset management firm with a long history of success. Invesco has presence in over 25 countries and Jemstep has offices throughout the United States, South Africa, and India. As we further our mission and expand our presence and position, we’re seeking individuals of demonstrable success, with energetic, motivating personalities to join our team. Job Purpose (Job Summary): Unique opportunity for an investment professional to transfer their skills and experience into a leading digital wealth management platform. In this role, you will help built and support Jemstep’s end-to-end investment solutions. This hands‐on and highly visible role will require a candidate who can thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment. We are seeking candidates who exhibit a strong desire to work in a startup environment and want to be part of the new wave of digital wealth management. Key Responsibilities / Duties:Under limited supervision the Investments & Operations Analysts will report directly into the Director of Investment Solutions and will be responsible for: The development, analysis, and ongoing support in all areas of wealth and investment management on the Jemstep Advisor Pro platform.Support of wealth and investment management process; ranging from initial client engagement and proposal through to client maintenance covering the following core functional areas: Client suitability and risk profilingCreation and maintenance of investment solutions (portfolio models)Investment policy proposal and statementsGoal-based investingTrading and rebalancingClient maintenance and supportProvide guidance, and support to the Jemstep Sales and Client Support teams during the initial client engagement through to product implementationOngoing involvement with existing clients to pursue additional investment opportunitiesExamine and assess the wealth management industry with key focus on factors related to scalable investment solutions within a robo/digital environmentQualificationsWork Experience / Knowledge:2-4 years revelant work experience.Prior experience working in financial services or retail bankingSkills / Other Personal Attributes Required:Robust knowledge and familiarity with common wealth management strategies and their relative strengths and weaknessesTech savvy, specifically the ability to navigate multiple complex systemsAbility to understand complex financial issues and general knowledge of financial and investment markets, regulation, and actors within advisory and investment servicesStrong written and verbal communication skillsCreative, with a breadth of interests, and an intrinsic initiative to learn new thingsAbility to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced environmentFormal Education: (minimum requirement to perform job duties) A Bachelor’s Degree.Working Conditions:Normal office environment with little exposure to noise, dust and temperatures.The ability to lift, carry or otherwise move objects of up to 10 pounds is also necessary.Normally works a regular schedule of hours, however hours may vary depending upon the project or assignment.FLSA (US Only): Exempt  The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.  Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.North America-United States-California-Los Altos-5150 El Camino Real

Name: Programmer Analyst/Business Process Analyst

In addition, this role will provide primary IT technical support with various database (Oracle and SQL Server) and interface tools (scripting and reporting...). General Skills & Abilities • Communications skills to define and document requirements • Excellent documentation skills • Willingness to document processes and procedures, enabler of turnover to production Desired Skills/Experience • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle database backup/restore processes and Microsoft SQL Server SSIS and SSRS. • Working experience of creating Oracle Packages/functions and Microsoft SQL Server stored procedures. • Experience supporting finance functions like Accounting, Budgeting or Forecasting functions. • Working knowledge of AS/400 operating system and Command Language • Experience with ASP.net programming • Experience working on interface development between finance/HR system (eP/NextGen) and Questica budget system • Experience with a public-sector agency - provided by DiceProgrammer Analyst/Business Process Analyst,Oracle and SQL Server,SQL Server SSIS and SSRS.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst - Payroll
Description: Job Description: That?s a cool job - I want it!  Ready to shake things up? Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and strive to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we?re committed to our work, customers, having fun, and most meaningfully to each other?s success. We continue to be on a tear while enjoying incredible growth year over year.  As a Senior Business Analyst at Splunk, you will help drive projects by implementing solutions to improve the company's finance processes and the business applications it builds and uses. You are an experienced Generalist and IT business analyst. You have the ability to work on a variety of different types of projects and business processes and have a background that demonstrates this ability. Splunk offers the chance to work with cutting-edge technology in a collaborative, exciting, and fast-paced environment. Responsibilities: + Partner with internal Finance/HR team in developing delivery roadmaps, defining business processes and associated system requirements.  + Analyze, design, build, test, implement, support, and enhance Workday modules including Payroll, Benefits and Time Tracking.  + Organize and manage project work to drive predictable delivery.  + Drive system implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification, and resolution).  + Architect innovative solutions to automate and scale business processes and systems.  + Serve as authoritative resource on standard methodologies and domain knowledge in the Payroll space (The US domestic and international).  + Deliver Solutions ? Implement global technologies and services to meet long term Payroll business needs; partner with development teams on system design and gap analysis, prioritization of critical initiatives and resources, and make v. buy evaluation  + Business Requirements - Coordinate the collection and documentation of global business needs and the documentation of system configuration and integration specifications, test plans, and use cases  + Implementation - Coordinate the rollout of new tools and systems including delivery of standard operating procedures, workflow diagrams, test and training materials and post-launch support resources  + Analysis - Analyzing and understanding large amounts of data and complex process and data flows to identify specific opportunities to implement seamless data flows  + Testing of configurations and system feeds to ensure data integrity  + Communication - Own communications to project members and partners on progress, issues, and risks including regular status updates and periodic white paper analysis; provide pre and post-launch communications to impacted teams  + Operational Excellence - Drive global Payroll process optimization and standardization while balancing the business need for flexibility and appropriate localization  + Measurement - Develop measures to define progress and success; establish ongoing reporting requirements and key performance indicators for confirming return on investment; maintain project budgets and forecasts Requirements: + Minimum of 10+ years of relevant work experience.  + Proven experience implementing and configuring vendor software and building custom Payroll applications through full system implementation life-cycles.  + Demonstrated experience in Payroll Processing that consists of Schwab Stocks, Benefits and other Deductions for Payroll Cycle.  + Experience with one or more Finance/HR Payroll functional areas (e.g. Netsuite, Workday, ADP).  + Hands-on experience in Workday Payroll Processing, Benefits, and ADP Processing.  + Proven experience in implementing or supporting Workday HRIS/Payroll System and thorough understanding of Workday related technologies for Integration with finance systems.  + Successful track record in working on cross-functional, cross-team projects.  + Good interpersonal and communication skills, strong analytical skills, and ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment.  + Ability to work across cross-functional groups and ensure ability to influence and execute across groups  + A passion for technology and an ability to identify new opportunities for efficiency and productivity Education: + BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience; MA/MS degree preferred  We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.  For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  About Splunk  Splunk was founded to pursue a disruptive new vision: make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Machine data is one of the fastest growing and most complex areas of big data?generated by every component of IT infrastructures, applications, mobile phone location data, website clickstreams, social data, sensors, RFID and much more.  Splunk is focused specifically on the challenges and opportunity of taking massive amounts of machine data, and providing powerful insights from that data. IT insights. Security insights. Business insights. It?s what we call Operational Intelligence.  Since shipping its software in 2006, Splunk now has over 13,000 customers in more than 110 countries around the world. These organizations are using Splunk to harness the power of their machine data to deepen business and customer understanding, mitigate cybersecurity risk, prevent fraud, improve service performance and reduce costs. Innovation is in our DNA ? from technology to the way we do business. Splunk is the platform for Operational Intelligence!  Splunk has more than 2,700 global employees, with headquarters in San Francisco, an office in San Jose, CA and regional headquarters in London and Hong Kong.  We?ve built a phenomenal foundation for success with a proven leadership team, highly passionate employees and unique patented software. We invite you to help us continue our drive to define a new industry and become part of an innovative, and disruptive software company.  Benefits & Perks: Wow! This is really cool!  SF Only  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO, sick leave, stocked micro kitchens in Splunk offices, catered lunches on Mondays, catered breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer, ?Fun Fridays?.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Non SF  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO and sick leave. Our work environments vary by location however we believe in hosting amenities and fun activities to fuel our energy. You may find fully stocked micro kitchens, catered lunches on Mondays and breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer and ?Fun Fridays?.  This isn?t a job ? it?s a life changer ? are you ready?  Individuals seeking employment at Splunk are considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition (except where physical fitness is a valid occupational qualification), genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws. Click here to review the US Department of Labor?s EEO is The Law notice. Please click here to review Splunk?s Affirmative Action Policy Statement.  Splunk does not discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Please click here to review Splunk?s Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.  Splunk is also committed to providing access to all individuals who are seeking information from our website. Any individual using assistive technology (such as a screen reader, Braille reader, etc.) who experiences difficulty accessing information on any part of Splunk?s website should send comments to accessiblecareers@splunk.com. Please include the nature of the accessibility problem and your e-mail or contact address. If the accessibility problem involves a particular page, the message should include the URL of that page.  Splunk doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with Splunk.  To check on your application click here.

Name: Lead IT Business Systems Analyst

You will have demonstrated technical, people, and project management experience in distributed development environments. Who we are Since 2006, 23andMe's mission has been to help people access, understand, and benefit from the human genome. We are a group of passionate individuals pushing the boundaries of what's possible to help turn genetic insight into better health and personal understanding. What you'll doGathering business requirements and process mappingAssisting with project scoping, planning, and schedulingWorking with cross-functional business teams and defining best practice business processesBeing a communication focal point providing coordination for Business Systems projectsAnticipating risks and mitigating them before they become seriousFacilitating cross-functional alignment and agreements around project issuesUnderstand system capabilities and business requirements, and drive standard & scalable solutionsIdentify opportunities to increase efficiency and productivity within the context of the overall business strategyDocument work using the required standards, methods and toolsBusiness Process Mapping and Fit gap analysisCreation of business process flows (as-is & to-be)What you'll bringBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline3+ years of experience in software project managementERP hands-on experience with NetSuite and other ERP systemsMultiple successful business system implementationsGood analytical skills, understanding of project lifecycles, and the ability to act in an entrepreneurial manner to ensure the software delivered matches the business communities' needsExcellent verbal and written communications skills with all levels of technical and business resourcesAbout Us 23andMe, Inc. is the leading consumer genetics and research company. More information is available at www.23andMe.com. At 23andMe we value a diverse, inclusive work force and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual's race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. 23andMe will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law. Name: Security Business Analyst - Identity & Access

Responsibilities include: Analysis to support specification, design, and development of Identity Access Management (IAM) solutions and Data Protection and Privacy software capabilities.Support our products, services, and systems to integrate with our Customer Identity and Access platform.Work closely with InfoSec, compliance, and other service owners responsible for establishing governance, policies, and requirements.Clearly articulate and document business requirements Who You'll Work WithWe drive solutions for Identity and Access and Data Protection and Privacy for applications and systems for Cisco customers, partners, suppliers, and employees. Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. We connect everything – people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more – from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities. Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco  *LI-BB

Name: Business Solution Analyst
Description: Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Name: IT Business Systems Analyst - HR (Contract)
Description: Requisition Number 18-0873  Post Date 11/12/2018  Title IT Business Systems Analyst - HR (Contract)  Location Corporate HQT  Job Status Per Diem  Work Hours 0  City San Jose  State CA  Description Satellite Healthcare is a successful, nonprofit organization that has improved the lives of people living with kidney disease since 1973. We earn our national reputation for excellent patient care each day by offering a complete range of dialysis therapy choices, personalized clinical services, and unparalleled wellness education.Satellite Healthcare provides expert, personalized kidney care at over 80 centers across the U.S. as well as at acute dialysis locations in California and Texas. Learn more about Satellite Healthcare at www.satellitehealth.com.The IT Business Systems Analyst understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends IT solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. This position interprets and transforms information based on business requirements and provides the data for delivery. It conducts detailed research of vendor products, assists with general project management and addresses enterprise application administrative tasks. The IT Business Systems Analyst is a liaison among enterprise applications business stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. This is done in conjunction with a strong understanding of the relevant technologies, at an application administration level.In addition, the IT Business Systems Analyst follows best practices and standardizes how work is managed and delivered. This includes regular status reporting, escalation of issues to business sponsors, and participation in driving the usability, efficiency and scalability of enterprise applications functionality.Essential Functions:The essential functions listed are not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. All employees must work in accordance with Satellite’s I-CARE Standards. Gather, analyze and document Satellite’s business and functional requirements from clinical staff, Operations and business users Analyze, document, and improve workflows, processes, and standards Understand business process management to elicit and gather customer business requirements and translate them to specific software requirements Communicate effectively with internal teams and external clients to deliver functional requirements including GUI, screen and interface designs Act as an experienced interface between business units, technology teams and support teams Provide technical guidance concerning business implications of application development projects Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions Manage client expectations effectively Lead work with Quality Assurance to build and validate test cases against all requirements Analyze application defects to determine if they fall within scope of project requirements Lead post-project analysis to reflect upon successes, failures, and lessons learned Facilitate SCRUM daily meetings Responsible for driving the Satellite Healthcare culture through values and customer service standards Accountable for outstanding customer service to all external and internal customers Develops and maintains effective relationships through effective and timely communication Takes initiative and action to respond, resolve and follow up regarding customer service issues with all customers in a timely manner  Requirements Minimum QualificationsAny combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.Education: Bachelor's degree in business information systems (IS), computer science or related fieldExperience:Five (5) years of IT and/or Business experience in a Business Systems Analysis role or experience working with internal clients and/or external agencies/partners Proven experience working with the core business teams of Finance, HR, Legal, Sales & Marketing Experience with HR, recruiting, onboarding processes/systems Hands-on experience developing/administering relevant packaged or custom-applications Experience administering Microsoft on premise enterprise applications such as MS Dynamics Great Plains and/or MS Dynamics CRM highly preferred Experience administering SaaS enterprise applications such as Ultipro HRIS highly preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:A blend of business, IT, financial and communication skills, as this is a highly visible position Well-versed in Microsoft Office applications Well-versed in SCRUM methodologies Understanding of various essential business functions of an organization Strong ability to facilitate process mapping activities and working knowledge of mapping techniques Strong understanding of Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures Strong understanding with how legacy and web-based system interfaces with each other Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; expertise in setting and managing customer expectations Ability to facilitate meetings and follow up with resulting action items Effective influencing and negotiating skills in an environment with contractors, resources administratively reporting to other managers, and third-party vendors Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence Proficient understanding of key technologies and processes – programming, database, operations, and platforms Able to read, write, speak, understand and satisfactorily communicate with others in English in person, over the phone and via email
