Name: - Senior GTM Business Analyst
Description: · What You'll Do: A strong business analysts to help us grow our $12+B service and support business, enabled by our Customer Lifecycle motions. Develop, design, and evolve our strategy, by analyzing new strategic GTM opportunities and drive projects that foster innovation within the Customer Experience organization and the Company as a whole. You’ll drive market and competitive assessments, screen strategic partnerships and potential acquisition targets and the market & business intelligence you develop will help Cisco identify new growth opportunities. You’ll learn a lot in this challenging role and, if successful, you’ll have opportunities to advance within the strategy organization or in a line management capacity elsewhere in the company. Who You'll Work With:  You'll regularly influence our CX Executive Leadership Team, enabling them to make effective and informed decisions. As a trusted advisor, you will need to synthesize your findings and provide valuable data backed insights for the leadership to act on. You'll be a key member on a high-performing, well-respected team who exists to help Cisco services, support and solutions grow profitably. We work hard and pride ourselves on the quality and speed of our deliverables. We take our work/responsibilities seriously but certainly have a lot of fun together. We share strong values: Learning, Integrity, Creativity and Courage. We think deeply and talk simply. We develop strong relationships across the business and we get things done! Who You Are A skilled analyst with an ability to lead, research, and provide insights on critical initiatives and issues. You have proven analytical and quantitative skills coupled with ability to run financial market modeling. You can convey the most complex concepts in the simplest of term. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and multi-cultural business environment and you can work with a range of sensitive and confidential issues.  At minimum, we require:o Expert knowledge of a technology organization’s services, customer success, sales, and BE functionso Go to Market experience in taking new offers and selling motions from ideation, to planning, to execution. o Experience with new monetization offers around software subscriptions, cloud, support, and Enterprise Licensing Agreements o 10+ years of related business experience in a corporate strategy capacity and/or with a management consulting firm. o Ability to work in a highly matrix organization o MBA in business, economics, finance Why Cisco We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.  We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.  We Are Cisco.

We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. In 2016, Gap Inc. was named one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign for the thirteenth consecutive year and was the sole winner of the Catalyst award for equality in the workplace in 2016.

Name: Business/Data Analyst - Winter Intern (January - April)
Description: Cloud computing is revolutionizing IT and forcing organizations to rethink their approach to cloud security. Lacework is at the forefront of this transformation. We enable security teams to effectively secure the public clouds AWS, Azure or Google by eliminating repetitive, manual and labor-intensive security tasks. Using Lacework, security teams operate security at the same pace as DevOps, which relies on automated tools to publish daily updates to the cloud.We are looking for a Data/Business Analyst who is excited about building an industry leading, next generation Cloud Security System. At Lacework, youll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment while getting a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help shape our technologies, products and business. If you are ready, we have some interesting engineering-challenges ready for you! :-) Have fun while you are solving them!!!During the 12-week internship, you'll be a full-time member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect our customers worldwide!Here's what you'll need to be successful:Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field, with demonstrated software engineering talent and a passion to help further our mission for education at scale.Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.Must have a legal right to work in the U. S. for the duration of the internship· Strong sense of ownership, customer obsession, and drive Comfortable to write code in at least one programming language.Familiarity with some programming language and business reporting tools.Bonus points if you have the following:Prior internship experience where you have demonstrated an ability to work in teams, problem solve and communicate effectively regarding technical projectsUse statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reportsUse data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a wholeCollecting and interpreting dataStrong sense of ownership, customer obsession, and driveSharp analytical abilities and proven design skillsExperience in data modeling and analysis, especially with distinctive data sourcesDemonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practicesDemonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environmentLacework is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of Lacework to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons, regardless of age, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, political affiliations, marital status, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, age, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, or on the basis of personal favoritism or other non-merit factors, except where otherwise provided by law.

Name: Junior Data Analyst (Contract)
Description: The RoleDo you want to explore massive, unruly data corpora from a variety of angles? Are you a strong believer in rigorous scientific methodology? Do you want to work on the boundary between application-focused research and academic pursuits?  Based as a remote employee in Germany or The Netherlands, a successful candidate should have some experience with collaborating in an international distributed team. You should have the right to work in the Netherlands (or Germany) under Dutch (or German) taxation and labour regulations.  As a junior data analyst in the Intelligent Systems group you will support the team of researchers and engineers by actively participating in structuring and analysis of data derived from both exploratory/observational studies and structured interventional studies. You will be responsible for data cleaning, report generation, dashboard development, and communication of experimental findings both internally and externally.You will learn about experimental design  and be involved in the reviewing of meaningful academic literature as it relates to ongoing research projects.Key Responsibilities include: Support the effective creation, management and use of their data to resolve product problems.Responsible for data quality, the improvement of data to meet the defined specifications and the analysis of data or the creation of statistics to support business delivery, development or change.Data pre-processing and filtering to reduce data messiness for downstream analysis.Visualising multivariate mixed-type data and reporting on aggregate properties of experimental payloads via custom-built dashboards.Collaborating on reporting strategy and dissemination of findings in an industry and academic context.Contribute to the preparation of scientific manuscripts for dissemination at international conferences and publication in academic peer- reviewed journals. Skills & Experience A degree in a relevant subject (computer science, mathematics / statistics) or experience in a comparable role (MSc preferred, BSc considered with substantial complementary work experience).Proficiency in using SQL.Strong quantitative analysis skills and keen analytical abilities, some experience with one or more statistical computing packages/environments (Matlab, Python, or R).You will have the ability to expertly perform data capture, creation and manipulation across a variety of specific data sets.Experience of delivering data extraction and manipulation based on defined requirements and be able to build, manage and utilise data.Methodical and systematic way of working.Excellent communication (written, oral, and presentation) in English; experience with formal scientific writing and publication in peer reviewed journals a plus.You may have experience of the following: Associate Data Analyst, Junior Data Analyst, Graduate Analyst, Data Analyst, Database, Data Administrator, Database Analyst, SQL, Microsoft Office, Excel, Access, Database Administrator, Geographic Information Systems, Data Modelling, DBA, Data Handling etc. The TeamThe Mozilla Intelligent Systems group performs fundamental and exploratory research into the nature of the World Wide Web and the interaction between people and web technologies.The CompanyMozilla is a global technology nonprofit super-powered by a worldwide group of volunteers, and with a mission to ensure the Internet is a global public resource open and accessible to all. We drive impact through our products, technology and people by advocating for individuals’ online lives and on their behalf for the health of the Internet. We are engineers, designers, makers, and problem solvers.  To be part of the team, we ask that you be technically curious, capable, always passionate about learning more, and excited to be moving the Mozilla mission forward.  Mozilla isn’t just a great place to work; it’s an experience you’ll carry with you throughout your career.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Level: NA1  #LI-RH1

Name: Analyst
Description: ANALYSTLocation: Palo Alto, CA /  Boston, MA Department: Deal Team Reports To: Managing  Director or Senior Managing Director Position  Summary Analysts  collaborate with Principals, Vice Presidents, and Associates to deliver on  various business and asset valuations as our Managing Directors work to expand  our investment portfolio. Some of these  responsibilities include on-site due diligence and analysis of industry  positioning. Essential  Responsibilities ·  Provide  full analytical support of new and on-going business deals, which includes due  diligence and data collection ensuring the accuracy and validity of supplied  information.  ·  Analyze  companies industry positioning and financial performance, including inventory  and operational performance.  ·  Evaluate  productivity, efficiency and profitability while developing a qualitative  understanding of the nuances that might affect asset values.  ·  Create  reports analyzing findings to review and present to management team.  ·  Assist  with researching the retail, consumer products, industrial and/or other market  sectors; proactively communicate to management important events and/or possible  business leads that may impact or generate deals.  ·  Help  maintain the internal deal database to ensure accurate and timely  contact/company information.  ·  Provide  additional analysis support as requested by management.  ·  Other  duties and projects as needed. Qualifications ·  Bachelors  degree with at least one year of related experience in a lending, financial,  banking, or consulting environment.  ·  Excellent  verbal and written communications skills.  ·  Proven  analytical, presentation and project skills are critical.  ·  Ability  and willingness to thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment handling  multiple projects at any given time.  ·  Comprehensive  understanding of financial statements is essential, including allocation of  overhead expenses. In addition, comprehensive  understanding of inventory and other asset accounting methodologies is  preferred.  ·  Demonstrated  advanced proficiency with computer applications in a PC Windows based  environment; experience with all MS applications is required.

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: SummarySummary The people here at Apple don’t just create products — we build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of our people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it.  The Worldwide Accessories team is a nimble group of professionals focused on rapidly growing the accessories business at Apple and building cross-functional competencies for continued success. We engage directly with Apple’s largest resellers worldwide to build deeper partnerships, accelerate sell-thru. We ensure Apple customers have access to the essential branded accessories they need to unlock the value of hero devices. To support this effort, we work closely with the sales, demand planning, operations, finance, legal, and marketing organizations worldwide. We define the holistic strategy, design unique offers and programs, develop essential channel assets, lead supply availability, and ensure the successful launch of new products.  You have the proven skills to design, build, model, and implement unique programs to drive demand.  Ability to summarize and communicate complex analyses to every type of audience.  Your extraordinary organization skills and ability to lead multiple projects at once makes you a master at multi-taking.  You are able to architect new cross-functional business processes to ensure timely results.  You are calm under pressure, have a sense of humor and flexible with a diverse set of personalities  You thrive with limited direction in an ambiguous work environment and enjoy the challenge it brings.  Does your natural curiosity to seek out and deliver on next level business insights drive you to solution that are unique?  Deep understanding of market trends and continued desire to learn more.  Expertise with Excel and Keynote; Tableau and BusinessObjects proficiency preferred.  Experience in the retail, telecommunications, or consumer electronics industries preferred.  Do you have a minimum of 5 years experience in business development, sales, category management, sales operations, sales finance, strategy consulting, or related fields?  Do you enjoy puzzles, problem solving and thinking beyond an obvious solution? Do you thrive in ambiguity and teams where little direction should fuel your creativity? If these two questions get you energized then the Channel Offers Analyst maybe a role that is up your alley. This talented individual will be comfortable working in a dynamic environment. We often pursue ambiguous objectives, and quickly execute analyses and defend key take-aways to senior executives. In this role, you will also develop expertise in Apple reporting systems, demonstrate technical skills to build robust reporting and analysis tools to guide tactical sales actions. Additionally, the Analyst should be ambitious, while enthusiastically pursuing new and unique projects as the team grows and evolves.  Our Offers Analyst plays a significant role in identifying, modeling, summarizing, and tracking sales opportunities in support of our worldwide partners. You will use detailed analysis and a strong foundation in sales data, to guide global sales strategies and design demand generation programs. These programs will be executed at scale. As an Offers Analyst, you will actively identify incremental sales opportunities and track regional execution and overall performance on a weekly basis. Education & Experience A Bachelor’s Degree is required, with a preference for degrees that are more focused on analysis such as Accounting, Engineering, Business or Economics Additional Requirements Proficiency with Excel, Tableau or other visual reporting tool

Name: Operations Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Operations Business Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day production operations in the area of Enterprise Business Analytics, including tasks related to identifying and troubleshooting application issues. Identify and document root cause analysis and effectively communicate with all internal stakeholders. Ensure all production changes are made in accordance with NetApp software development processes. Responsible for completing Monthly/Quarterly system audits for SOX compliance. Responsible for daily data refreshes by ensuring on-time data extractions from various internal source systems. Supports key business events – Monthly/Quarterly Sales Booking & Finance close which is key for external reporting. Lead recon efforts in case of any data discrepancies with source systems. Attend daily change management meeting to represent on-going production releases in Analytics area. Lead cross-functional teams to address business or systems related issues. This role will interact with BRMs, Development teams, MSPs and IT Management on a day to day basis. Name: Business and CRM Analyst
Description: Reporting to the head of business intelligence for IS&S Payments & Commerce, this person will be responsible for marketing effectiveness and CRM analytics for the multi-billion dollar App Store & iTunes Gift Card and Gift Code business worldwide. We are seeking an exceptional data analyst to play an integral role in helping the business make decisions using data. You will partner with key stakeholders across he business teams as you design, refine, and create deep analytical investigations and innovative reporting solutions. This will include leveraging large and complex data sources, deriving actionable insights, delivering dynamic and intuitive decision tools, and bringing our data to life via amazing visualizations. The ideal candidate is a self-motived team player, skilled in a broad set of analytical tools, with a strong passion for data and effective visualization techniques. Ability to adapt and learn quickly, provide results with limited direction, and communicate complex results effectively is a must. In this role you will conduct deep topical analysis on a broad range of strategic and tactical questions related to CRM activities related to customer acquisition, lifecycle, and retention. You have a strong passion for empirical research and answering hard questions with data; the demonstrated ability to conceptualize, promote and implement new ideas for the business. You are a analytics professional with 5+ years of experience in marketing analytics and end-to-end measurement programs for customer acquisition and retention efforts. Have strong writing, data visualization and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to senior executives. Experience with Tableau is highly desirable. Capable of clearly communicating complex analyses to a non-technical audience Have a strong passion for conceptualizing, documenting and deploying complex analytical plans to solve business problems with minimal guidance. You are a self-starter, driven, accountable and a highly spirited team player. Strong knowledge of either SAS, R, or Python SQL mastery for data access, manipulation, and validation Experience working with large data sets Comfortable learning new technologies and working in a fast-paced environment Ideal candidates are proficient in Base SAS, SAS STAT & SAS Macros and you have working knowledge of SAS - Enterprise Guide/Miner. R/Python within Spark/Hadoop clusters highly preferred. - You have strong working knowledge of database structures and data warehousing principles and have solid experience in SQL with the ability to ETL both structured and unstructured data from various sources; experience with Teradata highly preferred. Candidates with a background in payments are also highly preferred •Conceive and design end to end optimized data platforms and customer analytics to support key business decisions on marketing performance and CRM activities. •Conducting regular and ad-hoc analyses, data mining and predictive analytics to provide leadership with actionable insights at tactical and strategic levels related to the active customer and product type user base •Manage analytic projects through all phases, including data quality, data modeling, statistical analysis, data visualization and presentation of results and deliverables. •Design and develop highly polished and functional Tableau dashboards to support constructs such as churn/re-emergence, purchase cycle, behavioral change propensity and customer lifetime value •Quickly outline and build customized analyses for leadership •Partner with cross-functional teams to identify, frame, prioritize, and answer business questions where analytics can drive impact •Perform all aspects of analysis including data acquisition and manipulation, programming, data visualization, documentation, and presentation of results •Develop a deep understanding of our customer base and purchase/top-up choices •Contribute to the development of tools to improve team efficiency and productivity","educationAndExperience":"Minimum of bachelor’s degree, preferably in economics, statistics, computer science, or related quantitative field. Advanced degree in Applied Econometrics, Statistics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Analytics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or related field preferred.Minimum of bachelor’s degree, preferably in economics, statistics, computer science, or related quantitative field. Advanced degree in Applied Econometrics, Statistics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Analytics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Industrial

Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: 28800 Ida St Valley Nebraska 68064-8016Why Valmont Welcome to Valmont, where a world of opportunity awaits. When you join our team, you become part of a passionate group dedicated to changing lives and conserving resources around the globe. We want problem solvers who roll up their sleeves to foster progress and innovation for all people. At Valmont, we provide infrastructure, irrigation, tubing and coatings to the world. We strengthen cities. We nourish croplands. We design, manufacture and coat. Our products and services make a difference. Join us, and BUILD YOUR WORLD.A Brief Summary of This Position: Valmont is currently seeking a highly motivated and talented individual for the Business Planning Analyst position in the North America Operations organization. In this individual contributor position you will apply Master Scheduling, production planning and analytics to achieve the most efficient and economical value to the Sales & Operations Planning functionality for Valmont North America. Essential Functions: Multi-site production planning & optimization:  · Effectively manage projects relating to the optimization of production capacity and footprint across multiple sites in North America in an engineer-to-order environment.  · Define and develop S&OP performance metrics for measurement, comparison, or evaluation of Supply Chain factors, and provide ongoing analysis in areas such as production planning, inventory levels, material planning optimization, Inventory and logistics planning.  · Develop, maintain and review metrics aligned to ensure Sales & Operations Plan execution is on target.  · Identify, negotiate and resolve conflicts with respect to material and capacity availability as well as order-promising and integrity.  · Communicate long-term planning demands to stakeholders across the NA Operations network.  · Demonstrate full knowledge of the product lines and ERP systems, and serve as a technical leader for assigned systems and/or service development, ability to educate and train end-users to a technology-driven Supply Chain.  · Evaluate order expedite requests and coordinate with site level production control teams to fulfill customer requests.  · Assist with development of projects plans to meet deadlines for major initiatives, drive various groups and cross-functional projects to promote smooth implementation of initiatives.  Analytics of Sales & Operations Planning processes:  · Translate business requirements into the design and development of data models and reports, identify trends, and ensure accuracy and readiness of data.  · Use analytics to optimize the demand and supply balance, determining out-of-balance conditions, identifying alternatives, and recommending actions for mitigation.  · Conduct regular cadence of data gathering, aggregation and analysis required to formulate Sales & Operations Plan.  · Collaborate with appropriate teams to forecast demand, establish forecasting procedures, models and quotas to identify changes and trends, and to create supply plans to optimize service levels and maintain Supply Chain System efficiency.  · Validate data in various databases to ensure accuracy and consistency, identify root causes of data inconsistency, and implement corrective action plans to meet business requirements. Other Important Details about the Role: · Support business functions, working with functional leaders and providing periodical and ad-hoc analyses and reports as required.  · Execute project management disciplines to ensure projects and tasks completed on time and within budget, and business requirements delivered.  · Demonstrate strong production planning and scheduling skills.  · Assist site production control teams on implementation of Valmont and Industry best practices.  · Abides by all policies and procedures of Valmont Industries, Inc. Required Qualifications of Every Candidate (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities): · Preferred Bachelors with 6+ years relevant experience or Associates Degree with 8+ years relevant experience or 10+ years of relevant experience  · Experience with production planning and Master Scheduling techniques  · Strong understanding of Supply Chain principles, practices, and procedures in manufacturing environment  · Advanced Microsoft Suite software skills, especially Excel modeling, Excel data analysis  · Knowledge of business intelligence and/or analytical/statistical software: Oracle, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI  · Working knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning ERP software  · Strong understanding of project management principles.  · Ability to work independently  · Passion and integrity who has the drive to excel and deliver exceptional results Highly Qualified Candidates Will Also Possess These Qualifications: · Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Supply Chain management, or Operations  · American Production and Inventory Control Society APICS certificate desired: CPIM and/or CSCP certificate  · Strong leadership skills and the ability to support divisional business objectives Working Environment and Physical Efforts: Work is typically performed in an office setting. The incumbent is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as talk and listen on the phone and in personal conversations or meetings. Environment is fast paced and demanding most of the time. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms while working in the office with various files and forms and while working on the computer. The employee is occasionally required to move about the office. Incumbent must utilize proper ergonomic safeguards such as monitor height and positions, keyboard location and height and proper wrists rests. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds in working with large files, binders, and computer equipment. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.  Valmont does not discriminate against any employee or applicant in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  If you have a disability and require any assistance in filling out the application for employment, call (402) 963-1115 or email EEOCompliance@Valmont.com.

Name: Staff Business Analyst
Description: Job ID  Requisition Id:- 14167 Job Description We are looking for an analytical supply chain individual to join our operations team. The ideal candidate will have a high level of independent judgment, acute business acumen, an incredible attention to detail and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment both in a team setting and autonomously. The primary responsibility of this role is to analyze, plan and implement supply chain optimization strategies to minimize cost while also providing world-class customer support for a portion of the Cypress product portfolio. To successfully perform this responsibility, the individual will consistently be evaluating and improvement of supply chain processes, managing financial and customer support metrics, and interacting with internal and external members of the global manufacturing teams. The individual will be deeply involved with the all steps of the semiconductor supply chain, including the wafer FAB, subcontractors, and back end manufacturing teams. In this role, the individual will receive general supervision from their direct manager and will frequently interact with upper levels of management.  DECISION MAKING: Supply planning with a mentality of perfect delivery at minimal cost. Prioritize tasks consistent with meeting overall supply management organizational goals.  PROBLEM SOLVING: Apply appropriate benchmarks, financial analysis, and risk management techniques to solve complex issues. Ability to influence diverse group of people to achieve solutions beneficial for Cypress. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Cypress Semiconductors employees or any other company location. Cypress Semiconductor is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Name: Sr. Finance Business Systems Analyst
Description: Who We Are: Malwarebytes is the next-gen cybersecurity company that millions worldwide trust. Malwarebytes proactively protects people and businesses against dangerous threats such as malware, ransomware, and exploits that escape detection by traditional antivirus solutions. The company's flagship product combines advanced heuristic threat detection with signatureless technologies to detect and stop a cyberattack before damage occurs. More than 10,000 businesses worldwide use, trust, and recommend Malwarebytes. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in California, with offices in Europe and Asia, and a global team of threat researchers and security experts.  We've created a fantastic culture that our employees love and were recently named in the top 10 of Fortune Magazine's Great Place to Work list. We're pretty proud of all that too. We're growing fast and are looking for some great people to join us. Who We Need: As Malwarebytes continues to expand the product and client base, The Information technology group is absolutely vital in building business applications that fuel the Organization's growth. To support such growth, we are looking for an energetic Senior Finance Business Analyst/Developer to join our team.  As a Senior Finance Business Analyst/Developer, you will be an integral member of the CIO team working with peers (internal and external) to develop and maintain Financial systems and will work closely with the business stakeholders to ensure our technology aligns with their requirements and will support the growth of the organization. What You'll Do: Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage the NetSuite and other finance applications  Participate in technical design sessions; develop detailed technical solution documentation and recommend suitable architecture that is aligned with business objectives  Develop, test, and document working custom development, integrations, and data migration elements of a NetSuite and other financial systems implementation  Bring your industry expertise (P2P,R2R, O2C) and ideas to help solve problems in innovative ways  Execute test plans to ensure a quality solution is delivered  Participate in code reviews for ongoing projects to ensure that code quality is at the highest level possible and appropriate design patterns are being used  Provide detailed estimates and work breakdown structure for assigned tasks  Lead two to three developers and produce much needed project deliverables Skills You'll Need to Have: Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent.  Six to 8 years of Procure to Pay (P2P), Record to Report (R2R) and Finance analytics experience is must  Minimum 6 years of ERP platform (Oracle EBS, NetSuite, Microsoft Dynamics) development experience is must  Manage all Financial system projects, by working closely with the Finance and Accounting teams to identify project requirements, work with our internal IT and external consultants on implementation and ensure projects are successfully completed on time.  Lead the testing efforts for all system updates including analyzing updates to determine impacts and then coordinating and managing testing  Review financial and accounting processes to identify areas for improvement and then work with the Finance and Accounting teams to address these pain points from both a system and process standpoint  Manage and support 3rd party applications/integrations such as Avalara, Nexonia, Adaptive Insights and internal Business Intelligence systems  Work with the team to build and maintain dashboards and other reporting  Provides assistance to internal employees by troubleshooting and quickly resolving issues with the Financial systems  Background in development of enterprise systems as part of a complete software product lifecycle  Led the team of onsite and offshore resources to deliver solutions  Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies such as Scrum  Effective communicator that works well in a collaborative team setting  NetSuite experience is preferred  Knowledge of Order to Cash process and Salesforce is a plus  Nice. Fun. Happy. (we have a firewall keeping mean, boring and angry people out) What We Offer: An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the world  A great work environment that supports growth and development  Competitive compensation and benefit packages  401(k) matching program  Open time off policy  Stocked kitchen with healthy (and some unhealthy) drinks, snacks, fruit and lunch options  A company who enjoys having fun; holiday and summer parties, and lots of other great stuff!

Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The Lead Business Analyst acts as a facilitator and liaison across functional teams and ANSYS IT for all aspects of the development of functional roadmaps that include People, Process and Technology changes. This role aligns strategic goals and objectives with decisions regarding the alignment of capabilities and corresponding investments in key initiatives. The role will partner with the PMO, Application and Functional teams to drive the development of initiative roadmaps. The primary focus is the business motivations, business operations and business analysis frameworks that link these aspects of an enterprise together. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain strong partnerships with key business stakeholders and team members.Develop business architecture strategy based on understanding of business strategies and business value of key initiatives.Apply a structured business architectural approach and methodology for capturing key initiatives for the enterprise.Capture enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide governance in terms of progress toward goals.Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities and functional units and the decomposition of those functions into subunits.Assist with quantifying business benefit and pre-project business solution design.Identify functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies that may exist in role alignment, process gaps and overlaps and business capability maturity gaps.Conduct business process modeling and document AS-IS and TO-BE models.Responsible for discovering, gathering, documenting, and vetting high level business and functional requirements for new projects and processes to assess impacts across the enterprise.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degreeMinimum 10 years of experience in Business Analysis, Business Process and/or ITMinimum 10 years developing Functional Specifications, Process Flows and Use CasesMinimum 10 years of experience conducting requirement analysis, solving business problems, assessing technical capabilities, and documenting solutionsPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSound analytical and problem solving skillsStrong ability to think strategically across the enterpriseBusiness Architecture experience preferredPortfolio Management experience a plusStrong presentation and communication skills which will include organizing meetings with varied participants from multiple functions across the businessMinimal travelCULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company: Customer focusResults and AccountabilityInnovationTransparency and IntegrityMasteryInclusivenessSense of urgencyCollaboration and Teamwork ANSYS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: Risk Control Technical Consultant, National Insurance
Description: Launch your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance- A Fortune 100 Company!We are searching for a Risk Control Consultant to join one of our clients dedicated team in the San Francisco Bay area. This position may be work from home, due to the dedicated aspect of the account, but does require the majority of each workday at various customer locations. In this role, you will work shoulder-to-shoulder with our client's Risk Management and Health & Safety teams to identify, quantify, and reduce/eliminate safety hazards. Our clients dedicated team takes pride in its reputation for responsiveness and proven track record for pro-actively identifying opportunities for impact, and for developing solutions that have proven time and again our value in mitigating loss for this high-profile customer. The right candidate for this role will bring strong relationship-building skills, acute customer focus, and a passion for quality execution as well as the requisite technical skills and experience.  Please Note: This position is eligible to be hired at differed levels depending on experience.  Responsibilities: Work with our clients Management and employees to provide comprehensive and highly-sophisticated risk control consultative services.Conduct on-site evaluations, evaluate data, and creates/implements service plans to control customer's source of risk, losses and costs.Provide risk assessment services and information to track progress and demonstrate the value of doing business with Liberty Mutual.Due to our clients operating schedule, position requires occasional early morning/late evening appointments and overnight travel to various locations.Overnight travel varies and is dependent upon customer need, but may be up to 25% of the time.Primary service territory includes Oakland, San Francisco, San Jose, and special project work in other states.Travel is mainly in the San Francisco Bay area, but may mainly require traveling throughout California on a limited basis. Key Capabilities and Characteristics: Has a strong focus on the customer, exceeding their expectationsWorks with a sense of urgency to address customer requests or problemsAble to adapt to changing priorities and to juggle competing prioritiesHandles customer feedback constructively without getting defensiveDemonstrates personal energy and staminaCapacity to become trusted advisor and partner to clientQualifications: Required: Bachelor's degree or equivalent with coursework in math, engineering or related areas (or equivalent).Required: Advanced knowledge, skills and experience in service planning and delivery, risk assessment, risk analysis, solutions management and progress measurement.Preferred: Risk control consulting experience in the field of transportation.Required: Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills to develop and maintain relationships with customers, peers, and industry contacts; the ability to interact and influence change within all levels of an organization, especially business executives; a strong team orientation; and commitment to continuous improvement.Required: Functional knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.)Required: Demonstrated ability to retrieve and enter information using various proprietary software applications and create/modify documents and complex spreadsheets using Microsoft Office suite.Required: At least 8 years of directly related consulting experience in risk control or progressive safety/heath field.Preferred: Candidates are typically working towards (or obtained) an advanced degree and/or professional certification in one or more of the following areas: CSP, ARM, CRM, CPCU, CIH, or CPE.Benefits:We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, its our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview:At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.Were dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.Job: Risk Control Primary Location: United States-California-San Jose Schedule: Full-time Salary: $102,500-$131,500 Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years) Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time

Name: Co-op: NPI Business Analyst
Description: Co-op Student Position: Winter Term (January to Apr 2019)Req Title – NPI Business Analyst Co-op Number of Positions: 1This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-op or internship program at a U.S. University. Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.OverviewAs a Business Analyst Co op for Nokia you will develop creative solutions for real business challenges. You will collaborate on internal and external projects to identify areas for improvement. You will observe, analyze and document these processes, workflows, issues and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities. Ultimately you will improve how our organization and business operates to help better support and service our Customer.We are a world class and diverse company and as a result you will find a diverse group of people tackling business issues. We work with cross functional teams to create new business models and process improvements. As a Co-op you will work industry professionals, learn and benefit from their experience, exposure and mentorship but yet we will value your ideas and perspective. This is culture of Nokia, one you will cherish being part of.Desired SkillsYou are a working towards a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business, Management, Finance, or Information Systems or a related field from an accredited institution.You have a minimum of a 3.0 GPA or equivalentYou have excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skillsYou possess a high level of customer focus and service excellence as you seek practical solutionsYou have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and cross-functional teamsYou have superb social skills, “can do” attitude and team player in global environmentYou possess effective time-management skills and the ability to prioritize work assignmentsWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: CW Business Data Analyst

Essential Job Functions:  Use a combination of tools such Hive or SQL, SAS/R/Python/Excel to run analysis and provide data-driven insights on our data and third-party data for marketing targeting, channel optimization, E2E funnel conversion, customer segmentation, sales forecast, etc. Own the process of designing and building metrics and KPI to track and monitor marketing efficiency and report data with visualization tools such as Tableau for business partners and senior leadership Design and run A/B testing with creative methodologies to help the marketing and design teams test and learn to increase our online channel traffic Work with marketing team to build leads nurture strategies for financing products and re-engage the existing base in a smart way Support statistical modeling efforts to understand our customers cash flow, behavior and preference which helps build customer tailored marketing strategy and predict the right point of needs for our financing products Provide ad-hoc analytics work to help strategic decision making throughout the whole teamREQUIREMENTS: BS/BA degree in Economics, Math, Statistics, or other related quantitative field; Advanced degree in quantitative field is preferred Strong understanding of how the business works is imperative to success in this position 2-5 year working experience as a data analyst role; Marketing analytics experience is strongly preferred Work experience with Tableau or other visualization software Significant work experience with analytics products such as Python, R, SAS, Excel or other similar ones; Big data related knowledge is a plus Strong statistic background with applied modeling skill is a plus Strong logical HIVE/SQL query skills and familiar with different database products and data structures An analytical mindset to dive into data and derive insight to drive business impact Confidence in taking ownership and passion in driving changes in a fast-paced working environment Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Business Analyst - Jemstep
Description: Business Analyst - Jemstep(Job Number: 21743)DescriptionAbout Jemstep FinTech is a fast-paced, rapidly growing, and engaging space. Jemstep is a market-leading FinTech provider of digital advice solutions to investment advisory firms including banks, broker dealers, and independent advisors. Our Advisor Pro solution enables firms and their advisors to connect with investors digitally, delivering investment advice to help them achieve their financial goals. We are helping banks and financial advisors transform their business, making it more efficient for firms to serve their clients and onboard new ones.  While most “robo” advice solutions in market have been designed to replace advisors, our solution is designed to help advisors by extending their reach and enriching their clients’ experience. We firmly stand behind our platform’s flexibility, ease of integration and adoption, and value in delivering measurable results with a full suite of technology solutions.  In this position, you’ll be joining a high-growth company brimming with intelligent people, optimism, collaboration, and passion for progress, with ties to Invesco, a globally recognized and established asset management firm with a long history of success. Invesco has presence in over 25 countries and Jemstep has offices throughout the United States, South Africa, and India. As we further our mission and expand our presence and position, we’re seeking individuals of demonstrable success, with energetic, motivating personalities to join our team. Job Summary The Business Analyst will be an integral part of the Customer Success and Implementation team dedicated to understanding clients’ strategy for digital investment products and how the Jemstep Advisor Pro Service should be configured to meet their objectives. The position will play an integral role in the product onboarding and development cycle for clients positioning them for successful growth in assets under management while maintaining a superior customer experience. The position entails research and documentation work pertaining to clients’ product development business requirements, translating the requirements into development documentation tasks, and testing and validating development success in meeting the requirements.  This position will also be required to consult with senior analysts, product managers, developers, and implementation consultants in the organization for guidance where applicable. Key Responsibilities/DutiesEvaluate clients' business processes for digital investment product solutions.Identify business requirements and then translate and document into development requirements.Conduct meetings and presentations.Lead reviews of requirements and designs with relevant stakeholders to obtain agreement and sign off.Manage information obtained in meetings and rapidly produce documentation as required to maintain project schedule and activities.Use background knowledge and experience to conduct complex data analysis.Attend internal and client meetings and document and communicate the results of research, analysis and meeting outcomes.Support management by preparing client presentation materials and supporting or leading meetings.Develop and perform user acceptance testing.QualificationsWork Experience •Minimum 3+ years’ financial services experience as a business analyst  •Ideally, will have worked on multi-discipline technology integration projects and/or phases of projects with teams of up to 8+ people and of a minimum length of 9+ months  •Experience in writing business requirements for a SaaS company.  •Sound knowledge of financial technology ecosystem in the Bank/IBD environment is a plus  •Ideally, will have had experience of negotiating with external parties / strategic partners  •Proficient user of the Microsoft suite of products, including Project and Office and other project management tools such as Wrike Skills •Excellent listening and written communication skills (to include process flowcharting and development of formal business solutions documents)  •Strong verbal communication skills, including presentation skills  •Able to influence and build relationships at all levels internally and externally  •Strong customer focused attitude  •Strong experience of negotiation, influencing and conflict management  •Team player  •Creative problem solver - able to challenge and propose solutions which challenge the status quo  •Structured, disciplined approach to work and strong attention to detail  •Strong time management, organizational and planning skills  •Able to multi-task and work independently under pressure to meet tight deadlines while remaining professional and courteous  •Proven self-starter  •Flexible, able to meet changing requirements and priorities  •Proven ability to work in a global, multicultural environment  •Flexibility and willingness to travel domestically and internationally when required by demands of projects Education (minimum requirement to perform job duties) •A Bachelor’s Degree, Graduate, or equivalent qualification is preferred  •Formal project management training (i.e. Six Sigma, CBAP, PMI, PMP certificate) a plus Working ConditionsNormal office environment with little exposure to noise, dust and temperatures.The ability to lift, carry or otherwise move objects of up to 10 pounds is also necessary.  •Normally works a regular schedule of hours, however hours may vary depending upon the project or assignment.  •Ability to travel 20% FLSA (US Only): Exempt  The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The job holder may be required to perform other duties as deemed appropriate by their manager from time to time.  Invesco's culture of inclusivity and its commitment to diversity in the workplace are demonstrated through our people practices. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, or veteran status. Our equal opportunity employment efforts comply with all applicable U.S. state and federal laws governing non-discrimination in employment.  #LI-MD1North America-United States-California-Los Altos-5150 El Camino Real

Name: Business Analyst Data, Mobility Business Group
Description: Job Overview: As a Business Analyst, you will be involved in Ford's initiatives to create innovative, data-driven products that drive revenue for Ford. In this role you will support strategic planning, market research, competitive analysis and benchmarketing, data product creation, and business and financial model formulation. Data products include, but are not limited to APIs, data marketplaces, algorithms, tools, services, and capabilities that generate revenue from data.  You will partner with the in-region Ford Smart Mobility strategy teams and business units to understand the market fit for the solutions that we are defining, andto develop business and marketing requirements for the solutions.You'll work closely with the product owners/managers on the high-level product strategy and competitive analysis, support product feature prioritization, and support product launches with in-market pricing, bundling, and launch strategies.You'll support the partnership team and business units across Ford as required with data partner contract negotiation and pricing, risk evaluation and modeling, and data availability assessment.  The successful candidate will also be charged with conducting market analysis, developing demand generation programs, assisting with go-to-market strategies, selling, working alongside the regional marketing leads to reach the target audience for each product, and generating increase in revenue and market share. Responsibilities include:Support and conduct market and competitive research on data products to justify recommendations for new strategies, roadmaps, and data products.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify new data product opportunities.Manage, understand, and create business analysis tools and techniques (i.e. business models, pricing models, user story mapping, process maps, rules matrices, mockups etc.).Develop business requirements, understand impacts and identify potential issues across various processes, departments, products and lines of business.Conduct research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the company.Spot new technology trends, data monetization trends, and identify white-space opportunities for data products and initiativesSupport product marketing managers and product owners with the day-to-day cadence of project governance, project delivery dates and milestones, business plan reviews.Help resolve bottlenecks for teams by following-up on open issues with stakeholdersAnticipate future needs based on existing technology roadmaps for both vehicle hardware and software architecture.Lead budget development, forecasts, and project needs across initiatives, including the development of pricing and cost models.Ability to travel 25% of timeBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, or related field5+ years of experience doing marketing research, competitive analysis and using data to facilitate business decisions; high growth, technology management consulting, or business intelligence background preferred3+ years of experience with business and technical requirements analysis, hypotheses modeling, and methodology developmentPreferred Qualifications:Master's degree in Data Science, Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or Econometrics5+ years of experience working laterally across multiple business projects simultaneously3+ years hands on experience in working with large amounts of data3-5 years of experience with digital data services and business models across multiple industries3-5 years of experience supporting the development of data products to gauge addressable demand by business service typeAbility to work across multiple tasks simultaneously; strong attention to detail and delivery track recordAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment while managing the expectations of stakeholdersStrong quantitative, financial, and business modeling skillsExperience with methods and tasks to strengthen application of data, analytics, and processes for business opportunity evaluationStrong research and analytic background, which can include consulting in related industries, or similar professional experienceTechnical skills should include a combination of: data science or data pipeline management, business model development, gathering and use of vehicle-level or customer-level data, information design/visualization, and translating technical solutions to business or data productsAbility to understand and advance analysis of complex needs for the integration of services relevant to the business and various business domain areasBias for action: identifies and acts on both short- and long-term goals in achieving resultsComfortable with ambiguity: remains focused in spite of unexpected challenges; continues to seek a path forwardStrong aptitude for critical thinking and analysis: able to translate strategic plans into executable actionsProven experience in developing business and financial models across a variety of industry sectors, particularly high tech and other digital services. The distance between imagination and ... creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. When you join the Ford team discover all the benefits, rewards and development opportunities you'd expect from a diverse global leader. You'll become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products - and it is always ready to go further.  Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: VMware will not sponsor a visa for this role.Job Description Senior Business System Analyst, IT Services  VMware-USA, Palo Alto, CA  Business Summary:VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility. Built on VMware's industry-leading virtualization technology, our solutions deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more safely consuming any application.  With 2015 revenues of $6.6 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, more than 75,000 partners, and 19,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff you've always dreamed about? Dare to explore at careers.vmware.com.  Job Role and Responsibility:Senior Business Systems Analyst (BSA) acts as liaison between IT and business functions, to help build solutions that facilitate VMware operate more effectively and efficiently. Solution focus areas include supporting LMS features and understanding the peripheral systems that drive LMS functionalities. Knowledge of finance and payments is a plus  .Candidate will drive the identification, implementation, and modification of business systems to meet user needs and comply with company standards and guidelines. Waterfall, AgileDesired Skills:7+ years experience of successful software project implementations with at least 3+ years related to LMSLMS applications specific experience required, eg Saba.Knowledge of payment and finance domain a plusKnowledge of business process areas of GTM a plusPossess strong technical background, analytical, and problem-solving skillsAbility to be able to lead multiple priorities and complex tasks in a dynamic work environmentMust possess strong communication and interpersonal skillsExperience in hands on design, prototyping, development, configurations, testing and other implementation activitiesExperience performing detailed gap analysis, and preparing as-is & to-be process documentationExperience preparing end-user documentation and conducting end-user trainingExperience leading distributed teams to design architecture and requirements for and lead development of packaged and integrated solutionsAbility to work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation and may require collaboration across multiple functional/technical teamsAbility to communicate in a clear and concise professional manner, tailored to the appropriate audience; including both verbal and written communications.Independent self-motivated ability to learn on the jobBusiness Analysis experience in a high-tech (preferable software) company highly desirable.4-year Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business management or related discipline.
