Name: CRM Business Analyst
Description: WE are Self-starters, WE are Passionate, WE are Relationship builders, WE are Innovative, WE are Nimble, and WE are Transparent…WE are SPRINTers! We believe in challenging you, then providing you the room and flexibility to deliver.  EFI is looking for a CRM Business Analyst to join our IS&T Business Unit in our Fremont, CA office. Be the Business Analyst leader on your team: Our CRM Business Analyst in our Fremont office is involved in leading the requirements development, analysis and configuration of the EFI SFDC, Sales Compensation, Service and Marketing System business solutions. This individual will be responsible for working closely with their Sales, Professional Services and Marketing business partners to define their business requirements and help them drive solid business solutions. This role reports to the Senior Manager of CRM. To accomplish these goals, you will need to:Poses strong business knowledge of Sales, Support, Marketing and Professional Services organizations, and underlying data conceptsWork closely with your Sales, Sales Compensation, Service and Marketing business partners to understand their business needs and develop solution strategies and roadmaps.Develop detailed business requirements that can be translated easily into technical SalesForce.com, Callidus and Marketing System solutions by the development team.Document as-is business processes, assess gaps and define business requirement improvements in support of integration with SAP and other applications, as well as improving the customer SFDC, Callidus and marketing systems solution experience.Work across a highly matrixed organization spanning teams in Israel, the US, Europe and India.Create training materials and documentation for your users and train new end users on Salesforce.com and related applications.Poses strong Communicator with ability to effectively package initiatives, milestones, achievements and outcomes into communications for different audiences.Have demonstrated experience supporting projects in both Waterfall and Agile environments; setting clear delivery objectives based on provided epics and user storiesWork closely with your business partners to provide feedback on functionality requests regarding feasibility and complexity.Provide configuration and maintenance support of EFI’s SalesForce.com and Callidus Sales Compensation environmentsProject managementAssist in quality assurance and defining testing strategy and risks. Provide significant contributions in the testing and debugging of new software or enhancements to existing software.Poses the ability to communicate complex requirements to development teams and work with them to build solid solutionsRequired Skills3-5 years Business Analyst experience in any one or more of the following functional areas: Sales, Sales Compensation, Marketing, Service/Support, Professional Services.Familiarity with Salesforce.com Integration components for SFDC (for example, SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, and SFDC data loaders)At least 2-3 years of SFDC Requirements Design, development, testing, and/or deployment experience in CRM, Sales or Service (Classic to Lightening), CPQ, Callidus Commission, or Integrations applicationsAt least 2-3 years of experience designing business requirements for, and using, SFDC Force.com configuration tools.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or related fieldSalesforce Developer or Administrator Certification a plusAdditional Skills/PreferencesExcellent written and verbal communication skills, using a variety of methods in diverse forumsExperience with going through a full software development life cycleKnowledge of Field Service 360, Callidus Sales Compensation, Adobe Campaign, Marketo or SAP a plus.2+ years’ experience - technical and/or process improvement project management.Interest in, and willingness to learn, new technologies and products.CCBA or CBAP Certification a plusWe move quickly, with the purposeful intention of solving a problem, accomplishing a goal, and ultimately making a difference for our customers, partners, colleagues and shareholders, EFI SPRINTers take action and adapt to changes in order to transform our customers businesses to be more productive and profitable through innovation in a digital print business.EFI is an “Affirmative Action/EEO/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer”

Name: Financial Aid Business Analyst - Administrative Analyst/Speciali
Description: CSU Job Listing Details Printable version E-Mail this listing Campus: East BayJob ID: 5421Job Title: Financial Aid Business Analyst - Administrative Analyst/SpecialiAppointment Type: ProbationaryTime Base: Full-Time Date Posted: September 14, 2018Closing Date: Open until filledLink to Apply Online: http://www.csueastbay.edu/jobsCampus Employment Homepage: http://www.csueastbay.edu/jobsDescription: SALARY AND BENEFITS:The starting salary will be between $4,693.00/month to $6,468.00/month.CSUEB offers a broad range of benefits that includes medical, dental, vision, retirement (CalPERS), 401k, 457, 403(b), dependent and health care reimbursement accounts, life insurance, vacation and sick, 13 paid holidays, one personal holiday and tuition fee waiver.For more information on the benefits program, please visit http://www.csueastbay.edu/af/departments/hr/benefits/index.htmlABOUT CSU EAST BAY:Cal State East Bay's beautiful main campus is located in the Hayward hills with panoramic views of the San Francisco Bay shoreline. Situated above the city of Hayward, the campus offers an ideal setting for teaching and learning and yet easy access to the many cities along the bay. The University has a satellite campus in Concord, a professional development center in Oakland and a significant presence online. Founded in 1957, California State University, East Bay is one of 23 universities of the California State University system (CSU). With an enrollment over 15,800 students, Cal State East Bay is recognized as a regionally engaged and globally oriented university with a strong commitment to academic innovation, student success, engaged and service learning, diversity, and sustainability.ABOUT THE POSITION:Under the general supervision of the Director of Financial Aid, the Financial Aid Business Analyst is responsible for providing overall backup support for the PeopleSoft Financial Aid Module. The incumbent works to increase productivity through operational efficiency and system effectiveness, independently, independently assesses complex issues, and implements functionality of the Financial Aid Module. The Administrative Analyst/Specialists in financial aid (business analysts) is responsible for analyzing, developing, and implementation of technical operations related to business processes in the area of Financial Aid.This position will be assigned the development of reports using the student data warehouse are the data source. The report writers will:* Design and develop database student data reports using SQL Server Transaction-SOL within SQL Server Reporting Services.* Work from report specifications provided by the user, business analyst, or the AVP.RESPONSIBILITIES:Reporting/Analysis* Design and develop database reports using SQL Server Transaction-SOL within SQL Server Reporting Services or other appropriate data extraction tools.* Work from or develop report specifications against a dimensionally modeled data warehouse or native database tables.* Provide adequate testing of design and execution prior to final testing by users and AVP.Serve as backup resident PeopleSoft power user within the Financial Aid Office* Ensure ongoing configuration maintenance of the Financial Aid PeopleSoft module.* Serve as liaison between functional staff and technical staff.* Attend training and lead ongoing training of new and current staff throughout the campus.* Act as the primary tester for any new modifications or reports.* Partner with the Director of Financial Aid to analyze future software patches and vendor/CSU modifications for impacts on the installed system.* Ensure that all processes and procedures related to PeopleSoft are well documented.* Serve as liaison to the PeopleSoft project group for semester conversion, upgrades and other ongoing activities.* Participate in conference calls with CSU user groups and attend meetings as needed.* Collaborate with Financial Aid Directors to ensure all PeopleSoft processes, queries, and programs run on schedule, troubleshoot issues, and support workflows.* Generate and maintain department communication letter templates for 3 C's Module.Support workflow processes and troubleshoot data discrepancies* Responsible for the development and utilization of data analytics for ongoing assessment of department performance.* Assist with processing and resolution of data discrepancies.* Support staff with troubleshooting financial aid functional areas.* Develop reports/queries and maintenance of dashboards for functional staff.* Run routine processes in PeopleSoft (e.g. disbursement rosters, satisfactory academic progress, and communication batches).* Run standard weekly reports for functional staff.Specialized Tasks/Projects-Backup* Responsible for uploading the ICR reporting and proving ongoing status reports.* Maintain institutional data compliance with the California State Aid Commission.* Train functional staff in routine PeopleSoft operations.* Work close with management team to implement new workflow processes to improve efficiencies and maintain institutional compliance.* Collaborate with third party vendors with deploying new technologies.Other duties as assigned.REQUIREMENTS:* Consolidate information from different data sources and present information in a combined logical readable format.* Ability to work independently.* Ability to communicate effectively in spoken and written English.* Excellent organization skills.* Ability to work independently, make judgment, decisions and commitments within a team environment.* Excellent facilitation skills.* Ability to influence and gain support of a decision while collaborating with a decentralized customer base.* Excellent oral and written communication skills.* Excellent presentation skills.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Requires general knowledge and skills in the applicable administrative and/or program field with a foundational knowledge of public administration principles, practices, and methods. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor's degree and/or equivalent training and administrative work experience involving study, analysis, and/or evaluation leading to the development or improvement of administrative policies, procedures, practices, or programs.PREFERRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related discipline.* One or more years of work experience designing and creating complex database reports.* Experience with Microsoft SQL Server 2008 tools, including T-SQL and the use of Management Studio and SQL Server Reporting Services.* PeopleSoft experience.* Ability to interpret end-user non-technical specifications and transform request to function technical specifications.HOW TO APPLY:In addition to the standard CSUEB application, please submit a:1. Cover letter2. Resume3. List of three (3) or more professional references Resumes alone will not be accepted in lieu of a completed online application.To apply on-line, please go to www.csueastbay.edu/jobs. If you are a first time user, you must register, create a user ID and password, fill in your basic information, save and click on the position you are interested in, click on the "Apply Now" button to begin the online application.This position will remain open until filled and may close without further notice.Applicants will receive a confirmation of receipt via automatic email reply regarding their application materials. In addition, all applicants who were not selected will receive email notification at the conclusion of the recruitment process. Please be patient as this process may take several weeks.CONDITION(S) OF EMPLOYMENT:California State University, East Bay conducts pre-employment screening that may include, but is not limited to: criminal background check, verification of academic credentials, licenses, certificates, credit history, professional references and/or verification of work history. Candidates must submit to a background check before being offered a position with CSUEB. Unsatisfactory results of the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSUEB employees who apply for the position.OTHER INFORMATION:All California State University campuses, including CSUEB, are smoke and tobacco-free. For more information, please visit our website at http://www.csueastbay.edu/smokeandtobaccofree/In compliance with state and federal crime awareness and campus security legislation, including The Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Crime Statistics Act, the California State University East Bay Annual Campus Security Report is available at: http://www20.csueastbay.edu/af/departments/upd/campus-security-report.htmlMANDATED REPORTER:All California State University, East Bay employees are considered mandated reporters under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and are required to comply with requirements set forth in the CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.SPONSORSHIP:CSUEB is not a sponsoring agency for Staff or Management positions.EEO STATEMENT:As an Equal Opportunity Employer, CSUEB does not discriminate on the basis of any protected categories: age, ancestry, citizenship, color, disability, gender, immigration status, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran's status. The University is committed to the principles of diversity in employment and to creating a stimulating learning environment for its diverse student body.

Name: Business Analyst - WebEx Ops
Description: What You'll DoAs a Business Analyst, you will help identify and prioritize Cisco Cloud Collaboration’s biggest challenges and key opportunities in the areas of process, workflow, innovation, communication and strategic planning. You will partner with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their analytic and business needs, and provide data for informed decision-making. You will also need to think strategically, connect the dots of the bigger picture, as well as being comfortable in the details of the deliverables. You will listen to and translate operational needs into high-level technical or process specifications; design and develop recommended solutions and consult with our leadership teams to ensure smooth implementation. You have the ability and interest to work with a variety of technologies (Multi-tier Web Architectures, Rich Media, Telephony, instant Messaging) to solve problems, and have a background that demonstrates this ability.Responsibilities include but not limited to the following;- You have a keen sense for sniffing out inefficiencies and desire for better, simpler data will drive continuous improvements and innovation in our processes and operations - Responsible for Data collection and analysis- Identify, Analyze and interpret trends on support issues across Webex Services, TAC , Engineering, and Operations- Demonstrated ability to synthesize information to see big picture while effectively managing detail.- Proven ability to successfully work and partner across multiple functions in an organization.- Distinctive problem solving and analytic skills with a high degree of analytical rigor.-You are a team-oriented business analyst who will use your strong set of business analytical skills to help craft stories and insights to help make wide-ranging business decisions.- Define and implement KPIs for operational metrics. Identify key success measures for business processes being implemented.- Ability to address escalations, quickly assess and develop root cause analysis and solutions for operational escalations. Engage with the various teams within Cisco including internal partners to identify and scope the gaps, risks, and outcome for business challenges.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine broader requirements across program and larger organizational dependencies and interdependencies.- Lead Coordinate and manage cross-functional work efforts to gather, audit, and report on performance data in internal process and systems as well as provide updates- Perform business process modeling, User experience modeling and basic technical architecture diagraming.- Manage project communications across global stakeholders, subject matter experts, executives and other internal groups, including regular project meetings, email updates, and project wiki. - Can interpret technical and business strategy roadmaps and apply a detailed technical solution.- Establish and execute relevant governance and weekly reporting.- Excellent communication skills- Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders- Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats. Who Are You- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.- Minimum of 5 years in project management and/or business analysis / operations. Consulting background experience is helpful.

Name: Senior AP Business Analyst

We offer the chance to be a part of an important mission: ending breaches and protecting our way of life in the digital age. If you are a motivated, intelligent, creative, and hardworking individual, then this is the job for you!  We are looking to add Senior AP (and Procure to Pay) Business Analyst to our team. This role is critical to the Accounting organization’s success as the company continues to rapidly grow and disrupt the network security industry. A successful candidate will have the ability to drive impactful change and scaling by leading global accounts payable project implementations, enhancements, cross functional partnering, and further drive efficiencies to our global Accounts Payable operations through process optimization and standardization initiatives. drive global AP related projects and initiatives while partnering closely with AP processors and regional AP team (experience in a Coupa/Ariba environment is a plus);Drive resolution of system/process issues by identifying, testing, and implementing enhancements, perform regular maintenance and assess requests for feasibility and scope of solutions to SAP AP and OpenText VIM;Quickly understand business needs and translate into solutions, including identifying opportunities for process and system improvementsUnderstand accounts payable integration points between various SAP modules, systems and business processes;Partner closely with information technology team on projects and participate in regular status meetings;Partner closely with regional accounts payable teams to drive maintenance and enhancements of AP related initiativesPartner and maintain strong relationships with internal customers such as employees, FP&A, procurement, and receiving personnel;Document procedures and disseminate training to local and regional team members including new team-members;Assist in establishing and maintaining AP metrics for monthly and quarterly reporting using BI HANA utilizing Tableau;Act as the backup in the absence of the Accounts Payable Manager to oversee the accounts payable processes and controls;Perform special projects and ad-hoc requests;Maintain strong communication both written and oral amongst internal and external customers across all management levelsJob Qualifications:BA/BS in Business Administration (preferably Accounting) is preferredMinimum of 3 years of PTP business analyst experience at large company (technology industry preferred)Advanced MS Office experience (with strong skills using Excel)Capable of creative solutioning and thinking outside of standard processes and system designAbility to independently manage multiple competing demandsBe accountable for the quality, timeliness, and accuracy of own workKnowledge of standard accounts payable policies, procedures and regulationsUnderstanding of basic accountingExcellent planning and organizational skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to interact with internal and external customersAdaptable to using new systems and toolsSAP is requiredJIRA, Hana, Open Text and Tableau experience is a plusExperience working in a Coupa/Ariba/S4Hana environment is a plus Learn more about Palo Alto Networks here and check out our fast facts

Name: Siebel Business Systems Analyst - Products
Description: Title : Siebel Business Systems Analyst - Products  Location :  Bay area/San Diego, CAJob Overview: We are seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst with in-depth and broad IT knowledge to assist in troubleshooting and developing solutions in the Products area. Name: Business Analyst - Porduct Management
Description: Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world! Position Summary This role provides focused business analysis functions necessary to help support the Product Management team and strategic and product planning efforts. Tasks include: working with product and portfolio owners to conduct market research and analysis, documenting and streamlining operations, and supporting product group initiatives or programs. This role requires research, data management, and analytical abilities, as well as the business insight to drive key projects at various stageswhether planning, implementing or evaluating.  Primary Responsibilities You will lead market and competitive research and analysis, provide insights, and document resultsDetermine effective product positioning, correctly targeting the product in the market and shorten the time of sale for maximum sales effectivenessLead Market Requirement Documents based on market inputs (customer calls/visits, partners, trends, field feedback, services, win/loss analysis, competitive analysis, ROI, and other market opportunities)Lead the creation of product roadmaps and product positioning based upon analysis of market dynamicsBuild and deliver presentations to non-Exec audiencesLead programs and streamline associated operations (EoS, EoL, etc. or as assigned)Lead product group initiatives such as customer roundtables and programsCraft methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Process-oriented, mindset of continual improvement; real passion for ingesting and analyzing data, documenting processes with the intent of driving progressive improvements and significant innovationAbility to think strategically and see the big picture, analyzing a problem or project from a variety of angles, yet examining specific aspects in significant detailAbility to learn quickly, build consensus and interact effectively with teamsProduct Management, cross-functional or vendorKnowledge of business process and change management methodologyStrong organizational skills, strong attention to detail and accuracyStrong verbal and written communications skillsMust have strong data management and data analysis skills.Knowledge or experience on any web based statistical tool is a plusKnowledge of research methodology, survey techniques a plusDuties may require being on call periodically and working outside normal working hours (evenings)Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer tableQualificationsBachelor's degree in Marketing, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or other appropriate field with 5+ years experience; or a Master's degree with 3+ years experience; or equivalent experience.2+ years of technical, analytical work experience. Name: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description: Are you the type of person who is passionate about enabling intelligence from data? Are you curious by nature? We are seeking an Analyst, Business Intelligence to help deliver business insights across the organization through our Analytics platforms.  The ideal candidate will bring a strong business mindset for approaching problems and have technical skills in data extraction and manipulation. This is the perfect opportunity for an analyst with 2 - 3 years experience to make an impact in a high-growth, mobile commerce start-up. Responsibilities:Develop strong understanding of different areas of the business and the key metrics to measure performance of overall business, Marketplace Operations, Growth, Merchandising and community service groupDrive improvements in our Analytics platform to increase its impact in delivering insights across the organizationBuild different pieces of our BI Models framework - new tables, new dimensions and new measures etc as needed.Identify the new data needed to enable appropriate business insights and work with Data Engineering team to implement the data collection needed.Work with business owners across the organization to understand business requirements and build/update dashboards to deliver business insightsManage, maintain, update and QA different business KPI dashboardsProvide scheduled trainings and respond to ad-hoc questions by business teamsTroubleshoot any data, insights, and visualization related issuesOwn all admin tasks including adding/removing users, changing permission sets, creating new roles and permission sets etcEvangelize adoption of our analytics platform, new features and functionalities to increase efficiencies across the organizationPerform extensive QA on data to ensure the quality of data. Follow the standard process for reporting any issues identified and work with Data team to close the data issuesMaintain all required documentationDesired Skills:B.A./B.S. or equivalent degree with 3+ years of business analysis or business intelligence platform experience Or M.S. with 2+ years of experience.Proficiency in SQL. Knowledge of other programming languages and experience with external API integrations is a strong plus.Advanced business intelligence and reporting experience with strong critical thinking and project management skills. Passionate about building scalable, efficient and well document business insights frameworks.Detail oriented and expert in both qualitative and quantitative analysis with a passion for delivering actionable insights to key stakeholders.Excellent written and verbal communication skills Please note that Poshmark will not be able to sponsor work-related visa for this role. Why Poshmark? Founded in 2011, Poshmark is the largest social marketplace for fashion where anyone can buy, sell and share their style with others. Poshmark's mission is to make shopping simple and fun by connecting people around a shared love of fashion, while empowering entrepreneurs to become the next generation of retailers. Recognized as the go-to shopping destination for millennials, Poshmark's community of over four million Seller Stylists help shoppers discover the perfect look from over 75 million items and 5,000 brands. The company is backed by the world's leading investment firms and venture capital institutions including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and Snapchat. Here's what we'll set you up with:A team that is invested in your career growth and trainingCompetitive salary and equity, based on experienceCompany sponsored health, dental and vision plansA 15" MacBook Pro and smartphone reimbursementWork alongside world-class talentFlexible Vacation / Paid Time Off PolicyParental LeaveHealthy and exciting lunches and snacks offered dailyPersonal Style Encouraged (or not, whatever you're in to)Fun company happy hours, parties, and offsite events

Name: Co-op: NPI Business Analyst
Description: Co-op Student Position: Winter Term (January to Apr 2019)Req Title – NPI Business Analyst Co-op Number of Positions: 1This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-op or internship program at a U.S. University. Nokia is a global leader in the technologies that connect people and things. With state-of-the-art software, hardware and services for any type of network, Nokia is uniquely positioned to help communication service providers, governments, and large enterprises deliver on the promise of 5G, the Cloud and the Internet of Things. Serving customers in over 100 countries, our research scientists and engineers continue to invent and accelerate new technologies that will increasingly transform the way people and things communicate and connect.OverviewAs a Business Analyst Co op for Nokia you will develop creative solutions for real business challenges. You will collaborate on internal and external projects to identify areas for improvement. You will observe, analyze and document these processes, workflows, issues and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities. Ultimately you will improve how our organization and business operates to help better support and service our Customer.We are a world class and diverse company and as a result you will find a diverse group of people tackling business issues. We work with cross functional teams to create new business models and process improvements. As a Co-op you will work industry professionals, learn and benefit from their experience, exposure and mentorship but yet we will value your ideas and perspective. This is culture of Nokia, one you will cherish being part of.Desired SkillsYou are a working towards a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business, Management, Finance, or Information Systems or a related field from an accredited institution.You have a minimum of a 3.0 GPA or equivalentYou have excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skillsYou possess a high level of customer focus and service excellence as you seek practical solutionsYou have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and cross-functional teamsYou have superb social skills, “can do” attitude and team player in global environmentYou possess effective time-management skills and the ability to prioritize work assignmentsWe are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.  We're disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better. including both verbal and written communications.Ability to lead and work collaboratively within a business unit team and have strong influencing skillsMust be someone who is intellectually curious and excited about working with customers and gets gratification from building useful IT applications and solutionsMust be able to manage multiple priorities and complex tasks in a dynamic work environmentMust have experience preparing end-user documentation and conducting end-user trainingProject Management experience a plusBusiness process reengineering experience, Six Sigma certification etc. is a plus.ITIL certification is highly desiredGood communications skillsTeam PlayerFlexibility to work with a variety of personalities and stylesAdaptable to work in a varied, high-paced exiting, fun environment We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.SDL2017

Name: AMP Discovery Fraud & Moderation Business Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  The AMP Discovery Fraud & Moderation team is seeking a bright and motivated analyst to help ensure accuracy and integrity across iTunes Store and App Store discovery features. If you have proven analytic skills and are comfortable working with data in various environments and formats, this is the team for you!  You are upbeat, adaptable, and results oriented with a positive attitude  You are comfortable with a deadline-driven work environment  Ability to stay focused and prioritize a heavy workload while achieving exceptional quality  Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills in English  Additional language skills is helpful  Background in fraud investigations is helpful  Experience with SQL / Hive is helpful  Deep understanding of digital distribution platforms, payment structures, content marketing and user acquisition is helpful  The AMP Discovery Fraud & Moderation team works alongside a team of data scientists to evaluate and take action on signs of fraud, abuse, and manipulation. Analysts in this role are integral to the worldwide customer experience of all AMP products, and are able to provide valuable insights to teams across Apple, ultimately affecting support policies, operational processes, and product direction. Analyzing data for the purposes of risk mitigation using multiple internal tools for investigations.You have excellent judgment and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisionsParticipating in and / or leading projects to enhance tools and featuresYou create and updating documentation for policy and processesYou bring passion and dedication to your job and are committed to our vision and supporting the customer experienceEducation & Experience BA/BS or equivalent experience

Name: SAP Business Analyst - SD
Description: Job DescriptionWhen you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of $20 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. SUMMARY: A Business Analyst conducts research, monitors, maintains, and optimizes business solutions.  Knowledge of business processes and SAP within a specific area(s) of responsibility, defined by the position. Directly support users and corporate processes in the assigned area. Researches gaps in functionality, gathers requirements of users and presents recommendations to teams both technical and business.  Excellent grasp of industry and subject matter best practices, trends, and concepts. Ability to apply these concepts into the SAP environment and business process. Strong Leadership skills, especially in the handling of Organization Change Management are strongly desired. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Support SAP ECC and related software.Knowledge of Sales and Distribution techniques, methods, and tools. Subject matter best practices.Knowledge of SAP reporting capabilities.Develop IT and end-user documentation for processes and procedures.Participate in Service Desk function to resolve user related support calls.Prepare and execute test plans for new functionality.Publish communication related to the deployment of new functionality.Translate user requests into user requirements and program specifications.Work with Enterprise Shared Services and programmers to assure compliance to program specificationsDevelop training outlines for end-users and collaborate with documentation specialistsLiaise with Divisional Management to understand direction within their functional area of responsibilityMonitor compliance with Service Level Agreements for site.Support business initiatives utilizing Project Management expertise.Maintain security in compliance with ThermoFisher Security directives.Ensure compliance to Thermo Fisher IT Policies and Guidelines.Travel can range from 25%-50%.Gather user requirements to develop solutions and alternatives.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Translate high-level information into details as well as summarize detailed information.Communicate and collaborate with users to analyze information needs and functional requirements.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Work with users to define concepts under direction of project leaders.Serve as the conduit between the user community and the software development team through which requirements flow.Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates.Liaise between the business, technology teams and support teams.Comply with companys Global IT Policies & Procedures.Other duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Excellent knowledge of business processes and best practices.Knowledge of SAP in specified area.Knowledge of Thermo Fisher SAP Template a plus.3-7 years of business experience in functional area.2-4 years of SAP experience.4 year degree or 5-7 years experience in related area.Relevant technical certificates a plus.4+ years of related technical work experience.Strong interpersonal and excellent documentation skills are a must.Able to assume and complete assignments independently.Ability to explain and champion technical concepts to a broad audience.Excellent customer service skills required.Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Strong project management skills and understanding of project management lifecycle.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.FUNCTIONS WITHIN ISO:To understand the quality policy and objectives for quality.Perform duties and responsibilities according to the documented quality system.Recommend and implement improvements to activities and processes within the quality system.Have awareness of ITIL and other related quality/IT processes. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 65,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular missionenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.  Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.
