Name: Senior Business Analyst - Decision Support
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Our team is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the Decision Support function to support delivering insights and dashboard development for the Operations organization.  You will have a combination of business insight and technical knowledge, used to develop and deliver Dashboards, insights and reports in support of rapid decision-making. You will focus on supporting the growth of Apple’s products, routes to market and key Operations initiatives. Your role is highly visible, interacting with executives and networking throughout Apple’s organization. We want you to help drive Apple’s reporting strategy.  5 - 10 years meaningful experience  Ability to quickly translate ambiguous business requirements into analytical insights  Expertise with Tableau and data visualization  Experience presenting and sharing insights with various business functions  Advanced knowledge of SQL  Experience with ETL tools used to automate manual processes  Familiarity with Operations and various functions (primarily Retail, Online. Logistics, Supply Chain a plus)  Demonstrable experience developing reports using SAP BOBJ, or similar tool  Experience with Python a plus The individual should demonstrate: Sound critical thinking, work ethics and passion to go beyond what is expected ongoing.  Possess a very high degree of natural curiosity to drive the next levels of business questions and insights  Solid teammate - driving new insights across technical and business domains for self and team ongoing  Demonstrates resilience and flexibility in the face of ambiguity to drive business impacting change Design, develop, and support dashboards and reports. Drive deep data profiling and analysis for insights. Define and enforce to established Data Governance principles and practice.Develop very strong business partnerships, deliver solutions to enable deep analysis and support business management and executive decision-making.You will work with Apple’s IS&T team to drive development of tools to better support business analytics and will partner with other Apple organizations on data governance, reporting tools, hierarchy management and critical metrics.Constantly steer business outcomes using established management systems to ensure alignment across WW and Regional teams.Education & Experience BS/MS/MBA in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Finance, Marketing or related field.

Name: Business Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Description: Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse \"data\" sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. Interacts with product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.A key objective of the DDOMe team is to centralize Enterprise business data objects generated across the customer journey business process and platforms to establish a Unified Data Layer to enable KPI’s and experiences to run the Enterprise business with deeper connected insights to drive strategic actions and outcomes· Collaborate with other Data Analysts/Engineers, subject matter experts, and decision makers to develop data-driven models to accelerate data discovery, automate insights, and predict future outcomes· Develop metrics, KPIs, to measure the effectiveness of the experiences we’re delivering and be able to identify opportunities for further optimization.· Work with Leadership to define product vision and roadmap for online customer self-service experiences, including use of data science to provide modern and scalable experiences· Identify new areas for product feature development by analyzing customer requirements, market trends and competitive gaps.Understands and translates the business strategy, business goals, and business processes into an IT solution. End to end Delivery of Reporting for applications Across Adobe Source Systems, Especially in the Sales and Finance Area Interface with Adobe BUs and Technical Delivery Teams to assist in finalizing user stories, translating them to technical documentation and other system documentation required by Agile methodologies. Provide Product Design and Functionalities for DATA modelling teams Review and approve estimations from development and testing team Review and approve integration test cases Responsible for coordinating design, coding, testing, defect resolution and documentation Research and analyze business needs and recommend technical solutions which meet the business needs. Manage requirements volatility, integrity and continuity via change management and reprioritization Participate in Proof of Concept that leads to project proposals and application enhancements.Skills· An experienced data expert with robust data/object modeling knowledge· A full-stack data leader who understands where in the stack certain problems should be addressed· A cross-functional leader who can interface with Magento business system owners (to help influence them to clean their data)· All the requisite BSA kills relevant to data infrastructure (Hive, Hadoop, etc.) including performance optimization· Prior experience in deploying self-service BI tools and understanding the implications of that service model on the underlying data models· Prior experience in tech companies with mixed deployment products (on-prem, cloud, etc.) for a basic level of business context· degree in Business Analytics/Computer Science or MBA (a plus)· Experience with data driven service design and customer support; Deep knowledge and experience of data technology platforms like Hana/Hadoop/Azure SQL· Strong proficiency in querying and manipulating large data sets for analytical purposes using SQL/Python and experience with business intelligence tools like Tableau and Power BI· Experience with SAP ECC Order To Cash modules or other SAP Modules is an advantage or MS Dynamics CRM· Strong analytical skills and a drive to Innovate; demonstrated ability to use data to drive decision making in product development· Ability to manage complex builds through thoughtful prioritization and disciplines that drive towards delivery· Hands-on experience using databases and related technologies in a fast-paced multi-application business environment with large-scale and complex data-sets.At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.Adobe

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Do you want to be part of an exciting company dedicated to solving the greatest challenge humanity faces? Then Impossible Foods is the place for you.Impossible Foods was founded in 2011 to create a truly sustainable global food system by inventing an efficient, sustainable way to transform plants into irresistibly delicious, nutritious food -- food that delivers all the pleasures and nutritional benefits consumers demand, without the destructive environmental impact. Our first product, the Impossible Burger, was introduced by top chefs to the world and is currently available at over 2000 restaurants across the United States and abroad.As the IT Sr. Business Analyst you will work with your immediate team, external partners, and business stakeholders from Supply Chain teams. As a critical resource of Impossible’s growing IT team you will help drive multiple projects to improve our operations. We offer to work with some of the greatest minds in Science and Technology and you will have an opportunity to transform our business applications. Impossible Foods offers a fast-paced, open and collaborative environment, if you have the fire within and looking to make an impact immediately, read on. You Will Build a solid relationship with Supply Chain teams and become a trusted partner.Develop delivery roadmaps, defining business requirements and associated solution designs.Analyze complex business problems, assess alternatives, and recommend scalable solutions that balance customer needs, business constraints, and technical feasibility.Analyze, design and deliver continuous system improvement initiatives.Manage project work, oversee execution and ensure successful delivery.Drive system implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification, and resolution).Be a leader in driving the culture of predictable delivery.Communicate functional requirements to external development team and assist with unit testing.Develop appropriate test cases, complete IT testing and manage business test cycles.Promote adoption and positive user experiences by preparing training materials and delivering training sessions.Provide hands-on application support, resolving and managing user service requests.Create ad-hoc reports, queries, or data extracts, as necessary.Apply strong written and verbal communication, presentation, and influencing skills to stakeholders, including identifying and raising issues to the proper level. You Have Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business or equivalent work experience.5+ years IT applications experience with strong project mgmt. skills.Experience with IT internal controls and SOX requirements.Experience with Sage X3 is preferred - Order Management, Pricing, Shipping, Purchasing, Inventory, and integrating with third party systems including EDI, Plant Maintenance, Analytics.Previous experience with managing external IT delivery teams.Supply Chain management SME with deep understanding and working knowledge of Order to Cash, Plan to Fulfill and Procure to Pay, business processes.Exposure to Waterfall, Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle.Working knowledge of ITIL processes.Willingness to work in a 24x7 setting and support after-hours activities when necessary.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionAt JSG, we understand people and its our mission to help our clients reach their goals by being able to hire talented people.  Since our start in 1984, weve worked hard to establish our present position as the most effective cross-industry staffing solution available.  JSGs growth now extends to offices throughout the nation. We serve both busy recruiters and qualified candidates within multiple industries from our major offices headquartered in Chicago and Atlanta with local offices throughout the United States and Canada.Job DescriptionJohnson Service Group is seeking a Programmer Analyst/Process Analyst for a Temporary assignment with one of our clients within the government sector. Job Description: Seeking an analyst to be primary technical support for our legacy Financial applications. In addition, this role will provide primary IT technical support with various database (Oracle and SQL Server) and interface tools (scripting and reporting). This position requires to manage routine process tasks, to identify and define users needs and problems, to analyze the troubled situations and find the best outcome solutions, to achieve the higher standard goals in timely manner with your IT, programming and business analysis skills. This position will also be responsible for system integration with ETL tools and documenting procedures. Required Skills/Experience • Working knowledge of Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, and Microsoft Access.  • Ability to learn and understand application data table structure to create database schemas and ability to conditionally extract data directly from data base to create complex database views with Strong SQL programming.  • Define, manage and/or perform the design, testing, implementation and documentation of IT systems according to agreed timelines, business requirements and organization standards in collaboration with internal business units.  • Experience developing interfaces and integration between different system.  • Extract & transform for data integration.  • Work as a cross-functional team member, critically evaluate and manage user requests to ensure accurate prioritization and optimal resolutions.  • Lead communication with internal staff and technology service providers to bridge the requirement gaps and technical needs.  • Familiarity with Unix environment and shell scripting.  • 2+ years experience in IT Applications.  • 4-year degree or Masters degree related to Computer Science and Business Analyst. General Skills & Abilities • Communications skills to define and document requirements  • Excellent documentation skills  Willingness to document processes and procedures, enabler of turnover to production  Desired Skills/Experience  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle database backup/restore processes and Microsoft SQL Server SSIS and SSRS.  • Working experience of creating Oracle Packages/functions and Microsoft SQL Server stored procedures.  • Experience supporting finance functions like Accounting, Budgeting or Forecasting functions.  • Working knowledge of AS/400 operating system and Command Language  • Experience with ASP.net programming  • Experience working on interface development between finance/HR system (eP/NextGen) and Questica budget system  • Experience with a public-sector agency

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Full Time Permanent RoleCampbell, CA This client facing role will be responsible for designing, recommending, implementing and maintaining compensation programs, policies and procedures that support the achievement of company objectives by delivering fair, competitive, and performance driven compensation in a cost effective manner to clients. Responsibilities include compensation program analysis, design, creation, maintenance and administration, bonus and incentive processes and programs. In addition, the position is responsible for data analysis and reporting and provides necessary professional and/or technical level support and guidance. Functions as an internal technical consultant to HR, senior management, hiring managers, and employees to identify and resolve various compensation-related issues/questions. The resource should be good in Sales targeting, segmentation, IQVIA data, Symphony data and understand Sales Alignment, Sales exception managements and good understanding on IC (incentive compensation) goals and payouts.Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree in human resources, finance/accounting, or a business-related field.  Master's Degree in a directly-related field preferred (Good to have) Requirements:Five (5) years of progressively responsible professional-level work experience in the incentive compensation preferably in the Pharmaceutical arena.Strong data analysis/financial analysis skills;Advanced Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, Access, Word, and PowerPoint) skills.Previous incentive compensation (IC) reporting experience is mandatory.The drive for self-development, the ability to collaborate, and an action-oriented work ethicRequired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Must be advanced in the use of Microsoft Excel, including the ability to do complex formulas, pivot tables and power pivot reports.Database query skills (e.g. Microsoft Access, SQL or equivalent)Proficiency with standard Microsoft Office applications (Access, Word, Power Point, Outlook)Ability to set and maintain multiple priorities in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment with shifting priorities while providing deliverable's in a timely fashion.Must be well-organized with excellent time management skills, attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to develop/create professionally formatted summary materials (e.g. spreadsheets, tables, charts).Strong verbal and written communication skills.Ability to identify and understand broad-scope issues while simultaneously attending to details.Must be a team player with excellent follow-up and customer service skills.Must be self-motivated and results oriented; take ownership of projects and produces results.Pro-active, goal-oriented and able move quickly to resolution.Proven strong analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills, and ability to synthesize information and data from a variety of sources.Ability to apply sound judgment to solve problems, make defensible recommendations.Understand how certain compensation issues may impact other company departmentsprovided by Dice Business Analyst

Name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM.IBM Services is seeking Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Business Analysts to collect and analyze requirements and solve client problems using Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions. You will serve as a liaison between clients and project consultants, particularly during initial project phases. You will work primarily on project execution but may be involved in sales support as well.  Microsoft CRM Business Analysts are responsible for identifying, developing and deploying end-user solutions in CRM systems. Using your deep functional knowledge and familiarity with the Microsoft Dynamics CRM application, you will ensure that client business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training.Primary Responsibilities:Project ExecutionSupport the translation of client business requirements into CRM solutions, including requirements approval, communication, traceability and reuseContribute to the transfer of functional requirements to development and test teamsUse CRM workflow technology to automate business processesStay abreast on updates and new releases in CRM technologies (Microsofts and its competitors)Educate end-users on CRM functionsSales SupportHelp determine and translate customer needs into a solution and approachContribute to proposal developmentContribute to scope, approach, and estimating input to the proposal teamContribute to and participate in client demonstrations and presentationsAdditional skills required:Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioTeam Foundation Server (TFS)Familiarity with Microsoft technologies/trendsStrong analytical, presentation, and writing skillsBENEFITS Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population. http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/https://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wssCAREER GROWTH Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through: Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsFinding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employees strengths and career aspirationsDiversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovationCORPORATE CITIZENSHIP With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlhttp://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps Candidates that live in or near one of the following cities preferred, but all candidates considered: Atlanta, Chicago, Columbus, Houston, Dallas, Raleigh, Washington DC Metro Area, Piscataway, Philadelphia. GBSEA17RWMS Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 3 years team lead experience or management experience of 5+ team members (management consultant only)At least 2 years project experience in enterprise business application development and delivery (e.g., CRM, ERP, SCM, HCM)At least 1 year project implementation experience using Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Dynamics CRM online, or Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016, 2015, or 2013At least 2 years project experience translating client business needs into software capabilitiesAt least 2 years project experience with business requirements analysis and modelingAt least 2 years project experience creating functional designs, test conditions and test scriptsAt least 2 years experience working within a team environmentBasic knowledge of software development methodologies (Waterfall and/or Agile) Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 2 years consulting experience working for a global systems integratorMicrosoft Certified Professional (MCP)At least 1 year project experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Operations or Microsoft Dynamics AX 7, 2012, or 2009At least 1 year project experience working with global and offshore project teamsAt least 1 year experience with system integration or user acceptance testingAt least 1 year experience with organizational designAt least 1 year experience with business process design or re-engineeringAt least 1 year experience with developing and implementing end-user training programsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support sales and marketing functionsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support customer service, call center, or field service operations EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Program Manager/Business System Analyst, Payments
Description: Summary Apple is looking for a talented professional to lead program management and analysis for new and ongoing initiatives for our global Payments Team.  As an integral member of our Payments team you will be working with regional and global teams around the world to ensure a world-class customer experience and industry leading system implementations.  You are a creative thinker, you love to understand the ins and outs of an implementation, and you love finding winning resolutions. You have a high level of integrity and sense of urgency to “make things happen”. You can balance the needs of multiple teams and maintain a strong sense of empathy for your partners. You are able to clearly communicate to a group of senior leaders. You want to join a strong team that’s growing quickly to craft the international expansion of Apple’s payments initiatives.  Ability to challenge and debate issues of importance to identify the best possible outcome for the customer, requiring new industry standards  Demonstrated leadership and vision in driving communication throughout all levels of the organization  Enthusiastic and committed to project goals  Excellent organization skills and program/project management capabilities  Structured/Analytical thinker - can simplify and present complex problems and issues in an easy-to-understand manner  Ability to understand technical matters outside personal area of expertise  An understanding of financial transaction processing networks and systems  Knowledge of risk and compliance controls used in the payments industry  Comprehension of how digital wallets and alternative payment types work and the nuances of each  5 years experience working in the e-commerce space, including both technical and business expertise (e.g. technical implementation through legal contracts Gather business requirements for payment features from internal (Payment Product Managers, Finance, Payments, other iTunes and other Apple internal) partners as well as external sources and work with iTunes Engineering team and other cross functional teams to deliver world-class outcomesDocument the requirements in a clear and actionable wayBrainstorm approaches and solutions with multiple teams for scalable and extensible outcomes Lead the overall business activities portion of feature/project implementation between various business and engineering teams. Work closely with the Engineering Program Managers throughout execution.Serve as a partner and point of contact/escalation between the payment integrators and/or acquirers and the Apple internal teams (i.e.AMP engineering team, iTunes Operations, Apple Care).Work and collaborate with the iTunes Payment Operations and Apple Care teams to identify system and/or process improvements.Review contract-details with the appropriate teams to ensure all contractual requirements are covered in the business requirements documents, and in the implementationsEducation & Experience BA/BS degree required

Name: Sales Business Process Analyst
Description: Senior Sales Business Process AnalystDuties:The Senior Sales Business Process Analyst will directly drive efficiency, simplicity and intelligence to our client's sales processes and infrastructure to enhance business engagements. Partner closely with all major business functions across the sales deal lifecycle including sales, deal desk, sales operations, sales finance, order management, pricing, product management, invoicing, and revenue finance. Drive major cross-functional initiatives that are enabled through core CRM functionality. Responsibilities include functional expertise in the CRM, and other sales processes.Essential Functions:Partner with Sales, Business Operations, CRM, OTC, global business owners to address process improvement and drive efficiencyTake complete ownership of the business deliverables including any customizations and enhancements in the Sales CRM/CPQ areas. Reduce cycle time and improve through put and delivery of the IT development teamAbility to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT partners. Should be quickly able to understand and evaluate the challengesParticipate, influence and drive cross-functional projects that impact the Sales CRM processes.Drive continuous process improvements and operational efficiencies across sales, primarily in CRM area. Also, drive Sales and Sales Operations initiatives in an effort to make the systems and processes more reliable, predictable and efficientGood communication is a must. Dealing with business partner is very important aspect of this role.Managing and coordination of the Regression and User acceptance testing with the usersCollaborate with key business stakeholders, IT, external partners and third-party software vendors to implement effective and resilient solutionsAble to juggle multiple projects & tasks and successfully prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interestsProactively refine upstream solutions to avoid downstream business or IT process and data issuesUndertake post-implementation business support and troubleshoot and resolve systems issues working with the IT support teamNice to have third party software experience related to CRMStrong teamwork and interpersonal skillsRequirements:Requires 6-8 years of business operations experience of which at least 5 years mainly in CRM with a focus on gathering requirements, process improvements and solution design.Extensive experience as a business process analyst in the sales organization, with CRM as the core.Strong business partnership experience required, with proven track record of successfully driving cross-functional initiatives, enhancements and support issues. Exposure to a third-party CRM (ie. Dynamics, SAP CRM, SFDC) is a must.

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst - Billing
Description: That?s a cool job! I want it!  Ready to shake things up? Splunk continues to be on a tear while enjoying incredible growth year over year. With growth comes scaling opportunities and the need to take the friction out of our processes, platforms, and systems to drive scale, efficiency, and effectiveness. You will have a consistent track record automating core finance & accounting processes with low friction, high value business systems. As Splunk scales into a multibillion dollar company, it is important we get our processes and systems right for subsequent growth. This role is for you if possess a blend of engagement skills, knowledge of order to cash and billing processes, attention to details, critical thinking, and a real passion for frictionless systems. Come join a collaborative and growing organization where you can make a difference.  Responsibilities: I want to and can do that  The Business Systems Analyst ? Billing, will be responsible for the management, design, development, and deployment of Subscription Billing systems and interfaces. Additionally you will also work with the end-users and their management to resolve and enhance business processes and workflow. You will also help towards defining the IT roadmap for a long term billing strategy. You will be a strategic advisor to our internal clients, so this role will require a high level of expertise in billing processes and systems, as well as superb communication, prioritization and influencing skills.  + Implement subscription billing functionality in both existing and new systems.  + Drive the design and delivery of Splunk?s next-gen Subscription Billing Platform with future needs, scalability and industry-leading best-practices in mind  + Design, deliver and handle integrations to all impacted systems including CPQ, eCommerce, ERP and Fulfilment systems.  + You are responsible for taking initiative to ensure stable and defect-free operations, including logic, rules and code creation/ maintenance, control checks and monitoring of systems performance, in alignment with the requirements and timelines.  + Keep the company in compliance with existing and proposed statutory requirements governing billing and revenue.  + Main liaison with impacted system?s support and professional services organization.  + Partner with Finance, Products, Sales Ops, Billing and Rev Rec to understand business requirements and identify new use cases.  + Analyze complex business problems relating to systems and/or process. Develop and assist business partners with developing requirements, identifying gaps and translating business requirements into technical solutions.  + Documenting Standard Operating procedures as part of the regular maintenance; communicating system changes to the business..  + Develop technical solutions to requirements/issues; validate and communicate solutions to internal and external team members, test solutions and ensure it meets specifications.  + Collaborate closely with solution architects to define and implement effective and efficient solutions to business challenges and opportunities.  + Communicate information clearly and concisely and ensures others are informed.  + Prioritize to ensure work is done in a timely and high quality manner.  + Adapt to changing priorities of the business and seek out ways to develop new skills.  + Balance multiple projects and contending priorities.  Requirements: I?ve already done that or have that!  + Bachelor's degree preferably in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent years of industry experience.  + Minimum 8 years of full-time work-experience in relevant domains  + Minimum 3 years of experience in designing / maintaining highly scalable and resilient systems in the Billing domain. Experience with Salesforce, NetSuite, SaaS / Subscription Billing is a plus.  + Experience in Metering, Rating, Charging, Billing for Subscription services preferred  + Strong knowledge of Order to Cash processes  + Experience working in fast-growing, performance focused environments and administering complex programs  + Strong competencies of Data Analysis, Project Management, Communication, Influencing and collaborating.  + Work effectively in a team environment as well as independently.  + Able to explain complex systems and technical topics in a clear, concise manner to others who may have minimal technical knowledge using oral, written and visual presentations.  + Excellent planning and execution skills with a tried ability to establish and meet impactful goals and objectives with regards to data integration.  + Excellent oral and written skills and the ability to persuasively articulate ideas to all level of the internal organization  + Ability to work in a dynamic and highly-matrixed organization requiring good skills in critical thinking, influencing, and handling multiple priorities  + Ability to run multiple simultaneous tasks, providing consistent record of all activities, while handling confidential work with discretion  + Travel up to 25%  We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.  For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  About Splunk  Splunk was founded to pursue a disruptive new vision: make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. Machine data is one of the fastest growing and most complex areas of big data?generated by every component of IT infrastructures, applications, mobile phone location data, website clickstreams, social data, sensors, RFID and much more.  Splunk is focused specifically on the challenges and opportunity of taking massive amounts of machine data, and providing powerful insights from that data. IT insights. Security insights. Business insights. It?s what we call Operational Intelligence.  Since shipping its software in 2006, Splunk now has over 13,000 customers in more than 110 countries around the world. These organizations are using Splunk to harness the power of their machine data to deepen business and customer understanding, mitigate cybersecurity risk, prevent fraud, improve service performance and reduce costs. Innovation is in our DNA ? from technology to the way we do business. Splunk is the platform for Operational Intelligence!  Splunk has more than 2,700 global employees, with headquarters in San Francisco, an office in San Jose, CA and regional headquarters in London and Hong Kong.  We?ve built a phenomenal foundation for success with a proven leadership team, highly passionate employees and unique patented software. We invite you to help us continue our drive to define a new industry and become part of an innovative, and disruptive software company.  Benefits & Perks: Wow! This is really cool!  SF Only  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO, sick leave, stocked micro kitchens in Splunk offices, catered lunches on Mondays, catered breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer, ?Fun Fridays?.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Non SF  Medical, full company paid Dental, Vision and Life Insurance, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Commuter Accounts, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), 401(k), 3 weeks of PTO and sick leave. Our work environments vary by location however we believe in hosting amenities and fun activities to fuel our energy. You may find fully stocked micro kitchens, catered lunches on Mondays and breakfast on Fridays, basketball hoops, ping pong, arcade games, BBQ?s, soccer and ?Fun Fridays?.  This isn?t a job ? it?s a life changer ? are you ready?  Individuals seeking employment at Splunk are considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition (except where physical fitness is a valid occupational qualification), genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws. Click here to review the US Department of Labor?s EEO is The Law notice. Please click here to review Splunk?s Affirmative Action Policy Statement.  Splunk does not discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Please click here to review Splunk?s Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision.  Splunk is also committed to providing access to all individuals who are seeking information from our website. Any individual using assistive technology (such as a screen reader, Braille reader, etc.) who experiences difficulty accessing information on any part of Splunk?s website should send comments to accessiblecareers@splunk.com. Please include the nature of the accessibility problem and your e-mail or contact address. If the accessibility problem involves a particular page, the message should include the URL of that page.  Splunk doesn't accept unsolicited agency resumes and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or firm that doesn't have a signed agreement with Splunk.  To check on your application click here.

Name: Business/Data Analyst - Winter Intern (January - April)
Description: Cloud computing is revolutionizing IT and forcing organizations to rethink their approach to cloud security. Lacework is at the forefront of this transformation. We enable security teams to effectively secure the public clouds AWS, Azure or Google by eliminating repetitive, manual and labor-intensive security tasks. Using Lacework, security teams operate security at the same pace as DevOps, which relies on automated tools to publish daily updates to the cloud.We are looking for a Data/Business Analyst who is excited about building an industry leading, next generation Cloud Security System. At Lacework, youll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment while getting a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help shape our technologies, products and business. If you are ready, we have some interesting engineering-challenges ready for you! :-) Have fun while you are solving them!!!During the 12-week internship, you'll be a full-time member of a small Engineering team and paired with a mentor on your team. You will have the guidance, environment, and the responsibility of deploying your projects to production. You will work on real projects, features, and updates that will affect our customers worldwide!Here's what you'll need to be successful:Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related field, with demonstrated software engineering talent and a passion to help further our mission for education at scale.Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship.Must have a legal right to work in the U. S. for the duration of the internship· Strong sense of ownership, customer obsession, and drive Comfortable to write code in at least one programming language.Familiarity with some programming language and business reporting tools.Bonus points if you have the following:Prior internship experience where you have demonstrated an ability to work in teams, problem solve and communicate effectively regarding technical projectsUse statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful business reportsUse data to create models that depict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a wholeCollecting and interpreting dataStrong sense of ownership, customer obsession, and driveSharp analytical abilities and proven design skillsExperience in data modeling and analysis, especially with distinctive data sourcesDemonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practicesDemonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast-paced environmentLacework is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of Lacework to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons, regardless of age, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, political affiliations, marital status, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, age, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, or on the basis of personal favoritism or other non-merit factors, except where otherwise provided by law.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for analyzing data to identify data quality issues and recommend the best course of action to address them. The position is responsible for various analysis required on a regular basis from other teams in the organization.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:Brainstorm broad concepts and ideas of various reporting designs, both individually and with the team, and translate those into a consumable, tangible objective.Assist with data identification, data acquisition, data cleansing, data preparation, completeness testing, data loading, etc.Write scripts to analyze data based on business rules for ad-hoc analytics projects and/or development and implementation of reusable data analysis tools.Create business and functional specifications at the level necessary to extend or customize existing proof of concept product.Gather requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements, workshops, business process descriptions, use business case scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Develop project documentation, testing materials, training materials, requirements gathering including downstream and upstream interface requirements and adhering to a project management methodology is a must.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.Perform basic statistical analyses for projects and reports.QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Quantitative Analysis, or equivalent.Minimum of 2 years of related experience such as SQL script, data structure and data analysis.Experience with BI and ETL tools such as QlikView, Pentaho, etc.Experience working with Qlikview to develop Rapid applications, Proof of Concepts and mockups.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:Understand business requirements, business processes and data sources and define project objectives accordingly.Strong knowledge of Data Management Techniques and Key Performance Metrics. Ability to filter and clean data, and review reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code and data source problems.Communication Skills: The ability to translate the data into an understandable insight and present complex information simply, easily, and clearly. The individual should be able to story-tell with data, form relationships with all key stakeholders and tailor communication styles to specific audience needs.Critical Thinking: Analyze numbers, uncover trends, and draw conclusions based on the findings. Leverage problem solving skills and frameworks to develop solutions. Reconcile data conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, and take low-level information up to a more general understanding.Good work ethics and the ability to work effectively under pressure with tight deadlines.Ability to work in a team and interact with developers in distributed work environments.Ability to define problems, collect and reconcile data, validate data against source informationMotivated, shows initiative, and ability to work in fast paced environment.Drive for Results (Service, Quality, and Continuous Improvement).Commitment to the successful achievement of team and organizational goals.Demonstrate a focus on listening to and understanding client/customer needs and then delighting the client/customer by exceeding service and quality expectations.PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT:Duties are typically performed in an office setting.This position requires the ability to use a computer keyboard, communicate over the telephone and read printed material.Duties may require working outside normal working hours (evenings and weekends) at time.Travel required for this position:No or Yes : If yes state anticipated percent for travel: Travel rarely required (0-5%).

Name: People Operations Analyst
Description: What We Are About:The People Department prides itself on being the backbone of the company. As key communications strategists between different teams, we strive to maintain Illumio's mission and values through our client-facing efforts.What You Will Accomplish:Perform regular system maintenance, including system upgrades through researching new functionalities and conducting testingOwn Global processing of new hires, rehires, conversions, transfers, department/manager/salary changes, terminations, etc.Maintain electronic employee files and recordsTroubleshoot user issues and advise as appropriateCreate how-to guides on common issues and system updatesWork with third party vendors to ensure system integrations and EDIs are created, tested, and work properly.Develop and maintain various reports for HR and PayrollPartner with stakeholders to gather, understand and document reporting needs.Partner with Payroll team for pre- and post-process of incoming new hires, outgoing exits, and employee changes.Partner with benefit providers to ensure timely data entry into various systems is accurate.Conduct audits to ensure data integrity, as well as general HR compliance auditsRespond to requests for data from state and local agencies for HR compliance purposesForm I-9 maintenance and complianceAssist with incoming inquiries and issues via ticketing systemHave fun and help your team have fun!What You Will Bring:ADP proficiency! And a broad understanding of and strong experience in custom reporting, custom fields, business processes, and security.Strong technical skills, with a good understanding and working knowledge of HR operations and complianceKnowledge of HR administration and HRIS. Minimum of 2 years of hands on experience in reporting.Strong proficiency with MS Office, advance MS Excel skill a must.Knowledge of business processes, security, EDIs, and reporting is required.Bonus Points:Typically requires a BA/BS degree, preferably with an emphasis in HR Information Systems, information technology or HR, and minimum of 4 years of relevant experience.Good verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills are required. Requires strong analytical and technical skills with a good understanding and working knowledge of Human Resources operations.Must be able to exercise judgement and independently determine and take appropriate action with defined HR policies and procedures.Works under general direction from immediate manager.Who We AreIllumio, the leader in micro-segmentation, prevents the spread of breaches inside data center and cloud environments. For more information, visit our What We Do page or follow us @Illumio.

Name: Staff Business Analyst
Description: Job ID  Requisition Id:- 14167 Job Description We are looking for an analytical supply chain individual to join our operations team. The ideal candidate will have a high level of independent judgment, acute business acumen, an incredible attention to detail and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment both in a team setting and autonomously. The primary responsibility of this role is to analyze, plan and implement supply chain optimization strategies to minimize cost while also providing world-class customer support for a portion of the Cypress product portfolio. To successfully perform this responsibility, the individual will consistently be evaluating and improvement of supply chain processes, managing financial and customer support metrics, and interacting with internal and external members of the global manufacturing teams. The individual will be deeply involved with the all steps of the semiconductor supply chain, including the wafer FAB, subcontractors, and back end manufacturing teams. In this role, the individual will receive general supervision from their direct manager and will frequently interact with upper levels of management.  DECISION MAKING: Supply planning with a mentality of perfect delivery at minimal cost. Prioritize tasks consistent with meeting overall supply management organizational goals.  PROBLEM SOLVING: Apply appropriate benchmarks, financial analysis, and risk management techniques to solve complex issues. Ability to influence diverse group of people to achieve solutions beneficial for Cypress. SkillsBS/BA degree plus 2-5 years of experience in a semiconductor or similar business or MS plus 1-3 years of experienceSpecific education in Supply Chain Management (SCM) or Industrial EngineeringComplete knowledge of operational processes & conceptsAPICS certification preferred (but not required)Intermediate/Advanced proficiency in Excel Note  Cypress is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, physical or mental disability, or status as a Protected Veteran. TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: Cypress Semiconductor does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Cypress Semiconductors employees or any other company location. Cypress Semiconductor is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  Nearest Major Market: San Jose  Nearest Secondary Market: Palo Alto  Job Segment: Business Analyst, Engineer, Risk Management, Supply, Finance, Engineering, Operations, TechnologySDL2017

Drive major cross-functional initiatives that are enabled through core CRM functionality. Responsibilities include functional expertise in the CRM, and other sales processes.  Essential Functions:  Partner with Sales, Business Operations, CRM, OTC, global business owners to address process improvement and drive efficiency  Take complete ownership of the business deliverables including any customizations and enhancements in the Sales CRM/CPQ areas. Reduce cycle time and improve through put and delivery of the IT development team  Ability to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT partners. Should be quickly able to understand and evaluate the challenges  Participate, influence and drive cross-functional projects that impact the Sales CRM processes.  Drive continuous process improvements and operational efficiencies across sales, primarily in CRM area. Also, drive Sales and Sales Operations initiatives in an effort to make the systems and processes more reliable, predictable and efficient  Good communication is a must. Dealing with business partner is very important aspect of this role.  Managing and coordination of the Regression and User acceptance testing with the users  Collaborate with key business stakeholders, IT, external partners and third-party software vendors to implement effective and resilient solutions  Able to juggle multiple projects & tasks and successfully prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interests  Proactively refine upstream solutions to avoid downstream business or IT process and data issues  Undertake post-implementation business support and troubleshoot and resolve systems issues working with the IT support team  Nice to have third party software experience related to CRM  Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills . Requirements: Requires 6-8 years of business operations experience of which at least 5 years mainly in CRM with a focus on gathering requirements, process improvements and solution design. Extensive experience as a business process analyst in the sales organization, with CRM as the core. Strong business partnership experience required, with proven track record of successfully driving cross-functional initiatives, enhancements and support issues. Exposure to a third party CRM (ie. Dynamics, SAP CRM, SFDC) is a must. Interested candidates submit your resume to preritas@abovoinc.com or call me at 669-231-0354.

Name: Financial Analyst, US Sales Finance FP&A
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global dedication to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  US Channel Sales Finance is seeking a team-oriented finance professional with a distinctive analytic mind to join our FP&A team. Based in Cupertino, FP&A team serves as the hub of financial information that the US Channel business relies upon in decision-making, from forecasting investment for specific sales programs and its impact, to managing operational expense and its rationale across the division. This team has the unique ability to participate in all financial aspects of steering US Channel business.  Strong Finance background with FP&A experience of minimum 5 years  Proven advanced Excel skills required  Experience with integrated accounting systems (SAP) and other reporting tools (Essbase, Business Objects, Tableau, FileMaker) preferred  High level of integrity, attention to details, enthusiasm, and agility  Ability to set priorities and to navigate to get things done  Proven ability to build relationships and effectively influence business partners  Prepare quarterly/semi-annual Sales compensation targets in an accurate and timely manner, analyze the effectiveness of program in driving optimal sales performance  Responsible for forecasting and monitoring actuals, specific to Cost of Sales, Headcount, and Operating Expense, put together and present the deliverables including variance analysis to Corporate FP&A  Drive quarterly closing process for correct and sound financial recording, in collaboration with Shared Services and Corporate Finance groups  Support US Sales annual strategic planning, by providing Financial modeling of Revenue, COS, OPEX, HC by Line of Business, or by Route-to-Market  Identify process improvement opportunities implement new/innovative approach  Build and publish management reporting on various financial metrics to US Channel Sales leadership, example being merchandizing and staffing program ROI Education & Experience Bachelor's degree in Finance or Accounting  MBA and/or CPA preferred

Name: Payments Analyst
Description: Role SummaryeBay is diversifying payments, this role will be power Payments ecosystem by providing insights to executive leadership, analytics related to fraud solutions, value proposition and innovation related to the overall customer experience for eBay!Role DescriptionLooking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If youre interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay a company you can be proud to be a part of.The Global Payments, Billing & Risk (GPBR) function at eBay works to ensure great experiences when buyers and sellers come together and engage in commerce on the biggest marketplace in the world. This involves comprehensively understanding Payments & Risks on eBay. Identifying the opportunity areas and helping build scalable solutions to drive great user experience. Analytics is a critical need for each area. Core analytics capabilities include the ability to instrument right KPIs, identify the landscape of entire function, figure out opportunities for improvement work with product and payment providers to craft scalable solutions, and monitor their performance. The GPBR Analytics and Insights team builds this behavioral intelligence by exploring innovative interpretations of existing and new sources of data, using advanced analytical techniques, and overlaying the appropriate strategies to deliver world-class results. The group is multi-disciplinary with broad spectrum of industry experiences and deep analytical and quantitative expertise. The group is currently seeking a high energy, driven, collaborative team member that brings extensive problem solving skills to further its goal of applying cutting-edge analytics, Insights and visualization to drive payments roadmap.The role is data and analytically intensive. Successful candidates should be quick learners, strategic thinkers, operational and execution driven facilitators, problem solvers, and have an entrepreneurial spirit. This role is heavily cross-functional and ideal for candidates who enjoy both defining and solving complex problems, while getting deeply involved in the classification domain and product partners. Skills in problem definition, rigorous analysis, and recommendation development will also be critical as well as demonstration of exceptional interpersonal skills, initiative and integrity.ResponsibilitiesDevelop a deep understanding of Payments ecosystemStructure complex, ambiguous business questions and utilize analytical skills to synthesize actionable insights to the benefit of leaders in the organizationDiscover new opportunities to grow and optimize the business through analytics, financial modeling, and business case development.Design, plan, and execute methodologies to measure successes of business initiatives.Collaborate with other analysts/data scientists and help guide strategy based on learning from other analyses/projects across the organizationPerform ad-hoc analysis and product performance analysis as neededCreate and maintain insightful automated reports and dashboards utilizing typical data quality functions (e.g. standardization, consistency, etc.)Work closely across the matrix with teams like Finance, Marketing, Product, Engineering and senior executivesQualificationsBachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS or other quantitative fields3+ years of professional experience in using data to facilitate business decisionsExtensive experience in BI/DW best practicesExperience in efficient manipulation and analysis of large data setsProficiency in databases (SQL), and programming languages (at least one of following: Python, R, Ruby, Java, etc)Exceptionally attentive to detail and embracing of teamworkPeople-oriented; eager to build positive and productive relationships with a variety of stakeholdersExperience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends and using a multitude of disparate data sources and toolsAbility to shift priorities quickly, while maintaining a high degree of organization and controlThis website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookiesView our privacy policyView our accessibility infoeBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.For more information see:EEO is the Law PosterEEO is the Law Poster Supplement

Name: Senior IT Business Solution Analyst
Description: General Purpose of the Job: The IT Business Analyst (ITBA) has the overall responsibility to serve as the strategic interface with assigned business units or functional area for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery, service management, risk management and relationship management. The ITBA provides highly valued strategic consulting level support and guidance through key IT initiatives. They communicate decisions, priorities and relevant project information to appropriate levels of staff regarding business unit requests and projects and initiatives. They proactively share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to build competitive advantage and improve efficiency and effectiveness of business units. They partner with business leadership and other key stakeholders to define opportunities and identify and prioritize projects based on predefined criteria (e.g. return on investment, productivity, compliance). The ITBA proactively serves as a “trusted advisor,” and is the primary IT point of contact to business. They operate as the key business contact representing IT in promoting IT services and capabilities. The ITBA provides support in delivering technology products that meet the needs of the business. The ITBA focuses on strategic initiatives and planning activities for their business area. They strive to understand market challenges, including customer priorities and competitive issues. ITBAs are proactive and anticipatory in their thinking. They are, by nature, driven and provide significant value to business units. ITBA’s facilitate the investment intake process and the high level planning and execution of business initiatives through the use of technology. They serve a lead role in enabling the business to achieve their objectives through the effective use of technology.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:- Responsible for the development and implementation of solution roadmaps and to ensure successful introductions across the organization and with customers.- Develop solution concepts and business cases for new investments. - Perform business analysis and prepare recommendations and business plans as needed. - Create and analyze relevant information and develop recommendations that they present to management.- Act as the key liaison across all functional areas, including business units, the information technology department, and outside vendors. - Possess a broad knowledge of most technical and business resources and use them to effectively coordinate team members and external resources.- Create shared vision of their respective solutions and facilitate decision making and arbitration relating to trade-offs both within and between different solution platforms.- Create consensus with other functions as to the timing of solution introductions and withdrawals.- Oversee the launch of solutions and help to maximize the positive impact on the organization.- Identify, screen and evaluate new solution opportunities to address unmet (internal and external) customer needs.- Partner with key staff members to create strategic business plans.- Possess strong analytical skills, including an understanding of business economics and financial resources.- Utilize the appropriate technologies and ensure that customers have the solutions they need, when they need them, and in the media best suited to their requirements.- Collaborate with architecture and operations teams to ensure solution compatibility with company standards.- Collaborate with the Project Management Office on the intake process and prioritization of candidate projects across the company.OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:- Participate in strategic and budgetary planning processes, prepare and administer work unit operating budgets; provide recommendations on desired policies and goals and implement new/revised programs according to established guidelines.- Participate in field research in pursuit of new so

Name: Senior Retail Financial Analyst
Description: SummaryDo you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. Finance is critical to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. Apple Retail is seeking an analytical and creative thinker to help us provide strategic financial support for key technology initiatives and help set the future roadmap of the world’s most successful retailer. If you are a big picture thinker with a strong analytical background, can anticipate the needs of your business and enjoy putting ideas into motion, this role may be for you. As a finance partner for Apple Retail you will be responsible for outlining the technology capital investment portfolio to support our long term strategy. 5+ years of relevant experience in a high performance and high growth organization Strong knowledge of Excel. Project management, enterprise software (e.g. SAP), Filemaker, and Tableau experience a plus Proven track record of completing challenging projects, managing multiple priorities, and building effective business partnerships Think analytically and understand the business Experience in FP&A or Finance Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate results Thrive in a demanding and quickly-changing environment Desire to learn and grow in a hardworking, collaborative environment Apple Retail Finance is looking for a highly motivated analyst to support decision making for technology investments. Based in Cupertino, this role will work directly with all teams across Retail, and across all levels of the organization, including senior leadership. This position plays an integral part supporting and analyzing Apple Retail’s technology capital investment portfolio and roadmap, directly impacting Retail’s key long term strategies. The role will support the financial due diligence modeling as well as the prioritization for both Online and Stores technology projects. Primary responsibilities include: Cultivate business partnerships to develop start-to-finish understanding of financial and non financial returns for technology projectsPro-forma analysis of investments; contribute valuable insights to help inform the project approval process as well as ongoing performance once the project is live Develop actionable analysis and forum with senior leadership to prioritize the existing project portfolio while highlighting business changes in real time Understand the qualitative aspects of projects, and how they can help impact the decision making process Create technology investment portfolio pro forma analytics and report overall portfolio performance to senior Retail leadership Planning for, reporting on, and analysis of IS&T supported capital and operational expenses worldwide Education & ExperienceBS/BA or equivalent in business or related field.

Name: Channel Operations Analyst
Description: Zoom is the world leader in video communications with the highest customer satisfaction in our industry. We have been expanding rapidly since our Series D investment from Sequoia at a $1 billion valuation. Zoom was recently awarded the 5th Best SMB Company to Work for in the United States by Glassdoor (based on anonymous employee reviews). Now is the time to join our team of motivated and passionate people as Zoom grows to provide frictionless communications for businesses and organizations across the world. Visit zoom.us and follow us on Twitter (@zoom_us) and Facebook (Zoom Video Communications).Responsibilities:Serve as a trusted advisor representing the partner organization and sustain alignment across internal stakeholders as required to grow and scale the partner organization and operational support. Drive development and ongoing measurement of the Partner performance and impact on the Zoom business. Includes definition of KPIs, development of dashboards and reporting and driving reviews with key business partners. Liaise with the appropriate teams to develop robust, end-to-end partner operations process, including but not limited to lead to quote, partner applications and contracts, and partner order process and program support. Project management to support key initiatives associated with partner operations revenue recognition, including drafting and maintaining business requirements to consistently optimize and integrate numerous internal systems of record delivering a source of truth for partner business management and growth Liaise with the systems Team to develop the requirements and workflows that support CRM management of our partner ecosystem. Collaborate with order desk operations to ensure order processes across various partner types are understood and optimized. (Channel Reseller, ISV, Referrals). Lead applicable initiatives to automate where possible. Oversee partner account and opportunity management (e.g. ensure partner tagging, CRM record compliance, etc.) Ensure fluid and timely partner registration and acceptance workflow, compliance, tracking and drive any needed changes to support business efficiency and/or automation Lead projects that deconstruct and solve complex platform provisioning and/or payout, billing issues Requirements:BA/BS degree required 5-8 years of partner operations experience preferably in a SaaS/cloud companyComfortable engaging at all levels in an organization to deliver resultsExcellent communicator with proven ability to clearly convey ideas and information in written and verbal form to a variety of audiences Demonstrated skills in positioning and differentiating program benefits broadly to a partner communityHighly motivated, self-directed individual who thrives in a fast-paced team environmentExcellent organizational skills with attention to detail: ability to manage multiple priorities in parallelExperience in Channel Program/Sales Operations is mustSalesforce.com experience is must and Domo Visualization skills are plusExperience working in small, startup environments with building processes and functions from scratch Check us out with a free download:zoom.us/downloadZoom Video Communications is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of an individuals age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status. Our combined differences are what make us Zoom!

Name: HR Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: IT Business Systems Analyst - HR (Contract) Location: San Jose, CA Duration: 6 Months Contract Job Description: The essential functions listed are not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. All employees must work in accordance with Client Standards. Gather, analyze and document Client’s business and functional requirements from clinical staff, Operations and business users Analyze, document, and improve workflows, processes, and standards Understand business process management to elicit and gather customer business requirements and translate them to specific software requirements Communicate effectively with internal teams and external clients to deliver functional requirements including GUI, screen and interface designs Act as an experienced interface between business units, technology teams and support teams Provide technical guidance concerning business implications of application development projects Communicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions Manage client expectations effectively Lead work with Quality Assurance to build and validate test cases against all requirements Analyze application defects to determine if they fall within scope of project requirements Lead post-project analysis to reflect upon successes, failures, and lessons learned Facilitate SCRUM daily meetings Responsible for driving the Client’s culture through values and customer service standards Accountable for outstanding customer service to all external and internal customers Develops and maintains effective relationships through effective and timely communication Takes initiative and action to respond, resolve and follow up regarding customer service issues with all customers in a timely manner. Saas, HRIS, Finance, HR, Legal, Sales & Marketing
