Name: Sr. Finance Business Systems Analyst
Description: Who We Are: Malwarebytes is the next-gen cybersecurity company that millions worldwide trust. Malwarebytes proactively protects people and businesses against dangerous threats such as malware, ransomware, and exploits that escape detection by traditional antivirus solutions. The company's flagship product combines advanced heuristic threat detection with signatureless technologies to detect and stop a cyberattack before damage occurs. More than 10,000 businesses worldwide use, trust, and recommend Malwarebytes. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in California, with offices in Europe and Asia, and a global team of threat researchers and security experts.  We've created a fantastic culture that our employees love and were recently named in the top 10 of Fortune Magazine's Great Place to Work list. We're pretty proud of all that too. We're growing fast and are looking for some great people to join us. Who We Need: As Malwarebytes continues to expand the product and client base, The Information technology group is absolutely vital in building business applications that fuel the Organization's growth. To support such growth, we are looking for an energetic Senior Finance Business Analyst/Developer to join our team.  As a Senior Finance Business Analyst/Developer, you will be an integral member of the CIO team working with peers (internal and external) to develop and maintain Financial systems and will work closely with the business stakeholders to ensure our technology aligns with their requirements and will support the growth of the organization. What You'll Do: Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage the NetSuite and other finance applications  Participate in technical design sessions; develop detailed technical solution documentation and recommend suitable architecture that is aligned with business objectives  Develop, test, and document working custom development, integrations, and data migration elements of a NetSuite and other financial systems implementation  Bring your industry expertise (P2P,R2R, O2C) and ideas to help solve problems in innovative ways  Execute test plans to ensure a quality solution is delivered  Participate in code reviews for ongoing projects to ensure that code quality is at the highest level possible and appropriate design patterns are being used  Provide detailed estimates and work breakdown structure for assigned tasks  Lead two to three developers and produce much needed project deliverables Skills You'll Need to Have: Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent.  Six to 8 years of Procure to Pay (P2P), Record to Report (R2R) and Finance analytics experience is must  Minimum 6 years of ERP platform (Oracle EBS, NetSuite, Microsoft Dynamics) development experience is must  Manage all Financial system projects, by working closely with the Finance and Accounting teams to identify project requirements, work with our internal IT and external consultants on implementation and ensure projects are successfully completed on time.  Lead the testing efforts for all system updates including analyzing updates to determine impacts and then coordinating and managing testing  Review financial and accounting processes to identify areas for improvement and then work with the Finance and Accounting teams to address these pain points from both a system and process standpoint  Manage and support 3rd party applications/integrations such as Avalara, Nexonia, Adaptive Insights and internal Business Intelligence systems  Work with the team to build and maintain dashboards and other reporting  Provides assistance to internal employees by troubleshooting and quickly resolving issues with the Financial systems  Background in development of enterprise systems as part of a complete software product lifecycle  Led the team of onsite and offshore resources to deliver solutions  Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies such as Scrum  Effective communicator that works well in a collaborative team setting  NetSuite experience is preferred  Knowledge of Order to Cash process and Salesforce is a plus  Nice. Fun. Happy. (we have a firewall keeping mean, boring and angry people out) What We Offer: An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the world  A great work environment that supports growth and development  Competitive compensation and benefit packages  401(k) matching program  Open time off policy  Stocked kitchen with healthy (and some unhealthy) drinks, snacks, fruit and lunch options  A company who enjoys having fun; holiday and summer parties, and lots of other great stuff!

Name: Senior Data Business Analyst
Description: Senior Data and Business Analyst  Santa Clara, CAThis position reports to: Director, Operational Analytics  ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.  We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.  We are looking for an experienced Data and Business Analyst to join our Operational Analytics team. The Analyst is mainly responsible for analyzing KPIs, reviewing business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational risks, identify opportunities for improved data quality and efficiency, and become the company’s data expert – understanding relationships between tables and systems. They should have strong communication skills and an ability to understand and present complex analysis to all levels. Responsibilities will include activities from leading small to mid-size projects as well as working cross functionally assisting other project managers on larger, more complex projects.  We have a tight team environment where support, loyalty, and honest feedback are the currency. ServiceNow employees are expected to be self-starting, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.  Role:  We are looking for talented individuals with a strategic viewpoint who are able to grow and adapt along with our fast-paced business. You have to be passionate about working with data, be energized by business leaders gaining insight from your reporting and analysis, and be detail-oriented.  Our Business and Data Analysts are responsible for applying a breadth of data extraction, data cleansing, and analytic techniques to answer a wide range of business questions and drive operational improvements. They are effective communicators capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to a range of audiences. Responsibilities will include supporting ServiceNow internal operational groups such as Product Development, Engineering and Customer Support. Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The Lead Business Analyst acts as a facilitator and liaison across functional teams and ANSYS IT for all aspects of the development of functional roadmaps that include People, Process and Technology changes. This role aligns strategic goals and objectives with decisions regarding the alignment of capabilities and corresponding investments in key initiatives. The role will partner with the PMO, Application and Functional teams to drive the development of initiative roadmaps. The primary focus is the business motivations, business operations and business analysis frameworks that link these aspects of an enterprise together. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain strong partnerships with key business stakeholders and team members.Develop business architecture strategy based on understanding of business strategies and business value of key initiatives.Apply a structured business architectural approach and methodology for capturing key initiatives for the enterprise.Capture enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide governance in terms of progress toward goals.Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities and functional units and the decomposition of those functions into subunits.Assist with quantifying business benefit and pre-project business solution design.Identify functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies that may exist in role alignment, process gaps and overlaps and business capability maturity gaps.Conduct business process modeling and document AS-IS and TO-BE models.Responsible for discovering, gathering, documenting, and vetting high level business and functional requirements for new projects and processes to assess impacts across the enterprise.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degreeMinimum 10 years of experience in Business Analysis, Business Process and/or ITMinimum 10 years developing Functional Specifications, Process Flows and Use CasesMinimum 10 years of experience conducting requirement analysis, solving business problems, assessing technical capabilities, and documenting solutionsPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSound analytical and problem solving skillsStrong ability to think strategically across the enterpriseBusiness Architecture experience preferredPortfolio Management experience a plusStrong presentation and communication skills which will include organizing meetings with varied participants from multiple functions across the businessMinimal travelCULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company: Customer focusResults and AccountabilityInnovationTransparency and IntegrityMasteryInclusivenessSense of urgencyCollaboration and Teamwork ANSYS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.  ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.SDL2017

Name: Senior Business Strategy Analyst
Description: The Toyota Research Institute (TRI) is an R&D enterprise designed to bridge the gap between fundamental research and product development. It has been launched with mandates to (1) enhance the safety of automobiles, with the ultimate goal of creating a car that is incapable of causing a crash; (2) increase access to cars to those who otherwise cannot drive, including those with disabilities and the elderly; (3) help translate outdoor mobility technology into products for indoor mobility; and (4) accelerate scientific discovery by applying techniques from artificial intelligence and machine learning. Toyota believes artificial intelligence has significant potential to improve the quality of life for all people, bringing ease, comfort and safety to all aspects of life.TRIs robotics team is building technology that improves the quality of human life through artificial intelligence and robotics. The team is developing robotic technologies that can assist in homes and making breakthroughs in perception and manipulation that will allow robots to detect, grasp and lift objects within the home. We are looking for an experienced Business Strategy Analyst to identify and refine business opportunities for the technology we are creating.Responsibilities:Lead market research and analysis for new product area explorations; collect and interpret relevant dataDevelop key sector-specific insights, strategies, and high-level opportunities; size markets; identify trends; develop competitive insightsDevelop and critically assess viability of business modelsCollaborate with engineering and user research teams to synthesize cross-team insightsCollaborate with and support product teams from development through launchDevelop business strategy practice within companyQualifications:Excellent social and communication skillsExcellent written skills; ability to clearly and compellingly articulate insights, strategy, and new opportunities in written and presentation formExcellent software modeling skillsExperience designing or assessing business models and writing business plansExperience with early stage ventures and new product introductionMBA preferred5+ years of experience in a related positionTRI provides Equal Employment Opportunity without regard to the applicant's race, color, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, religion, marital status, genetic information, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.

Description: Scientific Data Analyst and Programmer  Stanford University Duties and Responsibilities  The Scientific Data Analyst and Programmer responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Program and optimize pipelines for data quality control, imaging data preprocessing, and statistical and computational analyses pipelines for large-scale multimodal brain imaging data, including but not limited to resting state and task based fMRI, diffusion MRI, and volumetric data, behavioral data, and biological (e.g. hormonal, genetic data.Maintain detailed logs of work flow, generated codes and scripts, and documentation of processesCreate and manage best practices for data organization and workflow proceduresImplement publicly available processing and analyses pipelines such as the Human Connectome Project.Implement data visualization programs on neuroimaging, behavioral, and biological dataProcess and analyze neuroimaging, behavioral, and biological data working closely with other lab membersWork closely with lab members on data requests and system upgrades.Assist in the creation and maintenance of lab databases, query tools for data mining, coordination of data integration from multiple ongoing studies, and documentation of these tools.Train other lab members on quality control and preprocessing of neuroimaging data.Communicate and document all issues and concerns as they arise to PIs and other relevant research staff Required Qualifications B.A., B.S. required. Masters or PhD preferred with background in biomedical engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, computational neuroscience, quantitative psychology, or related subject.Salary will be commensurate with relevant experience and education.Strong programming skills and comfort with diverse computing environments (e.g. Matlab, Python, UNIX/BASH languages).Strong background in statistics and statistical software scripting (e.g. R, Python).Experience with data visualization.Strong interpersonal skills and a high level of organization with careful attention to detail are absolutely required.High degree of motivation, organization, and selfŠ\sufficiency, although some training and supervision will be provided. Additional Qualifications Experience with databases (neuroimaging, biological, and behavioral) is an advantage.Experience with network analyses, machine learning and modeling confer a significant advantage.Familiarity with the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) is an advantage. Proficiency with multiple neuroimaging analysis platforms (e.g. HCP Pipeline, FreeSurfer, SPM, FSL, AFNI, GIFT, TrackVis, CONN, etc.) is an advantage.  To view the full application and other opportunities, visit: https://med.stanford.edu/scsnl/faculty.html  Copyright ©2017 Jobelephant.com Inc. All rights reserved. Name: Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst
Description: 10x Genomics is a Bay Area start-up developing new technologies for breakthrough next generation sequencing applications. The core technology combines advances in chemistry, biochemistry, microfluidics and computational biology. Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst By joining 10x Genomics, you can become an integral part of helping enable our customers expand the ways they explore, discover, process and innovate in the field of genomics.  We are seeking an experienced, collaborative and results-oriented individual to join our 10X team as Financial Systems & Business Intelligence Analyst, reporting to Senior Director of FP&A. This position is a hybrid of financial planning & commercial analysis and system savvy data analytics covering data collection, analysis and report design, with approximately 50% financial/commercial analysis and 50% reporting and system related work. The ideal candidate has an FP&A background with strong system skills, and can bring analytical rigor, business intelligence, and report writing skills to enhance our dashboards and other analytic capacity to drive the business forward. The candidate will interact with various functional organizations.  Individuals applying for this position must be analytical, critical thinkers who can see the bigger business picture but at the same time detail-oriented with efficient report development skills and must be action driven, flexible in changing direction and methods, thrive in a fast-paced environment, excel at managing multiple priorities, succeed in communicating with all levels within the organization and provide immediate contribution.  Key ResponsibilitiesAnalyze complex business problems using data from multiple internal systems and external sources to provide insight to decision-makersIdentify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets to identify key influencers, ahead of the curve, to our fast-paced businessDesign, maintain and deliver key performance dashboards and financial metrics/reports, through automation. This includes;Work cross-departmentally to create specifications for reports and analysis, automate and develop schedules for KPI metrics, and ensure all deadlines and deliverables are metDevelop, implement and optimize data management processes to design elegant reporting and analytics solutionsEvaluate and resolve for integrity of data interfaces, mapping and data field usage among different systems, as needed, in order to support the above tasks Required Skills and BackgroundBachelor's degree in Finance or Business administrationAdditional degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, Business Analytics or related fieldFinance and/or Marketing backgroundDemonstrated hands on experience with reporting tools (Qlik and/or Tableau are strongly preferred) and ExcelStrong analytical skills with a proven ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information3-5 years of Business Intelligence experience with an emphasis on analytical and reporting tools with databases, including data visualization, quantitative analysis and logical reasoningProficiency with Microsoft Office Products and query languages, such as SQLERP, CRM and simple databases experience (NetSuite and com desirable)Experience working with DataMart development, data mappingsThe ability to engage in active dialogue with enterprise stakeholders and data providers is central to success in this roleBasic understanding and experience applying statistics to business problemsDesired Skills and BackgroundMBA a plusSuperior multi-tasking skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented and dynamic environmentAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Name: Sr. Sales Business Analyst
Description: NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. Nvidia is a “learning machine” that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to solve, that only we can pursue, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work, to amplify human creativity and intelligence. Make the choice to join us today. We are looking for a Sr. Sales Business Analyst.What you’ll be doing:You will partner with leaders from sales, service and operations teams to gain in-depth understanding of the strategy, processes, products, services, and roadmap. You will define, build and operationalize key processes, including: service request routing, sales opportunity management, quote to cash processes, analytics, and knowledgebase management. This role requires working across business organizations and levels including functional and technology leadership, software architects, developers, product management. This role will be tightly integrated with our agile development process.Work hand in hand with the business to design efficient processes, define comprehensive business requirements, make the business case for applications or features that support our operations, and partner with development to enable these capabilities.Apply understanding of salesforce.com in solutioning of business requirements.Be responsible for systems roll-out and change management, including new process definition, UAT, training, go-live, and adoption. Establish the key success metrics and goals for your applications.What we need to see:Bachelor's degree, preferably in business, economics, finance or comparable discipline and 7+ years of sales operations, service operations or consulting experienceYou possess strong knowledge of Salesforce.com Service and Sales Cloud functions – CPQ, associated data models, and community cloud administrationSalesforce.com certification helpfulYou balance deep understanding of systems with strong business sense to understand business needs, flows, systems, drivers, and processes.Experience with moving business teams to or using the Salesforce.com new user interface (Lightning) preferredAbility to lead challenging work in a dynamic environmentYou have experience in a dynamic, global, matrix organizationWays to stand out from the crowd:Enjoy working in a fast pace environment with multiple priorities, and an ambiguous yet creative work environmentAn obvious passion for getting things done in fast-paced sales and technology environmentSelf-motivated, high EQ, can work within anyone from SVP to field salesExperience working internationallyYou're a self starter with a mindset for growth and continuous learningNVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and talented people on the planet working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!Location: based in Santa Clara, CANVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Data Integrity Business Analyst
Description: Summary At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. If you are a self-motivated, high-energy individual who is not afraid of challenges, we’re looking for you. Apple is seeking a tried Data Integrity Business Analyst to join the Apple Media Products Analytics and Data Products team. The Data Integrity Business Analyst plays a meaningful role in defining data integrity framework, enabling process to measure and monitor data integrity, tracking data integrity issues to resolution.  8+ years of industry experience passionate about improving quality of the data in big data environment.  Experienced in coordinating multi-functional activities between QA, Engineering, Business, Legal etc.  Experienced in data integrity issue management - define & monitor KPIs, recommend changes to improve data integrity, reduce cost from issues.  Experienced in data quality issue tracking and resolution activities end to end (impact analysis, root cause analysis, data analysis etc.).  Reciprocal; able to build consensus and drive valuable meetings among multi-functional teams while also meaningful assumptions in a relevant way.  You have proven analytical and logic abilities.  Strategic thinker with the ability to see the big picture while working with ambiguity and uncertainty.  Validated ability to capture and analyze large amounts of data at a macro and micro level.  Consistent focus on training and improving existing processes.  Experience in working with ETL applications, data pipelines, and Big Data.  Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.  Data Integrity Framework  Data Integrity Business Analyst will assist the data integrity program manager in the development and execution of a comprehensive data integrity framework.  Define process for monitoring, measuring, and reporting compliance with acceptable levels of data quality (completeness, validity, consistency, timeliness, and accuracy).  Create new KPIs and measures as well as designing interactive dashboards for technology implementations that helps the business understand state of quality and impact to the business.  Requirements Gathering & Data Integrity Solution Implementation  Define a template to gather data quality requirements, oversee the definition of data quality requirements based on known business requirements, data quality issues, data quality resolution plan, and technology.  Collaborate with Engineering to implement the solution (prevention, detection, monitoring and alerting) specific to data quality requirements.  Conduct end to end data and requirements analysis in order to understand the transformational and data processing lifecycles as the data migrates throughout the enterprise architecture. Candidate should be able to analyze data and identify any functional gaps based on data quality exceptions generated through Data quality tool/ solutions.  Issue Management Data Integrity Exceptions  Responsibilities include the Data Quality Issue Management, supporting all efforts and endeavors related to providing visibility about data issues and tracking the remediation efforts.  The issue management includes creating, supporting and evolving reports that has KPIs and measurements about the overall status and health of the data.  Develop data quality scorecard, issue dashboard.  Classify root causes, conduct and organize sessions with SMEs to discuss or brainstorm the process gaps, solution gaps and present recommendations to permanently solve the problem.  Focus and support all aspects of data quality issue management and improvement, exception handling and alerting process.  Training and Documentation  Work with data integrity manager to promote data integrity best practices, create data integrity training, root cause analysis training and create templates and validations for data owners to use.  Create documentation, perform knowledge transfer and cross training for partners to develop new data quality rules as well as help data stewards tasked with remediating data quality issues.  Produce and distribute daily/weekly team status reports or scorecards as well as give to project status reporting depending on the undertaking at and assist with any management reporting.  Additional Requirements NICE TO HAVE Six Sigma Certification  Knowledge of building dashboards using Tableau, Qlikview or similar tools  Knowledge of spark, scala, HDFS, Hive  Knowledge of Data Integration tools, SQL, Talend, BI tools. Education & Experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Information Systems.

Name: Senior Business Data Analyst
Description: OverviewAs members of the People and Places team, we are stewards of Intuit's greatest strategic asset: Our People. Our mission is to drive a high performing organization in a growth oriented global company. Our vision is to inspire the world’s top talent to innovate and make a difference.  As a member of the People & Places Business Intelligence team, this is an opportunity to contribute to the data and analytics foundation within Talent Acquisition.ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Data Analyst, responsibilities will include Partner with the Talent Acquisition team to influence the data strategy and roadmap.Lead analytics efforts to measure Talent Acquisition efforts including quality of hire and talent pipeline analysisCommunication of analytical results is easily understood by both technical and non-technical audiencesIdentify ways to improve status quo and clearly articulate findings in order to support product decisions around goals, metrics and the customer benefitPartner with cross functional teams to implement appropriate data management practices to ensure a high degree of data quality and maintain data privacy standardsPartner directly with product managers, program managers and developers on instrumentation of the business process, data capture and integrations between systems QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a quantitative field - Business, Statistics, Psychology or other social science; Master’s preferred5+ years of work experience involving quantitative data analysisStrong business acumen, excellent communication skills (written, verbal, and presentation) and the ability to communicate complex ideas in clear, succinct terms to both analytical and non-analytical audiences are a necessityAbility to understand business processes and translate into data requirements and maintain or establish accurate outcome measuresSkilled at probing for, evaluating and synthesizing data from disparate data sources to draw interpretive insightsProvide teams with ad-hoc analysis, reports and dashboards enabling easy access to data for decision makers across the organizationApply descriptive and predictive modeling and methodologies to drive solutionsExperience with design & implementation of data architecture, process design, and metric developmentExperience in analytical and modeling tools, such as Python, R, or SPSSExperience with data visualization tools, such as QlikviewExperience with experimentation setup and monitoringPrefer experience using workforce analytics to drive business outcomes

Name: Financial Analyst

This position may require some travel to company manufacturing sites in Chicago and China.

Name: Manufacturing Business Analyst

Riverbed’s unified and integrated Digital Performance Platform, brings together a powerful combination of Digital Experience, Cloud Networking and Cloud Edge solutions that provides a modern IT architecture for the digital enterprise, delivering new levels of operational agility and dramatically accelerating business performance and outcomes. At more than $1 billion in annual revenue, Riverbed’s 30,000+ customers include 98% of the Fortune 100 and 100% of the Forbes Global 100. Learn more at www.riverbed.comWith over 2,000 employees globally, Riverbed offers the rewarding experience of working with some of the smartest, most passionate, and nicest people in the industry who are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. Each of us is committed to delivering the strategies, architectures and technologies that our partners and customers need to control, optimize and have visibility into their networks and applications.Responsibilities:Responsible for establishing efficient and standardized manufacturing business processesDevelop Oracle application based solutions in collaboration with IT team, which enable the business to realize its operational and strategic goals.Drive business requirements gathering, analysis and solution design with manufacturing and IT team.Represents manufacturing team in cross functional IT implementation.Coordinate and lead new IT application related testing & test design for the manufacturing teamSupport the business process owners and super users on day to day Oracle application related issuesCoordinate with logistics team and contract manufacturers in ensuring trouble free shipment transactions and exchange of data.Train new users in Oracle EBS, VCP, BICS, Agile and other IT applicationsEngage with IT in creating new reports and analyticsEngage with planning team in analyzing and presenting planning recommendationRequirements:Strong order to cash, procure to pay and plan to build process knowledgeFunctional expert in Oracle EBS suite of productsKnowledgeable about Oracle EBS, Oracle VCP, Agile, SFDC and BICS setups and configurationsExperienced in writing business requirement documents and test cases for Oracle ERP implementationWell versed with advanced features of Microsoft ExcelExcellent communication skillsMinimum 5-10 years of experience in the industryWhy Riverbed Technology?If you are a high-achiever who wants to be part of a dynamically growing, billion dollar plus company, then you should look closely at Riverbed. We offer the rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry that are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. The company has been recognized multiple years for attracting and retaining today’s top talent as a great place to work by Glassdoor, Fortune magazine’s 20 Great Workplaces in Tech and by numerous other publications.Learn more at www.riverbed.com. Name: Senior Business Operations Analyst
Description: At BlueVine, we’re transforming how businesses get access to working capital financing. Founded in 2013, our online lending platform has helped 10,000+ business owners simplify their cashflow management, boost growth, and take advantage of new opportunities. As a leading FinTech company, we’re backed by Menlo Ventures, LightSpeed Ventures, 83North, Silicon Valley Bank, Citi Ventures, M12 and Nationwide Insurance among other notable investors. Our clients love us, the market we’re going after is huge, and we’re just getting started.As a Business Operations Analyst, you will help architect how BlueVine goes to market. You will drive the strategy and growth of our Sales, Account Management, Marketing, and Partnerships teams through automation, incentive plan design, and process development. You will have the opportunity to own team projects across multiple business functions. You will own projects end to end, from evaluation and analytics, to support gathering and execution.WHAT YOU'LL DO: Partner with our risk, engineering, data science, and finance organizations to drive growthDrive product strategy for the business team to help evaluate, build, and launch new products for the companyOwn insights and analytics for the Revenue OrganizationDevelop the processes and systems relied on by our business teams to achieve our growth targetsBuild incentive plans to fuel our growth and maximize our customer experienceWHAT WE LOOK FOR:4+ years experience overall with 2+ in an operations/finance roleDemonstrable experience with SQL and scripting languages such as Python or RubyVery strong excel skills (Array/CSE formula familiarity, etc.)A proven self starter, setting your own deliverables, and then executing themEntrepreneurial mindset and a track record of finding problems and fixing themBA/BS degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Finance, Math) or equivalent work experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsApplicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.BlueVine’s mission is to help business owners succeed and thrive by making sure they have convenient access to capital for their everyday funding needs. We’ve helped thousands of businesses since we started in 2013, funding more than $1 billion in working capital through our pioneering online platform. Our invoice factoring product allows business to receive cash advances on their outstanding invoices, offering factoring lines of up to $5 million. Our business line of credit product, called Flex Credit, offers financing based on 6-month and 12-month payment terms, and credit lines of up to $250,000. Based in Redwood City, Calif., BlueVine is backed by leading venture capital firms.

Name: Lead Analyst
Description: Lead Analyst – Multiple Positions (San Jose, CA & unanticipated locations throughout the US) Duties: Implementation of Oracle systems, including analyzing client systems and specifications and developing customized solutions using available Oracle technologies. Development of RICE components and support of Oracle Application E Business suite modules such as Oracle Inventory, Oracle Order Management, Oracle Purchasing, Oracle Service Contracts, Oracle Install Base, Oracle Work in Process, Oracle Payables, Oracle Receivables. Participate in requirements gathering, analysis, design, development, gap analysis, customization, configuration, and testing, with strong understanding of application configuration setups, functionality, and integration of various modules. Work extensively on the functional and technical sides of the Interfaces, Conversions, Customizations of reports and forms, Customization of workflows. Troubleshoot user problems based on knowledge and expertise of Oracle application setups, system administrator tasks, application functionality and back-end tables. Support custom development in Oracle Application Production Environment and E-Business Suite, and perform technical analysis, design technical/functional documents using AIM documentation methodology, development and extensions of the Oracle E-Business Suite.  Required: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, Engineering or related field plus 3 years of experience in the job offered or related IT position. Must have 3 years of experience with Oracle Inventory, Oracle Order Management, Oracle Purchasing, Oracle Work in Process, Oracle Payables, and Oracle Receivables.  In the alternate, will accept 5 years of experience in the job offered or related IT position. Must have 3 years of experience with Oracle Inventory, Oracle Order Management, Oracle Purchasing, Oracle Work in Process,  Oracle Payables, and Oracle Receivables.  Travel required to unanticipated locations throughout the US.  Send resumes to: Jade Global, Inc., 1731 Technology Drive, Ste. 350, San Jose, CA 95110, Attn: Human Resources or via email to anisha.amte@jadeglobal.com . Must reference “Lead Analyst” position.

Name: Senior Sales Business Analyst
Description: Senior Sales Business Process AnalystLocation: Santa Clara, CA (HQ) ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications. We are redefining markets and changing the perception of enterprise software. Our cloud platform allows enterprise IT to bring together business strategy, application design and operations in a powerfully simple solution.  To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for drivers—people who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge. We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet, and we want to hire people who have their best work ahead of them, not behind them. Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily. We invite you to join in to stand out. The Senior Sales Business Process Analyst will be responsible for managing and supporting CRM, Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) processes across the Sales organization with significant business process experience with CRM and CPQ. Partner closely with all major business functions across the quote to cash life cycle, including sales, deal desk, sales operations, sales finance, order management, pricing, product management, invoicing, and revenue finance. Drive major cross-functional initiatives that are enabled through core CRM and CPQ functionality. Responsibilities include functional expertise in the Sales CRM, and Quoting processes.Essential Functions:Partner with Sales, Business Operations, CRM, Order to Cash, global business owners to address process improvement and drive efficiencyTake complete ownership of the business deliverables including any customizations and enhancements in the Sales CRM/CPQ areas. Reduce cycle time and improve through put and delivery of the IT development teamAbility to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT partners. Should be quickly able to understand and evaluate the challengesParticipate, influence and drive cross-functional projects that impact the Sales CRM/CPQ processes.Drive continuous process improvements and operational efficiencies across Q2C, primarily in CRM and CPQ area. Also, drive Sales and Sales Operations initiatives in an effort to make the systems and processes more reliable, predictable and efficientGood communication is a must. Dealing with business partner is very important aspect of this role.Managing and coordination of the Regression and User acceptance testing with the usersCollaborate with key business stakeholders, IT, external partners and third-party software vendors to implement effective and resilient solutionsAble to juggle multiple projects & tasks and successfully prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interestsProactively refine upstream solutions to avoid downstream business or IT process and data issuesUndertake post-implementation business support and troubleshoot and resolve systems issues working with the IT support teamNice to have third party software experience related to CRM and CPQStrong teamwork and interpersonal skillsRequirements: Requires 6-8 years of business operations experience of which at least 5 years mainly in CRM and CPQ with a focus on gathering requirements, process improvements and solution design. Extensive experience as a business systems analyst in the Quote to Cash lifecyle, with CRM as the core. Strong business partnership experience required, with proven track record of successfully driving cross-functional initiatives, enhancements and support issues. Exposure to a third party CRM (ie. SFDC, Dynamics) and CPQ is a must.

Non- visa dependents (GC, Citizens, H4 EAD) preferred.

Name: Analyst, Business Development and Strategy
Description: Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. We constantly seek talented, motivated individuals possessing a proven track record of excellence to join our team. Become part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive and mobility industry.  We are currently seeking a Business Development and Strategy Analyst. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.  You Will:  ● Play a key role in identifying new business opportunities, developing and implementing corporate strategies, and establishing business partnerships  ● Conduct competitor analysis and benchmarking, market trends analysis, emerging technologies analysis, and business model analysis  ● Present reports summarizing key findings and observations, and propose corresponding strategic actions  ● Create materials used for business development purposes, participate in external meetings, and maintain business development activity tracking tools and databases  You Bring:  ● Passion for transforming the automotive and mobility industry  ● Excellent critical thinking, research, and analytical capabilities  ● Strong familiarity with the Microsoft Office suite of products  ● Self-starter attitude, high attention to detail, and ability to work with ambiguity  ● Strong communication skills, multitasking skills, and ability to solve problems independently  ● Aptitude for driving tasks to completion with minimal guidance while still operating in a team environment  ● 2+ years of experience in business development, corporate development, market or equity research, management consulting, or corporate finance  Advantageous  ● Prior experience in automotive or mobility-as-a-service (MaaS)  ● Basic accounting knowledge, and ability to read and interpret income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements  ● Ability to develop forecasting models using Microsoft Excel  Education Requirements  ● Bachelor’s degree in management, business, engineering or other relevant fields  Be part of something amazing:  Come work alongside some of the best and most accomplished minds in the industry. Based in the heart of Silicon Valley, California, Lucid Motors is making significant breakthroughs in clean technology.  Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for the brilliant minds who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you want to actively work towards creating a better, sustainable future, we’d love to have you join our team!  Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital  status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.  At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate the differences that make up our team, our products, and our community.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to the following: Participate in full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, design, testing, implementation, and support of reporting capabilities. Develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Monitor performance and quality control plans to optimize reporting solution. Use statistical techniques to identify, analyze and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets, assess data quality and eliminate irrelevant data Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain database reporting tables. Develop data collection instruments; develop and utilizes instruments and methods for the evaluation and quality control of research or operational data. Develop an understanding of the centralized data reporting repository for support and enhancement. Serves as a mentoring resource for non-technical staff on relational data and reporting; May develop and/or present training programs in field of expertise. Reviews, installs, analyzes and implements reporting application security patches to remain vendor compliant, and cyber security compliant. Ensures and validates the integrity and quality of the scripts to be promoted to any of the environments. Performs the following: Data Export/Import/Load and data transformations between databases in production environments, production data file transfers between different systems/vendors, and troubleshooting of reporting performance issues and provides required solution. Ensures data is compliant with any data governance policies. Other duties as assigned by IT Management staff as needed. Major duties and responsibilities are listed above. This list indicates the kinds of work the person does, but in no way limits or modifies a supervisor s right to change jobs or assign additional or different work to employees. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science or Business with an emphasis on Computer Systems or Equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 3 years of information systems experience in multi-platform environments. Minimum 1 year experience in DML, DDL and SQL required. Oracle and SQL database experience preferred. QUALIFICATIONS Ability to work with management to prioritize business and information need. Advanced verbal and written communication skills. Ability to mentor, lead, guide, and train staff or interns performing related work. Demonstrates ability to follow the accepted policy and project methodology. Demonstrates ability to continue self-improvement through ongoing education and learning. Demonstrates knowledge of advancements in database management technology. Proficiently works independently, prioritize individual projects, and consistently meet deadlines. - provided by DiceData Analyst, Oracle. SQL, Cisco

Name: Business Analyst IV
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking a highly motivated Business Systems Analyst to streamline processes and facilitate technology delivery to businesses outsourcing work to 3rd party vendors. The successful candidate will focus on scale and consistency to isolate technical needs in the business, assess feasibility and availability within enterprise engineering, and measure success of deployments. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining the relationship between Enterprise Engineering business units, and cross-functional partners.  The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious and a fast learner while keeping focused on high impact projects. Partner with stakeholders to define and gather business requirements to drive development of technical solutionsDrive investigation of and collaboration with cross-functional partners to address systemic issuesWork with internal business groups to acquire a deep understanding of their processes and operationsLeverage business knowledge and expertise to identify opportunities for process improvements; serve as a trusted technology advisor for the businessMaintain a high-level familiarity of relevant IT systems in order to identify and address potential upstream/downstream integration impactsIdentify and evaluate risks, gaps, and process inefficienciesDefine, plan, and manage small and medium projects, in coordination with technical and business teamsWork with technical service owners to put projects on Enterprise Engineering' s roadmapLiaise with cross-functional teams and assist them with best practices to ensure end-to-end process and tool consistencyDefine KPI' s and success criteria and review post delivery to gauge overall successSkills:3-7 years of consulting, project management, or business systems analyst experienceExpertise in working on cross functional technical projects and the creation of detailed requirement documentsDetail-oriented with the ability to quickly process information, analyze and solve complex problems, and demonstrate a dedication to maintaining the quality of the end productExperience building and optimizing scalable processesExperience collaborating across multiple disciplines, including business and technical teamsSelf-motivated team player with clear and effective communications skills, strong time management skills, and the ability to manage simultaneous and often changing prioritiesExperience working across integrated systems in an enterprise technology environment Education: Bachelors degree in engineering, industrial engineering, supply chain management, business or economics majors.

Name: Big Data Business Analyst

We are constantly on the lookout for professionals to fulfill the staffing needs of our clients and we currently have a job opening that may interest you.  Role : Big Data Business Analyst  Location: Milpitas, CA  Duration: long term  Key Skills: Big Data systems, Business Analysis, GSuite, JIRA/Confluence Job Requirements: 10+ years of experience capturing, documenting & evangelizing requirements across a variety of stakeholders including: UX, Dev & Infrastructure. Name: Senior Data Business Analyst
Description: Senior Data and Business Analyst  Santa Clara, CAThis position reports to: Director, Operational Analytics  ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.  We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.  We are looking for an experienced Data and Business Analyst to join our Operational Analytics team. The Analyst is mainly responsible for analyzing KPIs, reviewing business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational risks, identify opportunities for improved data quality and efficiency, and become the company’s data expert – understanding relationships between tables and systems. They should have strong communication skills and an ability to understand and present complex analysis to all levels. Responsibilities will include activities from leading small to mid-size projects as well as working cross functionally assisting other project managers on larger, more complex projects.  We have a tight team environment where support, loyalty, and honest feedback are the currency. ServiceNow employees are expected to be self-starting, proactive, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.  Role:  We are looking for talented individuals with a strategic viewpoint who are able to grow and adapt along with our fast-paced business. You have to be passionate about working with data, be energized by business leaders gaining insight from your reporting and analysis, and be detail-oriented.  Our Business and Data Analysts are responsible for applying a breadth of data extraction, data cleansing, and analytic techniques to answer a wide range of business questions and drive operational improvements. They are effective communicators capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to a range of audiences. Responsibilities will include supporting ServiceNow internal operational groups such as Product Development, Engineering and Customer Support. Name: Business Systems Analyst - 18
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES: The Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for serving as a liaison with the IT business owners and technical IT professionals to lead and facilitate the elicitation and prioritization of business requirements.  These technology solutions include, but are not limited to 3rd party vendor interface design and IT Infrastructure such as servers and networking to create solutions and key documents such as user interface specifications, workflow charts, diagrams, and report design.  The candidate should have a good grasp of system/solution design and the components of IT Service Management. Solid written and verbal communication and problem-solving skills are mandatory, along with the ability to interface with IT Staff including Infrastructure and System Developers, System Administrators, and Database Administrators. Must be able to conduct systems and data analysis with a preference given to those with network and server Infrastructure experience. EXPERIENCE:5 or more years of IT experience including a demonstrated lead role in requirements elicitation.The ideal candidate has BSA experience in the Information Technology arena developing requirements for IT-led initiatives in networking, engineering, and IT operations; Systems and impact analysis.Projects involving IT Service Management or Network/Datacenters is a plus. Work experience in the US preferred. Technical, functional and team skills:Demonstrated ability in analytical thinking and problem solvingExcellent written and spoken English skillsAttention to detailSelf-motivatedSeasoned professional with a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent along with 5 or more years IT experience, including infrastructure design or installation experience.Preference given to ITIL certified candidatesExperience with software development life cycle and associated deliverables.Experience in IT Service Management and a preference for Release ManagementExperience with IT Infrastructure and the interactions between these systemsExperience with data analysis (SQL queries), interfaces, and software development (high level understanding of programming languages)Significantly influence IT and business stakeholdersRapid absorption of new information or new domainsProvide expert advice within portfolio and for other portfoliosConfidently present findings to senior management and executivesDevelop and deliver powerful presentations by positioning content and objectives appropriately (i.e. positive verses negative tone) for the audience.Excellent knowledge of information systems concepts and IT trendsAbility to develop and present data analysis results in a meaningful way for business senior managers and executives to easily comprehend quickly as part of the decision-making processAbility to gather, analyze, prioritize and present requirementsDisplay an excellent understanding of upstream and downstream applications and the implications of proposed requirements and/or solutions.

Name: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Pony.ai is startup co-located in Silicon Valley and China, our mission is to revolutionize the future of transportation by building the safest and most reliable technology for autonomous vehicles. Armed with the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence, we aim to deliver our technology at a global scale. We believe our work has the potential to transform lives and industries for the better.  At Pony.ai, excellence is at the core of our company. Every detail counts as we work to deliver a safe, reliable, and cost-effective autonomous driving platform to the public. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in developing and deploying state-of-the art vehicle technology. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company grows. Join us on this exciting journey as we bring the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence to the future of transportation.  As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible to conceptualize and produce visually compelling business intelligence reporting solutions (reports, dashboards, interfaces, etc.) using reporting tools, applications, and queries or scripts. This is a highly impactful role where the insights provided will directly impact to making autonomous driving safer, smarter, and smoother.  You will need to work extensively with product management, engineering, business development and operations teams. You should be an expert with analyzing large data sets, enjoys diving deep into data analysis, discovering root causes, and designing long-term solutions. The candidate should be an effective communicator capable of driving resolutions and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. Learn about company’s rapidly growing technology and business developments and operationsDesign and develop metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business and product decisions to improve performanceConduct deep-dive data analysis for business insights and recommendationCollaborate with engineers to implement the data architecture and designData automation through identifying, building, and maintaining scalable processesCombine knowledge of statistical methodology and analysis with programming skills to support complex analysesLead individual development effort through detailed understanding of the software development life cycle and/or agile development environment with emphasis on BI practicesGain solid understanding of source data, its strengths, weaknesses, semantics and formats; to develop logical and physical data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional)RequirementsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or related technical field5+ years of years of relevant professional work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence, market research or related field with global operationsExperience in BI projects converting business needs to data warehousing and reporting solutionsExperience gathering business requirements, using industry standard business intelligence tools to extract data, formulate metrics and build reportsExperience with databases in a business environment with big data and complex datasetsExperience with analytical software (such as R, SAS, Micro Strategy, Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organizationBalance attention to detail with swift executionExperience identifying and communicating analytical outcomes in person and in writing to both business and technical teams. Experience surfacing automated insights using descriptive analyticsGreat communication skills, organized, able to multitask and be a great teammate

Name: IT Finance Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst will be responsible for defining business requirements of Harmonic’s financial processes, as well as helping design and implement efficient, effective and scalable systems solutions to support those processes, leveraging industry best practices and standards. This individual will be the key liaison between business users, IT, 3rd party software vendors and any other stakeholders, working closely with all to maintain alignment with business goals and priorities. This individual must have strong subject matter expertise in business financial processes, as well as knowledge of Harmonic’s key systems that support them. Additionally, the individual will be expert at interpreting customer needs and translating them into the application and operational requirements needed by the technical team to build, test and the systems.Responsibilities:-Interview business users, document detailed requirements, process & data flows, use cases, UI mockups, test scenarios and plans, as well as obtain necessary agreements and sign-offs on such documentation.-Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs, delivering an answer that drives to best practice.-Work with users and technical team to identify and prioritize opportunities for process improvements including integration with other enterprise systems or 3rd party software as needed, then appropriately developing and managing scope of the initiatives executed to support the improvements.-Collaborate with developers to establish the technical vision and convey a complete understanding of the requirements, ensuring that they are adequately addressed in the development process.-Execute test plans in concert with key business stakeholders ensuring completeness and reliability of the solution while partnering with IT in defect resolution/validations during test cycles; obtain final user acceptance sign-offs.-Build and cultivate strong relationships across multiple functional areas, be capable of creating a team atmosphere while driving necessary deadline commitments and a positive work environment, and be able to effectively communicate project plans and updates to key stakeholders and management.-Manage and ensure compliance via SOX controls, working closely with IT and internal audit.-Train and support global finance users, including incident creation & management. Perform troubleshooting, resolving issues where possible, and assisting technical team in understanding reported issues and providing adequate information and research to facilitate bug fixes.-Assist end users with reporting needs as required.Qualifications:-Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Accounting plus 5-8 years of experience-Demonstrated knowledge of best practice with respect to the following financial processes:-Quote-to-Cash-Procure-to-Pay -Revenue Accounting-Cost Accounting-Project Accounting-Consolidations-Asset Life Cycle Management-Travel & Expense Management-Treasury Management-Governance, Risk, & Compliance -Accounting Integration -Financial Controls & Reporting -Close & Forecasting-Experience and deep knowledge of Oracle EBS applications, including GL, AP, AR, FA, CM, Purchasing & ADI as well as Vertex Tax and Hyperion Budgeting Planning.-Experience with reporting tools such as Oracle Reports, Discoverer, and Essbase. OBIEE and working knowledge of SQL a plus.-Maintains current knowledge of relevant SOX and US financial regulations, as well as understanding of applicable international financial governance and control requirements. -Experience in project management, systems implementation processes and software product development lifecycle methodologies and practices; experience with Agile a plus-Working knowledge of Microsoft Visio, Project, Word, Excel and PowerPoint; SharePoint experience a plus. -Strong analytical skills and demonstrated business judgment -Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills and the ability to interact professionally with and facilitate a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Harmonic is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Senior Sales Business Analyst
Description: Senior Sales Business Process AnalystLocation: Santa Clara, CA (HQ) ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications. We are redefining markets and changing the perception of enterprise software. Our cloud platform allows enterprise IT to bring together business strategy, application design and operations in a powerfully simple solution.  To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for drivers—people who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge. We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet, and we want to hire people who have their best work ahead of them, not behind them. Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily. We invite you to join in to stand out. The Senior Sales Business Process Analyst will be responsible for managing and supporting CRM, Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) processes across the Sales organization with significant business process experience with CRM and CPQ. Partner closely with all major business functions across the quote to cash life cycle, including sales, deal desk, sales operations, sales finance, order management, pricing, product management, invoicing, and revenue finance. Drive major cross-functional initiatives that are enabled through core CRM and CPQ functionality. Responsibilities include functional expertise in the Sales CRM, and Quoting processes.Essential Functions:Partner with Sales, Business Operations, CRM, Order to Cash, global business owners to address process improvement and drive efficiencyTake complete ownership of the business deliverables including any customizations and enhancements in the Sales CRM/CPQ areas. Reduce cycle time and improve through put and delivery of the IT development teamAbility to discuss functional and the solution aspects of a project effectively with IT partners. Should be quickly able to understand and evaluate the challengesParticipate, influence and drive cross-functional projects that impact the Sales CRM/CPQ processes.Drive continuous process improvements and operational efficiencies across Q2C, primarily in CRM and CPQ area. Also, drive Sales and Sales Operations initiatives in an effort to make the systems and processes more reliable, predictable and efficientGood communication is a must. Dealing with business partner is very important aspect of this role.Managing and coordination of the Regression and User acceptance testing with the usersCollaborate with key business stakeholders, IT, external partners and third-party software vendors to implement effective and resilient solutionsAble to juggle multiple projects & tasks and successfully prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interestsProactively refine upstream solutions to avoid downstream business or IT process and data issuesUndertake post-implementation business support and troubleshoot and resolve systems issues working with the IT support teamNice to have third party software experience related to CRM and CPQStrong teamwork and interpersonal skillsRequirements: Requires 6-8 years of business operations experience of which at least 5 years mainly in CRM and CPQ with a focus on gathering requirements, process improvements and solution design. Extensive experience as a business systems analyst in the Quote to Cash lifecyle, with CRM as the core. Strong business partnership experience required, with proven track record of successfully driving cross-functional initiatives, enhancements and support issues. Exposure to a third party CRM (ie. SFDC, Dynamics) and CPQ is a must.

Name: Business Analyst / Program Manager
Description: Overview: As an Operations Data Analyst/Program Manager you will be responsible for analyzing operational performance, uncovering service quality gaps, and building advanced dashboards and reporting. You have a strong desire to understand empirical facts. You are a problem solver by nature, a self-starter, and a diligent team player. As a member of our team, you will be a key analyst that supports our reporting and deep dives on root cause analyses. You will be tasked with completing a wide range of analyses by developing advanced queries, scripts, models and dashboards. You strike a solid balance between technical skills, project management skills (Data analyst focused projects) , and attention to detail. You are comfortable working with large data sets and breaking down complex concepts to non-tech members of the organization. You understand the implications of the analyses and reports you build and take the initiative to clearly communicate back to key stakeholders. You are a problem solver, quick learner and someone who is self-directed and self-motivated. You also thrive in a fast-paced, often changing environment. Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (e.g. science, math, or engineering)3-5+ years overall Data Analyst experienceExtensive (3-5+ years) SQL experience (complex database query and scripting; familiar with complex functions)Spreadsheets (Sheets/Excel) and advanced knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau or others) creating dashboards.Excellent written and verbal communicationSound business judgment and ability to communicate technical concepts effectivelyAbility to translate queries and numbers into business insightsHave a strong sense of ownership and a desire to develop new skillsProblem solver by nature, a self-starter, and a diligent team playerComfortable with ambiguity.Ability to interact with a diverse set of internal stakeholders and navigate through ambiguity to solve operational challenges.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Marketing Systems and Operations
Description: Who We Are: Malwarebytes is the next-gen cybersecurity company that millions worldwide trust. Malwarebytes proactively protects people and businesses against dangerous threats such as malware, ransomware, and exploits that escape detection by traditional antivirus solutions. The company's flagship product combines advanced heuristic threat detection with signature less technologies to detect and stop a cyberattack before damage occurs. More than 10,000 businesses worldwide use, trust, and recommend Malwarebytes. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in California, with offices in Europe and Asia, and a global team of threat researchers and security experts.  We've created a fantastic culture that our employees love and were recently named in the top 10 of Fortune Magazine's "Great Place to Work" list. We're growing fast and are looking for some great people to join us. Who We Need: Your role will be to help implement, administer, and optimize our Marketing Systems and own the business process designs, system implementations, change management, training, and compliance. You will partner with teams In Marketing, Sales, Product, Data Science and Engineering, IT to transform business challenges into process and systems-driven solutions. You must be able to pro-actively engage business, build relationships and solve problems. This position will require problem solving skills, data analytics and thought leadership to come up with creative solutions for the business. What You'll Do:Own the functional development of solutions that support Marketing, working with Global Marketing, Sales Operations, Business Applications, and other teams as needed.Develop and document functional solution design specifications for various analytics projects, dashboards and reports in alignment with unified data architecture standards. Functional solution design on big data technologies is desired.Perform business requirement analysis and data profiling required for the solution design, with the help of Looker, Tableau and PowerBI.Lead projects end-to-end from design, build, test, to deploy. Understand design trade-offs between declarative, code, and 3rd party tools.Serve as the primary contact with end-users (field questions, triage feature requests, troubleshoot issues) and cross-functional stakeholders.Use and recommend best practices while delivering scalable high-quality solutions.Assist with data management and governance. Support reporting requirements and leverage Marketo, Salesforce for data-driven decisions.Assist in designing, implementing, reviewing and/or maintaining both requirements and testing solutions.Regular interaction with business communicating the project portfolio, technology roadmap, and planning on future business objectives.Work within the framework of the Scrum standards to deliver business needs.Work in a matrix & collaborative environment with solution management, architects and "virtual" functional teams across multiple geographiesWork in a fast-paced startup like environment.Manage internalSLA communications and coordinate the handling/escalation of issues in a timely and efficient manner.Planning and establishing data training, UAT and other post go live activities including documentation.Responsible for driving adoption of technology and process changes.Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.Skills You'll Need to Have:10+ years of business/technical analyst experience within a sales or marketing function.A proven track record for designing and delivering solutions that are focused on usability, flexibility, and scalability.Strong understanding of the Salesforce, Marketo or Eloqua Sales and Marketing platform (data model, declarative functions, business processes).Familiarity with data wranglers and reporting/analysis/visualization tools such Trifacta, Tableau, Looker, Flexplore and Integration tools such as Tibco or Boomi.Familiarity with API framworks.Large scale technology implementation experience.Experience documenting and maintaining business, functional, and/or technical requirements.Ability to manage and cleanse Marketo data using various data management tools.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, agile environment.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Experience working with a distributed team across time zones.Ability to manage cross-department stakeholders with unique needs and competing priorities.What We Offer:An opportunity to do something great for yourself and the worldA great work environment that supports growth and developmentCompetitive compensation and benefit packages401(k) matching programOpen time off policyStocked kitchen with healthy (and some unhealthy) drinks, snacks, fruit and lunch optionsA company who enjoys having fun; holiday and summer parties, sporting events and lots of other great stuff

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Position: Senior Business Analyst Location: Sunnyvale, CA Longterm contract Pharma Domain experience is a must Please don't apply if you don't have experience in Pharmaceutical domain Key Accountabilities/Core Job Responsibilities: Lead requirements gathering efforts and translate Business Requirements into Functional/Technical Specifications. Identify and recommend business process improvements. Ability to organize and present ideas in a convincing and compelling manner. Ability to troubleshoot issues and work independently with minimal direction. Self-motivated with a high degree of initiative and excellent follow-up skills, along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science or related discipline.
