Name: Senior Competitive Intelligence Analyst
Description: Senior Competitive Intelligence Analyst  Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone in the world. We are a company filled with people who are deeply passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience and business insight for our customers. At Splunk, we're committed to our work, customers, improvements, having fun and take pride in each other's success. Learn more about Splunk careers, generous benefits, new technologies and how you can become a part of our journey!  The Splunk Security Markets Group is looking for a Competitive Intelligence Analyst to support the Product and Sales initiative. This individual will be expected to have a real passion for and deep understanding of the competitive landscape within the Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) market space in an effort to improve product roadmaps, positioning, and sales effectiveness. Through deep technical and product research this individual will be expected to identify competitive advantages and opportunities for improvements, and train peers as well as management on recommendations for improving technologies and new technologies. Responsibilities include:Take pride researching the SOAR market space, current and emerging competitive threats, competitor product strengths, improvements and weaknesses at a very deep and technical levelIdentify and assess competitive strengths as well as growing opportunities, and identify ground breaking methods of exploiting competitive strengthsSupport Product Management with product feature gap analysis, competitive threats and product launch strategies derived from competitive analysisWork with marketing to formulate competitive sales strategies, product demonstrations, content, and collateralPassionate about working with sales, SEs, and customer success to assist in closing customer sales.Formulate competitive sales strategies, business insight, positioning and tools to improve sales effectiveness.Committed to working directly with the sales team to help close opportunitiesDeep knowledge with product marketing to create scalable product content and improvements that articulate the benefits & differentiators of our product offeringsPassionate about analyzing data and building executive reports on rapidly growing win/lossRequirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT practices, or equivalent5+ years of Security experience (product or practitioner) requiredHighly motivated written and verbal skills are a huge plus - expected to support executive-level presentations and improvements.Solid understanding of the sales lifecycle and purchaser mindset.Strong grasp on insight generation scalability, influencing, problem solving and business acumen skills.Proven ability to analyze new, products and competitors and translate that information into actionable intelligence, positioning campaigns and sales tools.Strong written and verbal skills with the ability to quickly create collateral to differentiate the Splunk product offering and improvements.SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst IV
Description: Job Position: Business Analyst IV  Location: Menlo Park, CA, 94025  Duration: One Year AssignmentRole: Company's Enterprise Engineering Department is seeking a highly motivated Business Systems Analyst to streamline processes and facilitate technology delivery to businesses outsourcing work to 3rd party vendors. The successful candidate will focus on scale and consistency to isolate technical needs in the business, assess feasibility and availability within EE, and measure success of deployments. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining the relationship between Enterprise Engineering business units, and cross-functional partners. Name: Business Development Analyst Sr. Mgr
Description: Description:The Adjacencies Business Development Manager (ABDM) will be responsible for planning, executing and managing growth efforts beyond core business within the Special Programs line-of-business (SPLOB) and SPLOB engagement in LM Space Enterprise-level opportunities. The ABDM will report to the SPLOB Strategy and Business Development Director. The position requires leveraging current core programs and capabilities to penetrate adjacent markets both domestically in the Intelligence Community and internationally to grow the LOB, diversify its portfolio and meet Long-Range Plan (LRP) commitments. The AM BDM will lead a team of direct and indirect reports from BD and other functional areas to discover, qualify and mature new opportunities, develop discriminating value propositions and offerings, and bid effectively to achieve strong win rates. Specific responsibilities include:Leading development and execution of strategic growth plans focused on adjacent markets.Leading efforts to assess viability of adjacent markets, addressable customer budgets and competitive landscape to assess where investments and bandwidth should be focused.Leading the identification, prioritization and qualification of pursuits through the LM Space new business process and managing the overall new business portfolio to ensure diversification of risk and achievement of LRP growth goals.Managing and orchestrating adjacent customer engagement activities across the SPLOB, as defined in strategic and capture plans.Overseeing pursuit, capture and proposal activities within Adjacent markets, ensuring alignment with strategy, discriminating value propositions, competitive bid approach and high win rate.Supporting SPLOB new business collaborations with the greater LM Space enterprise, working with the BDD, the Advanced Programs Development (APD) VP and representatives from other LOBs and the Enterprise APD organization.Management of new business-related internal dollar and people resources pertaining to Adjacencies-related new business, ensuring efficient and effective use of internal funds, operating within budgets and re-prioritizing activities as needed.Leading a team of experienced BD professionals with relevant customer domain expertise and performing manager functions involving recruitment, training, performance assessment, prioritization of tasks and employee engagement.Communicating with and engaging SPLOB and LM Space senior leadership for the purpose of statusing, obtaining approvals and building advocacy for growth plans.Collaborating closely with organizations across the SPLOB, LM Space and the broader Lockheed Martin Corporation to ensure coordination of SP new business activities and maximum leverage of LMC resources to grow the business. Must have an active TS/SCI Clearance. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet and maintain eligibility requirements for access to classified information. US citizenship required. Basic Qualifications:Experience developing growth strategy, applying those strategies to the identification and qualification of new markets and specific opportunities, executing a capture plan to shape and position, and developing a discriminating offering with strong value proposition.Strong analytical skills, including business case and M&A valuation capabilities to quantitatively filter potential M&A candidates and strategic partnership opportunities.Strong experience with space-based remote sensing and RF markets, applicable Intel community customers and their missions, enabling technologies, core programs and key acquisitions.Demonstrated ability to lead diverse teams in developing and delivering superior products with constrained schedules and resources.At least 10 years of experience working new business activities, including some experience in capture management, proposal development and customer account management.At least 5 years of demonstrated team leadership that includes proven communication and presentation skills, effective decision making, building consensus, conflict resolution, and sustaining the team's energy and commitment.Direct experience engaging with high-level government stakeholders and customers in the Intelligence Community to understand mission need and effectively communicate a value proposition.Preferred experience engaging with Congressional professional staff and International customers.Willingness to travel domestically frequently and internationally as needed, with occasional over-the-weekend and extended travelDemonstrated ability to proactively drive change and aggressively engage competitively to grow a large business unit in the aerospace industry.Leadership and engagement skills to motivate and effectively direct a team of BD professionals.Very strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.TS/SCI clearanceIndustry-applicable B.S. or B.A. degree required; MBA or other advanced degree preferredDesired Skills:.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: Sr. Business Analyst (Data Focused)
Description: Project Overview: The UX Research Operations team combines world-class program management skills with a passion for user experience research to help UX Research teams across our client build and improve products for billions of users.  We manage a large team that offers many different services to UX Researchers across our client. As our client's research needs grow, we are growing this team at a rapid pace and are facing challenges scaling our operations. We're looking for an Analyst who will help us scale by automating simple manual tasks, defining meaningful metrics and building and maintaining dashboards to help drive our business decisions and ensure we're allocating our resources appropriately.  Overall Responsibilities: Support a mix of strategic and operational projects such as developing automated data analysis, creating dashboards, deriving insights from complex data, service metrics tracking and analysis.Own regular cadence of reporting and analysis of our organization's operational performance.recruiting programsWork with team leads to identify key metrics we can use to track the health of our recruiting operations. Set benchmarks and ensure we have the necessary dashboards to track progress and are reviewing progress regularly.Automate day-to-day tasks across our team using Apps Script. Perform ad-hoc analyses to answer various specific business questions and provide actionable insights to inform operational decisions.Create and maintain dashboards to provide insights and visibility into key strategic and operational performance of the organizationDesign and execute automation for tasks that improve the quality, speed and cost-effectiveness of our Required Skills: BA/BS degree (preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields) or equivalent practical experience.2-3+ years of working experienceDeep analytical and data-driven problem solving skills, including dashboard development.SQL, database and spreadsheet expert: Ability to extract, analyze and manipulate data in a variety of applications and formats.Experience defining meaningful metrics for an operations or support teamAn ability to conceive, implement and present dashboards and reports in a variety of formats to key stakeholders in order to monitor team health, operational bandwidth, and other useful metrics.Experience managing cross-functional technical projects for the complete life cycle, with competing resources and priorities.Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate across multiple types of audiencesProficient with our client Sheets, our client Docs & our client Slides.Experience working in our client Apps Script or other programming such as JavaScriptAbility to identify data, reporting and automation needs and either write queries or scripts or partner with other teams to make those ideas a reality. Nice to have skills/Not Required: Technical aptitude and highly analytical: a strong willingness to dive in and learn on the goCan use statistical concepts (inference, hypothesis testing) to inform decision makingAbility to think 'out of the box' and bring creative, nonstandard, and innovative solutions to the table.A strong sense of focus and excellent attention to detailAbility to quickly complete a large volume of high-quality work in a very fast-paced environment.Strong leadership skillsAbility to establish effective relationships, influence, drive consensus and collaborate internally and externally at all organizational levels.Proven ability to multitask, analyze opportunities, define successful approaches, and proactively solve problems.Thorough knowledge of user-centered design, user research methods, iterative development processes, and usability principles.Experience creating and maintaining program schedules using project management systems

Name: Business Process Analyst (Alliances and Channels)
Description: Business Analyst (Alliances and Channels Solutions)We are searching for an experienced Business Analyst to join Alliances and Channels (A&C) Solutions team. You will work alongside other business analysts and help in driving several A&C projects with multiple stakeholders (IT, Business and Partners). Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting requirements/processes, and performing user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to drive projects/process improvements with IT and other stakeholders.Business Analyst Responsibilities:Performing requirements analysis.Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and driving requirements with IT, Partners and 3rd party consultants.Drive requirement gathering workshops and gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful business requirement documents (BRD).Work closely with different stakeholders (Business Users, IT, Partners and other stakeholders) to align on requirements.Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.Managing competing resources and priorities.Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.Ensuring solutions delivered by IT meet business needs and requirements.Conduct UAT sessions and make sure the system/process enhancements meet user requirements.Perform user acceptance testing.Requirements:A bachelor’s degree in CS, Business or related field or an MBA.A minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Analysis or a related field.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Excellent documentation skills.A track record of following through on commitments.Self-starter and a passion to get the work done.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.History of leading and supporting successful projects.Experience in Partners or Channels space is highly desirable.Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.

Name: Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Process Infrastructure)
Description: Job DescriptionOverview It is an exciting time to join the Investment Solutions – Process Infrastructure team within the Portfolio Management Group (PMG)! In a newly structured team and group, your process improvement, problem solving and fact driven analysis will be a key contributor to the success of PMG, a major business unit driving overall firm success. The Opportunity: The Process Infrastructure Team is seeking a Business Analyst to help drive measurable business process improvements aligned with Portfolio Management Group objectives. The Business Analyst works cross-functionally within PMG and the broader firm to understand and develop our primary value chain, unify our business process architecture, streamline key processes and sub-processes, and proactively identify and execute on operational excellence and measurable areas for improvement. The Day-to Day:Partner with the business and its’ leadership to develop the client life cycle, map business capabilities and key processes, and assess areas for improvement using Lean methodology and Agile tools.Collaborate with the Technology Group as a process owner and business expert in implementing engineered or vendor solutions that enhance client experience and meet business requirements.Drive process improvements through constant, iterative review of our business process architecture’s stability and scalability, developing lean workflows with high quality output, ensuring solutions meet current and future business objectives.Use industry standard methodologies to conduct root cause analysis formulating cogent problem statements, process assessment, modeling, and plan for improvement.Document requirements and manage changes from current (as-is) to target (to-be) design states.Lead process redesign & reengineering workshops with business end-users providing them adequate support and training.Maintain business processes and group artifacts.Your Qualifications:Strong technical aptitude (learns new processes and systems quickly) and ability to work independently, handle multiple priorities, and solve complex problems.Effective written and verbal communication skills to multiple audiences, including various levels of management.Experience in process workflow mapping using MS Visio or similar toolsExperience leading teams in process improvement projects in service industries with a demonstrable track record preferred.Not required, but a plus:Prior experience as a Business Analyst or similar position.Knowledge and/or experience with Financial ApplicationsPrior experience or currently involved in, complex business processes, business process mapping, or business architecture modelingExperience with a Business Process Management Suite (BPMS)Experience with Atlassian Confluence, Jira and/or similar project & issue tracking softwareWorking knowledge of and applied experience with Waterfall and Agile methodologies, and SDLCWhy Fisher Investments Fisher Investments is a different kind of investment firm. We don’t come from Wall Street, nor do we believe we fit in with most of the finance industry, and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to innovative perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that enable us to offer the level of service that we do. And we invest in them accordingly, offering exceptional benefits like: 100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insuranceA 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidaysAnd much, much more We also provide a cumulative, continuous learning and development framework customized for every employee. This emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an award-winning work environment; we’re Great Place to Work Certified, and The Oregonian named us as a 2017 Top Workplace with the best benefits!  But in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our employees want to make a difference in an industry that can do better.  * California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year.  FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.  #LI-FI1

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionAnomali delivers earlier detection and identification of adversaries in your organization’s network by making it possible to correlate tens of millions of threat indicators against your real time network activity logs and up to a year or more of forensic log data. Anomali’s approach enables detection at every point along the kill chain, making it possible to mitigate threats before any material damage to your organization has occurred.Job Description:o Analyze complex business problem to be solved with automated systems.o Partner with business partners to understand business problem and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements.o Provide technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and develop systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet user requirements.o Configure system settings and options; plan and execute unit, integration and acceptance testing.o Partner with business partners to understand business requirements and processes to help the business assess technical solutions options.o Work directly with developers, architects to create and refine robust solution designs.o Collaborate with business partners, developers, and other teams on tasks related to the planning, scheduling and coordination of project activities.o Dissecting high-level information into details and communicate these details in a manner understood by relevant audiences.o As a conduit to management and stakeholders by providing regular updates on project progress.Requirements:o BS in Computer Science or Engineering or related field or equivalent working experience.o At least 5 years of experience in the high tech industry with primary focus in business system analysis, designing solutions and make appropriate recommendation related to complex IT problems.o Hands on experience with NetSuite is required.o Hands on experience with Salesforce and HubSpot.o Some data model experience and ETL process is a plus.o Hands on experience with Java or other programming languages.o Experience in fit/gap analysis to validate that technical solution meets business requirements.o Experience collaborating with cross functional team members and stakeholders to deliver project deliverables.o Experience facilitating requirements workshops, technical design reviews and team meetings.o Project management experience, producing project artifacts including design documents, user stories, and sequence diagrams.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Senior Business Analyst ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY Deliv is a fast-growing company that offers a highly collaborative, fast­ paced, entrepreneurial work environment. Data is the cornerstone of our business, and you will provide analytical support for all business intelligence activities. We’re looking for a creative leader with excellent analytical abilities across business and technology, attention to detail, strong ownership and organization skills. Cross­ team coordination, project management, and excellent communication skills are essential.  As Senior Business Analyst, you will facilitate the design and analytic effort on a variety of projects that directly impact operational success. Your role is to apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand ecosystems, user behaviors, and long ­term trends. You will build models of user behaviors and to optimize driver performance & operational economics. You are scrappy, focused on results, a self-­ starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression, and user engagement of a product.  Location of the role is in our Menlo Park, CA office and reports to the Director of Data Analytics. WHAT YOU’LL DOPartner with Logistics, Operations, Sales, Finance, and Product stakeholders to prioritize analysis activities and reporting requirements in support of company goals.Lead analysis activities that underpin strategic decisions, optimize delivery execution, and measure and motivate our crowd­sourced drivers.Write scripts in SQL-­based Looker Business Intelligence tool to build data sets, automate analysis, and update data models.Design and implement reporting dashboards and metrics that track and monitor the performance of our operational economics, the quality of our data, and overall health of the business.Problem solve how specific metrics need to be generated and, when required, work with the product and engineering teams to implement solutions (e.g. data gathering, gap analysis, work on submitted feature request or business requirement documents, file bugs etc).Work with internal operations teams to define problems, collect and synthesize relevant data, build analytical models and forecasts.Publish and track key metrics via dashboards, scorecards, and share ad­hoc analysis with both internal and external stakeholders.Drive ongoing data cleansing/data improvement tasks.Support and operationalize the reporting of key performance indicators.WHAT YOU’LL NEEDDegree in applied math, statistics, computer science, operations research, or related technical or analytical field.3+ years of analytical work experience in high data volume environments (preferably in internet, software, media, or financial industries).Demonstrated track record in the development and delivery of reporting and analysis in a demanding business environment.Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract and integrate data from various platforms or sources.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with a demonstrable track record of effectively partnering with technical, business, and operational colleagues.Knowledge of data mining and data validation.Experience writing SQL and knowledge of database infrastructure strong requirement.Knowledge of and experience implementing business intelligence tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, QlikView or Wave.PLUSESExperience working with a programming language such as Python, R, Scala, Java, etc.A history of being the early leader in startups who have gone on to be large successesUnderstanding of crowdsourced business models and last mile logistics market is a plusBENEFITS & PERKSCompetitive SalaryEquity in fast growing, early stage startup401k planHealth, Vision, and Dental Insurance10 Paid HolidaysGenerous parental leave planUnlimited vacation policy - work hard take time when you need itAccess to Corporate Business Park gymDisrupt traditional logistics - be a part of the team creating the future of delivery and making same-day delivery ubiquitous Apply Now

Look for ways to continuously improve processes & procedures.Manage and support operations related initiatives identified by the Professional Services management team.Identify opportunities for business process improvements and make recommendations as appropriate.Provide project and monthly metrics coordination and support.Work with team to understand and prioritize field requests.Manage the queue to provide prompt support to end users including consulting ecosystem to resolve issues and address questions.System testing of new functionality or bug fixes.Skills/Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in business systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or equivalent.Salesforce.com system experience is mandatory.Salesforce admin or equivalent certification required.Project coordination skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with different levels within the organization as well as collaborate with cross-functional business partners and technical teams.Ability to gather and transfer requirements from stakeholders into an action plan and deliver on that action plan leveraging internal systems as needed.Attention to detail with the ability to analyze and solve complex problems as well as provide documentation, guidance and instruction to users.Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to research solutions to issues as they arise.Ability to manage stakeholder expectations professionally.Ability to work independently, with general direction and guidance.Self-motivated, flexible, team player with solid multi-tasking, time management & organization expertise with the ability to manage multiple and often changing priorities.Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.

Name: Analyst I/II FT
Description: The Office of the City Clerk is recruiting for an Analyst I/II to become part of a dynamic and productive team that facilitates the City's legislative process and maximizes public access to municipal government. This Analyst position is part of the fiscal/HR team and is responsible for budget tracking, facilitating HR transactions for the Council offices, reviewing and processing grants request and general support to Council offices and their staff. Depending upon their qualifications the successful candidate may be hired at the Analyst I or Analyst II level.  The successful candidate will have the ability to establish effective working relationships with interdepartmental staff (at all levels of the organization) and third parties. In addition, the successful candidate must be detail-oriented, have excellent proofing abilities, be able to independently identify issues and develop solutions, possess an understanding of the legislative process and City organization, and have demonstrated routine experience in using MS Word, Excel and Outlook as well as a database application. The successful candidate will have demonstrated ability to implement process improvements that aid workflow. The position will provide the opportunity to the successful candidate of interpreting legal documents, questioning document content inconsistencies, and utilizing organizational resources to solve such inconsistencies.  The successful candidate will routinely interact with higher levels of the City's management organization in the performance of position responsibilities.  This recruitment may be used to fill multiple positions in this, or other divisions or departments. If you are interested in employment in this classification, you should apply to ensure you are considered for additional opportunities that may utilize the applicants from this recruitment. The actual salary shall be determined by the final candidates qualifications and experience. In addition to the starting salary, employees in the Analyst classification shall also receive an approximate five percent (5%) ongoing non-pensionable compensation pay. The ideal candidate will possess the following competencies, as demonstrated in past and current employment history. Desirable competencies for this position include: Analytical Thinking - approaches a situation or problem by defining the problem or issue; identifies a set of features, parameters, or considerations to take into account, collects and analyzes data, uses logic and intuition to arrive at conclusions and recommendations.Communication Skills - communicates and listens effectively and responds in an timely, effective, positive and respectful manner; written reports and correspondence are accurate, complete, current; well-organized, legible, concise, neat, and in proper grammatical form.Computer Skills - experience with common business computer applications including but not limited to: MS Outlook, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Access, and MS Excel.Customer Service - approaches problem-solving by focusing on customers first; advocates for customer results point of view; demonstrates the ability to anticipate customers' needs and deliver services effectively and efficiently in a timely, accurate, respectful and friendly manner.Decision Making - identifies and understands issues, problems, and opportunities; uses effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions.Initiative - exhibits self-directed, resourceful and creative behaviors toward meeting job objectives; anticipates problems, is proactive, and avoids difficulties by planning ahead; displays willingness to assume extra responsibility or workload and accept challenges; pursue continuing educational opportunities which promote enhanced job performance.Job Expertise - demonstrates knowledge of and experience with applicable professional/technical principles and practices, Citywide and departmental procedures/policies and federal and state rules and regulations.Multi-Tasking - can handle multiple projects and responsibilities simultaneously; has handled a wide variety of assignments in past and/or current position(s).Reliability - completes quality work assignments in a timely and efficient manner; fulfills responsibilities and maintains confidentiality as appropriate.Team Work & Interpersonal Skills - demonstrates a positive attitude and flexibility along with the ability to develop effective relationships with co-workers and supervisors by helping others accomplish tasks and using collaboration and conflict resolution skills. The selection process will consist of an evaluation of the applicant's training and experience based on the application and responses to the Job Specific Questions. Only the candidates whose backgrounds best match the position will be invited to proceed in the selection process. Additional phases of the selection process will consist of one or more interviews, one of which may include a practical/writing exercise. You will be prompted to answer the following job-specific questions during the online application process. Please note that there is a 4,000-character limit, including spaces, for each text response.Do you have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Business or Public Administration or a closely related field?Do you have experience with human resources administration in the public or private sector? If Yes, please describe your experience with human resources functions including: recruitment, selection, supervision, training, employee development, performance management and employee discipline with the City of San Jose or other organization.Do you have budget development and fiscal management experience? Please describe, in detail, your experience, including years of experience.Do you have experience providing support (such as preparing agendas, meeting packets, minutes or other duties) for an elected official, executive, board, commission, committee, or another group? Please describe your experience and provide specific examples of your workPlease describe your proficiency with the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point and provide a specific example of your work, include your specific role(s) and responsibilities and the outcome achieved.Do you have experience reviewing, interpreting, and/or administering laws, ordinances, governmental rules and regulations? Please describe your experience.Do you have experience in reviewing grants, contracts or other documents for adherence to the requirements of regulations, standards or guidelines and performing compliance reviews? Please describe your experience.Do you have experience managing multiple work assignments and projects? Please describe your work style and the techniques you use to manage your responsibilities and your desk. You must answer all job-specific questions in order to be considered for this vacancy or your application will be deemed incomplete and withheld from further consideration.1. Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Business or Public Administration or closely related field. Experience: Analyst I: None. Analyst II: Two years of increasingly responsible professional staff analytic or administrative experience at the level of Analyst I with the City of San Jose.Employment Eligibility: Federal law requires all employees to provide verification of their eligibility to work in this country. Please be informed that the City of San Jose will NOT sponsor, represent or sign any documents related to visa applications/transfers for H1-B or any other type of visa which requires an employer application.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we're committed to our work, customers, having fun and most meaningfully to each other's success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!  Role  Do you enjoy using your finance skills to lead change and efficiency? Are you highly analytical and have a high attention to detail? Do you want to work in a dynamic, high-energy environment in partnering with our Sales organization to reach our goal of hitting $5 billion and beyond? Then, this is the role for you.  We're hiring for a Senior Financial Analyst role on the Sales Finance team to help us with some of the most critical and interesting challenges in support of one of the best-performing Sales teams in the world. You will have the chance to join a small, highly-collaborative finance team and make an impact on Splunk's growing business. This role will be responsible for handling various corporate-level duties within Sales Finance, first, focusing on commissions modeling, and then opportunities in global consolidation, budgeting and forecasting. You'll work with senior leadership as well as take ownership of core FP&A activities such as monthly and quarterly close, annual planning and forecasting, and helping drive better process around our systems and tools.  Responsibilities: I want to and can do that! Own and run the commissions expense forecast model, ensuring accuracy and predictability, as well as partnering closely with Accounting on closing the booksImprove our internal process and procedures, establishing best-practices as well as leading change and improvements to enable the team to scale and growHelp oversee across the Sales Finance team to handle, consolidate, and pressure-test the worldwide Sales budgets and forecastsResponsible for monthly/quarterly close process and preparing the CFO for quarterly earnings callsSupport senior management team and departments heads with in-depth analysis and actionable insightsRoll up your sleeves and assist in developing annual operating plans, quarterly and monthly financial forecasts, and ongoing analysis of actuals versus plan and/or forecast Requirements: I've already done that or have that This role is for doers; be able to get into the details and get the job done while at the same time being able to see the forest for the treesCollaboratively-focused and maintain a positive attitude and work well with others in a fast-paced and ever-changing businessSuperior forecasting methods and techniques. Detailed oriented with the highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organizedArticulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Capable of presenting complex financial information in an easy to understand format.Excellent interpersonal skills and able to interact comfortably with senior level managementStrong financial acumen broadly across the organization (e.g., understanding of financial documents, chart of accounts, business intelligence, FP&A processes, etc.)Superior software and system skills (e.g. NetSuite, Microsoft Excel). NetSuite, Workday, Salesforce.com experience a plusExperience modeling and running commissions forecasts, forecasting revenue, as well as strong working knowledge of revenue recognition rules Education: Got it Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance. Masters preferred.5 plus years of relevant FP&A experience in a high growth software and SaaS company We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.  For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst, WW Sales Finance Business Development Support
Description: SummaryImagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have an important role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. We are looking for an outgoing professional with high analytical capacity, creativity, attention to detail, and strong social skills to support the WW Sales Finance Organization. The position requires the ability to complete complex financial and demand analysis, work cross-functionally and with local teams in region, develop and execute business strategies, identify business opportunities, and recommend and present business updates to senior management. Ability to conduct complex data heavy analysis Advanced spreadsheet and modeling skills Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to articulate results of analysis in easy-to-understand business terms High level of proficiency with Excel and presentation tools (e.g. Keynote) Proven ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams and make things happen Able to get into the details and stay highly motivated and organized Ability to think strategically to see the big picture while working with ambiguity and uncertainty Ability to manage several projects at once and properly prioritize Thrives in a dynamic, demanding environment Be an intellectually curious self-starter with a desire to find creative and innovative solutions to issues at hand Think both analytically and creatively and be willing to learn Apple WW Sales Finance serves as the global hub of financial information and decision support. You should be one who has been a top performer in your career with a consistent record of accomplishments. You will be a key contributor in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment and will be expected to influence strategic decisions around the world. - Work closely with finance and sales teams to analyze demand trends and provide executive updates - Support sales finance teams with automation and developing analytics tools & dashboards - Influence teams around the world and be comfortable being the central point of contact across teams and geographies - Track partner performance, including assessing ROI on Apple investments - Analyze global market trends and provide support to Sales Planning on key sales initiatives - Track competitor trends and evaluate Apple’s market positioning, especially in key emerging markets - Partner with local finance and assist in analysis, writing, and reviewing of quarterly summary document - Establish reporting and analytical models to report and evaluate performance, respond to ad-hoc questions and data requests Education & ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in a relevant field, with strong academic performance

Name: Business Continuity Program Analyst
Description: About Ivalua Ivalua was founded in 2000 on the disruptive notion that Procurement can unlock significant strategic value not only in a company's spend and supply chain, but throughout the organization.  We here at Ivalua, believe that software should empower Procurement leaders, not constrain them. We've created a complete Source-to-Pay platform that delivers real innovation and drives today's values, while also delivering best-in-class capabilities with the flexibility to meet the needs of tomorrow. Our team is driven by deep engineering skills and a love of cutting-edge projects. Now, over 18 years later, Ivalua has been recognized by top analysts, including Gartner and Forrester, as a global market leader. Our success is evidenced by our 98%+ customer retention rate within an active and engaged community of over 250 leading enterprises across 70 countries achieving a competitive advantage by strategically managing over USD 500 Billion in spend, powered by the Ivalua Solution.  If you're ambitious and thrive on getting tough, real-world problems solved with a smart, motivated team, you want to work here. Job Overview: In this position you will contribute to developing an overall understanding and solid foundation in Security, Governance, Risk, and Compliance. You will be responsible for working with key players, performing, and improving the current control environment, providing active support to implement the program to ensure business continuity awareness, establishing, and monitoring metrics to measure control effectiveness. Responsibilities:Lead implementation of the annual Business Continuity Management program. This includes: Performing business impact assessments (BIA)Assisting in business continuity plan (BCP) developmentPlanning, conducting, and evaluating BCP exercisesSupport design of annual program requirements, procedures, and key program deliverablesLead business continuity focused meetings with senior management to set the scope of the annual programChampion Business Continuity awarenessPerforming periodic testing of Business Continuity Plans (BCP) to ensure effectivenessParticipate in activities of the GRC team, including governance, compliance, risk, management, policy, best practices, and awarenessWork with key players to determine compliance with regulatory and compliance requirementsWork with third party providers generating assessmentsWhat Ivalua is looking for:2-5 years of experience in a Business Continuity environmentAbility to articulate Business Continuity concepts and methodologyKnowledge of and experience with the current industry standardsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBachelor's degree in Business or Computer related field or equivalent experienceExperience with ISO/IEC 22301, ISO/IEC 2700/27002Experience with security control auditingWhat Ivalua offers:Competitive compensation package with strong benefitsHigh-energy atmosphere with an innovative and stimulating work environment with exceptional growth and career opportunitiesWork with a very global and diverse team of exceptionally passionate, talented, and engaging colleagues who are established leaders in their industryLots of freedom for creativity and personal growthIvalua invests in the future of our employees with 4% 401(k) plan match

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job Description Summary:Simility, a PayPal Service, is an end-to-end fraud management platform helping large merchants, banks, and other Fortune 1000 companies manage fraud and risk. Our systems helps enterprises detect fraudulent events real time and help protect these enterprises from online threats. We do so by creatively harnessing the power of data, machine learning and humans and be on the cutting edge of fraud detection techniques and algorithms. Simility welcomes big thinkers and passionate team players, who are ready to take their career to the next level.Job Description:Simility’s Data Analysts (DAs) are comprehensive product experts who collaborate with customers and internal teams to ensure that their customers are successful in their deployments. They continually build upon and apply their technical knowledge and skills across the product suite at every level of the customer engagement. The successful DA will exhibit and build upon the deep expertise to ensure that they can not only have a successful deployment but an extremely satisfied customer. DA team members also spend their time working on projects that affect many parts of the organization, including process improvements, coding custom scripts, recommending tools, etc for the success of Simility. Primary Responsibilities: Help understand the main customer issues around fraud and compliance Understand the nature of the data that is going to be provided and work with the customer to create and finalize a data schema that meets their needs Perform univariate and bivariate analysis on data sets to detect anomalies and clean up Help populate the tables with data and do data regressions to understand the key parameters that may be indicative of fraud Further analyse data to identify fraud patterns and optimize the system to flag these patterns Train the customer on using the Simility platform including the ability to write custom rules, triggers, etc. Provide feedback from customers to the product development team in an effort to continually improve the product Lead and participate in special projects/initiatives: innovate and implement large-scale quality improvements to processes and/or systems by conducting data analysis and making recommendations, troubleshooting technical issues, and refining processes around customer support Subsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:San Jose, California, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations:We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Name: BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST~ EXCELLENT COMPANY TO WORK
Company: OPTION 1 STAFFING SERVICES, INC. AN AWARD WINNING AGENCY
Description: Job DescriptionIT BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST CONTRACTORSAN JOSE, CA OPTION 1 Staffing is currently recruiting for a IT Business Systems Analyst who understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends IT solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. This position interprets and transforms information based on business requirements and provides the data for delivery. It conducts detailed research of vendor products, assists with general project management and addresses enterprise application administrative tasks. The IT Business Systems Analyst is a liaison among enterprise applications business stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems. This is done in conjunction with a strong understanding of the relevant technologies, at an application administration level.  In addition, the IT Business Systems Analyst follows best practices and standardizes how work is managed and delivered. This includes regular status reporting, escalation of issues to business sponsors, and participation in driving the usability, efficiency and scalability of enterprise applications functionality.  Essential Functions  The essential functions listed are not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. Gather, analyze and document business and functional requirements from staff, Operations and business usersAnalyze, document, and improve workflows, processes, and standardsUnderstand business process management to elicit and gather customer business requirements and translate them to specific software requirementsCommunicate effectively with internal teams and external clients to deliver functional requirements including GUI, screen and interface designsAct as an experienced interface between business units, technology teams and support teamsProvide technical guidance concerning business implications of application development projectsCommunicate effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutionsManage client expectations effectivelyLead work with Quality Assurance to build and validate test cases against all requirementsAnalyze application defects to determine if they fall within scope of project requirementsLead post-project analysis to reflect upon successes, failures, and lessons learnedFacilitate SCRUM daily meetingsAccountable for outstanding customer service to all external and internal customersDevelops and maintains effective relationships through effective and timely communicationTakes initiative and action to respond, resolve and follow up regarding customer service issues with all customers in a timely mannerRequirementsMinimum Qualifications Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in business information systems (IS), computer science or related field  Experience Five (5) years of IT and/or Business experience in a Business Systems Analysis role or experience working with internal clients and/or external agencies/partnersProven experience working with the core business teams of Finance, HR, Legal, Sales & MarketingExperience with HR, recruiting, onboarding processes/systemsHands-on experience developing/administering relevant packaged or custom-applicationsExperience administering Microsoft on premise enterprise applications such as MS Dynamics Great Plains and/or MS Dynamics CRM highly preferredExperience administering SaaS enterprise applications such as Ultipro HRIS highly preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities A blend of business, IT, financial and communication skills, as this is a highly visible positionWell-versed in Microsoft Office applicationsWell-versed in SCRUM methodologiesUnderstanding of various essential business functions of an organizationStrong ability to facilitate process mapping activities and working knowledge of mapping techniquesStrong understanding of Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architecturesStrong understanding with how legacy and web-based system interfaces with each otherExperience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essentialCan conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesExceptional verbal and written communication skills; expertise in setting and managing customer expectationsAbility to facilitate meetings and follow up with resulting action itemsEffective influencing and negotiating skills in an environment with contractors, resources administratively reporting to other managers, and third-party vendorsStrong knowledge and understanding of business needs, with the ability to establish and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidenceProficient understanding of key technologies and processes programming, database, operations, and platformsAble to read, write, speak, understand and satisfactorily communicate with others in English in person, over the phone and via email For immediate consideration, please apply. Best of Staffing Award Winner  Check out our jobs @ www.option1staffing.com

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst Job ID #: 14393Job Category: Finance & AccountingEmployment Type: Experienced ProfessionalsDivision: Internet of ThingsDepartment: ISG FinancePrimary Country: USAPrimary Location: San Jose (CA) We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.Job Description  The finance organization at ARM is evolving into a more outbound, consultative and partnering organization. Along the way, we have crafted a new, exciting role in our team of a Finance Business Partners to include a Financial Analyst.  This role is a dedicated analyst in ISG. ISG is one of the two operating businesses of Arm, focused on delivering IoT services providing connectivity, device management, and data management. The business has recently seen significant investment through a number of acquisitions and operates in a dynamically changing environment. This is a role for an ambitious individual who can function in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and who has excellent analytical and communication skills, preferably with experience in a fast-moving SaaS environment.  Your will be involved to prepare, maintain and improve an effective financial planning and management, reporting, and analysis process that provides a level of financial strength and financial inputs to the decision-making of leaders in your partner organizations.  What will I be accountable for?  You will support a team of Business Partners, General Managers and Operations Leaders and corporate teams Support the monthly close process to ensure proper accounting treatment, accurate recording of transactions and thorough analysis of variance and financial reportingSupport the forecasts process, tracking of spend against budget, and continual monitoring and assessment of quarterly variance risks and opportunitiesSupport the planning process, through modeling of key assumptions and drivers, consolidating the plans and input into our planning systems, and generate reporting for reviewsThorough knowledge and continual analysis of key cost drivers, using business, industry and company acumen to identify cost optimization alternatives, rationalize project priorities, and drive solutions with the business, accordingly. This role is responsible for assisting in the development and monitoring of key performance indicators, highlighting trends, and analyzing root causesLead changes to processes and procedures to improve efficiency, forecast accuracy, and ability to identify business insight, including documentation of same. Support and partner on the broader Finance efforts for improved infrastructure and tools.You will also be involved in M & A integration support, ad-hoc modeling and analysis and related services to assigned groups and functions.Job Requirements What skills, experience, and qualifications do I need? You have a Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or economics, with 4+ years of FP & A experienceYou have advanced analytical, financial modeling skills including capital and revenue models and can translate financial acumen into business insight, quickly, on-demand. You have financial close knowledge, P & L literate You will keep a high standard of accuracy and precision and have an ability to distill large amounts of data and build new dashboards and critical metricsYou are a dedicated and self-motivated individual that is comfortable in completing projects in tight time frames with minimal direct supervision. Independent self-starter who is motivated by developing new processes and relationships Our Culture  At ARM, we are proud to have a set of beliefs that reflect our unrivaled creative culture. These beliefs are assessed as part of the recruitment process:  We, not I  Take daily responsibility to make the Global ARM community thrive  No individual is right answer.  Brilliance is collectiveInformation is crucial, share it  Realize that we win when we collaborate and that everyone misses out when we don't  Passion for progress  Our differences are our strength. Widen and mix up the pool of people you connect with  Difficult things can take unexpected directions. Stick with it  Make feedback positive and expansive, not negative and narrow  The essence of progress is that it can't stop. Grow with it and own your own progress  Be your brilliant self  Be quirky, not egocentric  Recognize the power in saying I don't know'  Make trust our default position  Hold strong opinions lightly  With offices around the world, ARM is a diverse organization of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling a vibrant, inclusive, meritocratic, and open workplace, where all our people can grow and succeed, we support our people to share their creative contributions to ARM's success in the global marketplace  #LI-PW1Benefits  Your particular benefits package will depend on position and type of employment and may be subject to change. Your package will be confirmed on offer of employment. Arm's benefits program provides permanent employees with the opportunity to stay innovative and healthy, ensure the wellness of their families, and create a positive working environment. Annual Bonus PlanDiscretionary Cash Awards401(k), 100% matching on first 6% eligible earningsMedical, Dental & Vision, 100% coverage for employee only, shared cost for dependentsBasic Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance (AD & D)Short Term (STD) and Long Term (LTD) Disability InsuranceVacation, 20 days per year with option to buy 5 more.Holidays, 13 days per yearSabbatical, 20 paid days every four-years of serviceSick Leave, 7 days per yearVolunteering, four hours per month (TeamARM)Office location dependent: caf on site, fitness facilities, team and social eventsAdditional benefits include: Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care, EAP, Health Advocate, Business Travel Accident Program & Commuter programs. ARM, Inc. (USA) participates in E-Verify. For more information, please refer to ******************** About Arm  Arm technology is at the heart of a computing and connectivity revolution that is transforming the way people live and businesses operate. From the unmissable to the invisible; our advanced, energy-efficient processor designs are enabling the intelligence in 86 billion silicon chips and securely powering products from the sensor to the smartphone to the supercomputer. With more than 1,000 technology partners including the world's most famous business and consumer brands, we are driving Arm innovation into all areas compute is happening inside the chip, the network and the cloud.  With offices around the world, Arm is a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and highly talented professionals. By enabling an inclusive, meritocratic and open workplace where all our people can grow and succeed, we encourage our people to share their unique contributions to Arm's success in the global marketplace.

Name: Business Analyst - Software Development
Description: Job DescriptionWhen you join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific, youll be part of a smart, driven team that shares your passion for exploration and discovery. With revenues of $22 billion and the largest investment in R&D in the industry, we give our people the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world. How will you make an impact? The Business Analyst will work with a highly motivated team dedicated to the development of cutting edge software products enabling Quality Control and medical diagnostics within a lab environment. The ideal candidate will be a team player who is passionate about delivering effective and customer-focused software products while working alongside Chemists, Molecular Biologists, and Engineers in a fast-paced environment. Should have a strong comfort level working with translating and defining technical user needs into software requirements. What will you do?Act as the Voice of the Customer (VOC) and translate user needs provided by Marketing into software requirements for the Development team by soliciting, aligning, and incorporating feedback from diverse stakeholders.Participate in cross-functional teams and effectively communicate difficult concepts at a high level, as well as the technical details, to various stakeholders within the organization.Work with offshore team to understand technical requirements and communicate/collaborate with users to analyze customer needs and functional requirements.Ensure a robust Design Control for new software product development per FDA and international guidelines by incorporating risk/compliance analysis.Compile and ensure a robust Design History File for new software product development.Develop and write Standard Operating Procedures for software product.Lead the development of customer-facing documentation and training materials, e.g., user guides, training manuals, etc.How will you get here?Bachelor's degree plus 5 years of direct related experience; Engineering/IT discipline is preferred.Proven skills to drive project progress while working to mitigate risks to project schedules and timelines.Must be highly collaborative, have the ability to work within a diverse team, and contribute to a supportive, positive work environment both within the team and in the greater site-wide community.Experience in authoring technical and released documentation is required.Proven track record of capturing requirements that meet customer needs.Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Set the foundation for designing high quality, flexible, scalable and maintainable software solutions.Ability to work in a fast paced environment while being a self-starter, and able to work with minimal directions.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.PMP certification is a plus.Understanding design control, FMEA/risk is highly preferred.Knowledge of FDA regulations for software product development is highly preferred.Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC).Familiarity with C# and cloud-based SW desired.Proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 70,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular missionenabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.  Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.com  Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.If you are an individual with a disability who requires reasonable accommodation to complete any part of our application process, click here for further assistance.Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst-Utilization Management
Description: SUMMARY The Senior Business Analyst provides strategic business analysis services to business partners. The focus of this position is to work closely with the Utilization Management Department also known as Health Services as well as other departments in the organization to gain in-depth understanding of customers business needs when it comes to reporting requirements, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates.  This role will be key to understanding reporting and business needs, contributing to the finical stewardship and documenting capabilities needed to address business challenges.  The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for generating and reviewing assigned reporting responsibilities, business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency. Responsibilities will include a full range of activities from report development, writing systems requirements, to leading small to mid-size projects and assisting other department members on larger more complex projects related to operational business functions that affect team members and providers. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND REPONSIBILITIES *Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems, including SDLC, and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of action plans by providing
