project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences (for example, senior management, Customers, technical staff)Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationshipsProvide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior management, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; managing resources; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for resultsIdentify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategiesProvide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilitiesProducing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT planCollaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA processIdentify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive)Elicit and clearly document business and systems requirementsAssess business process and system inefficienciesIdentify ways to increase adoption and customer satisfactionDemonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiationAbility to analyze and synthesize reporting requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processesUnderstand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholdersServe as a liaison between UM Operations and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementationsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESNoneQUALIFICATIONS:Must have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational reporting UM requestsStrong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skillsUnderstanding of Indices, fundamentals and analytical data, returns level data etc.Data analysis Must have proficiency with SQL, Microsoft ExcelBusiness Analyst top skills & proficiencies:CommunicationTechnical UnderstandingProblem SolvingLeadershipTeamworkClient ManagementBusiness OperationsMultitaskPHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk.The employee must be able to lift and move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, color vision and the ability to adjust focus.Nothing in this job description restricts managements right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. CANDIDATES must be willing to go through a pre-employment screening process.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $80,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year  Experience: Healthcare: 1 year (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Business Data Analyst ll
Description: Overview  Milestone is looking for passionate and motivated professionals who go above and beyond to solve the world's biggest problems through innovation and technology. Our vision is to revolutionize the way technology is deployed and supported worldwide.  Global Security Strategic Initiatives (GSSI) develops global programs that optimize processes, mitigate risk, and drive results to support the mission of the company and the advancement of the Global Security organization.  Do you naturally look for the story and have a knack for translating that story into one that non-analytical minds can grasp and rally behind? As the GSSI Strategic Business Partnerships (SBP) Business Data Analyst II, you will report to the SBP Lead and be responsible for leading the data analytics strategy for SBP. The GSSI SBP Team is looking for an experienced analyst that loves data, analytics and systems, and has a passion for answering difficult business questions with data-driven decision making. The successful applicant will be creative and a logical thinker who likes to answer complex questions through rigorous analyses, and has the ability to tell a synthesized, easy-to-follow data story. Responsibilities Drive data analytic projects from initial ask through metric/score definition, testing, development, deployment, support, and further iteration.Establish analytical framework for your team: define measurement approach, quantify and evaluate success, and develop KPIs and guide tracking efforts for ongoing measurement and reporting.Analyze data to assess opportunities and improve alignment of activities to organizational business drivers, goals, and objectives.Act as the key data steward in the build out of SBP's direction at an international level. The individual will also partner closely with key stakeholders to provide regular, robust reporting and analytics.Operate independently in a fast-changing environment and with multiple teams relying on you.Generate reporting, ad hoc analysis and create data visualizations to support leadership decision-making.Continually improve and automate existing methods for parsing data and incorporating into real-time models, analysis, and actions.Create platform(s) and tools for the organization to leverage.Coordinate data analytics requests from SBP and work with the data engineering team to implement them as appropriate.Communicate insights to the business partners- emphasizing clarity, completeness, and action ability. Qualifications 3-5 years experience in data analytics or management consulting.Education: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Business and/or 5+ years of work experience in the field.Systems: Proficient in SQL (Oracle, Hive, MySQL), Tableau (or other BI tools), MS Excel, Python/R or other scripting languages is a plus.  Hard SkillsNinja-like data analysis skills: you are a strategic thinker and have the ability to ask the right questions to elicit the true data needs. You understand how to most effectively support business leaders with critical decision-making analyses and recommendations.Bold builder: you are innately curious and have a strong desire to add new tools to your "tool belt "you're innovative, creative and constantly looking for opportunities to tweak and optimize by learning new tools quickly.Startup mental: you have the ability to simplify and structure complex and ambiguous problems and manage multiple simultaneous objectives in a fast paced and changing environment.  Soft SkillsSelf-starter attitude: you boldly pursue your work and love the responsibility of being personally empowered.Excellent communication: you possess strong interpersonal skills so you can interact collaboratively and productively with diverse teams across the organization. You build relationships to help drive adoption of data-driven decision making.Strong business acumen: you understand biz drivers and have a data framework-driven process of analyzing biz problems and developing solutions.SDL2017

Name: Analyst I/II FT
Description: The Office of the City Clerk is recruiting for an Analyst I/II to become part of a dynamic and productive team that facilitates the City's legislative process and maximizes public access to municipal government. This Analyst position is part of the fiscal/HR team and is responsible for budget tracking, facilitating HR transactions for the Council offices, reviewing and processing grants request and general support to Council offices and their staff. Depending upon their qualifications the successful candidate may be hired at the Analyst I or Analyst II level.  The successful candidate will have the ability to establish effective working relationships with interdepartmental staff (at all levels of the organization) and third parties. In addition, the successful candidate must be detail-oriented, have excellent proofing abilities, be able to independently identify issues and develop solutions, possess an understanding of the legislative process and City organization, and have demonstrated routine experience in using MS Word, Excel and Outlook as well as a database application. The successful candidate will have demonstrated ability to implement process improvements that aid workflow. The position will provide the opportunity to the successful candidate of interpreting legal documents, questioning document content inconsistencies, and utilizing organizational resources to solve such inconsistencies.  The successful candidate will routinely interact with higher levels of the City's management organization in the performance of position responsibilities.  This recruitment may be used to fill multiple positions in this, or other divisions or departments. If you are interested in employment in this classification, you should apply to ensure you are considered for additional opportunities that may utilize the applicants from this recruitment.  The actual salary shall be determined by the final candidate's qualifications and experience. In addition to the starting salary, employees in the Analyst classification shall also receive an approximate five percent (5%) ongoing non-pensionable compensation pay.  The ideal candidate will possess the following competencies, as demonstrated in past and current employment history. Desirable competencies for this position include: Analytical Thinking - approaches a situation or problem by defining the problem or issue; identifies a set of features, parameters, or considerations to take into account, collects and analyzes data, uses logic and intuition to arrive at conclusions and recommendations.Communication Skills - communicates and listens effectively and responds in an timely, effective, positive and respectful manner; written reports and correspondence are accurate, complete, current; well-organized, legible, concise, neat, and in proper grammatical form.Computer Skills - experience with common business computer applications including but not limited to: MS Outlook, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Access, and MS Excel.Customer Service - approaches problem-solving by focusing on customers first; advocates for customer results point of view; demonstrates the ability to anticipate customers' needs and deliver services effectively and efficiently in a timely, accurate, respectful and friendly manner.Decision Making - identifies and understands issues, problems, and opportunities; uses effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions.Initiative - exhibits self-directed, resourceful and creative behaviors toward meeting job objectives; anticipates problems, is proactive, and avoids difficulties by planning ahead; displays willingness to assume extra responsibility or workload and accept challenges; pursue continuing educational opportunities which promote enhanced job performance.Job Expertise - demonstrates knowledge of and experience with applicable professional/technical principles and practices, Citywide and departmental procedures/policies and federal and state rules and regulations.Multi-Tasking - can handle multiple projects and responsibilities simultaneously; has handled a wide variety of assignments in past and/or current position(s).Reliability - completes quality work assignments in a timely and efficient manner; fulfills responsibilities and maintains confidentiality as appropriate.Team Work & Interpersonal Skills - demonstrates a positive attitude and flexibility along with the ability to develop effective relationships with co-workers and supervisors by helping others accomplish tasks and using collaboration and conflict resolution skills. The selection process will consist of an evaluation of the applicant's training and experience based on the application and responses to the Job Specific Questions. Only the candidates whose backgrounds best match the position will be invited to proceed in the selection process. Additional phases of the selection process will consist of one or more interviews, one of which may include a practical/writing exercise.  You will be prompted to answer the following job-specific questions during the online application process. Please note that there is a 4,000-character limit, including spaces, for each text response. Do you have a Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Business or Public Administration or a closely related field?Do you have experience with human resources administration in the public or private sector? If Yes, please describe your experience with human resources functions including: recruitment, selection, supervision, training, employee development, performance management and employee discipline with the City of San Jose or other organization.Do you have budget development and fiscal management experience? Please describe, in detail, your experience, including years of experience.Do you have experience providing support (such as preparing agendas, meeting packets, minutes or other duties) for an elected official, executive, board, commission, committee, or another group? Please describe your experience and provide specific examples of your workPlease describe your proficiency with the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point and provide a specific example of your work, include your specific role(s) and responsibilities and the outcome achieved.Do you have experience reviewing, interpreting, and/or administering laws, ordinances, governmental rules and regulations? Please describe your experience.Do you have experience in reviewing grants, contracts or other documents for adherence to the requirements of regulations, standards or guidelines and performing compliance reviews? Please describe your experience.Do you have experience managing multiple work assignments and projects? Please describe your work style and the techniques you use to manage your responsibilities and your desk. You must answer all job-specific questions in order to be considered for this vacancy or your application will be deemed incomplete and withheld from further consideration. Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Business or Public Administration or closely related field.Experience: Analyst I: None. Analyst II: Two years of increasingly responsible professional staff analytic or administrative experience at the level of Analyst I with the City of San Jose. Employment Eligibility: Federal law requires all employees to provide verification of their eligibility to work in this country. Please be informed that the City of San Jose will NOT sponsor, represent or sign any documents related to visa applications/transfers for H1-B or any other type of visa which requires an employer application.SDL2017

Name: JPC - 1496 - Business Process Analyst - II
Description: Location: San Jose, California  About this Position:  Procurement Analyst/ Logistics Specialist job in San Jose, CA. Position requires a minimum of three years of experience in logistics or asset management. Qualified candidate will have advanced skills in Excel, SAP and asset management software.  Shift: Normal Business Hours M-F 9am-6pm (or similar schedule)  The Procurement Analyst/Logistics specialist job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Maintain asset management database and ensure all infrastructure hardware (server, network, video equipment, etc.) is correctly identified within database.Responsible for analyzing shipping loads and transportation methods.Conduct regular physical audits of infrastructure equipment.Identify sourcing opportunities and spend analysis on shipping and logistics categories.Assist in the bid process for the selection of freight forwarding vendors.Submit purchase orders for infrastructure teamManage procurement projects and ensure commitments are met by monitoring, assessing, and resolving discrepancies in budget, quality of work, and timely service.Qualifications:Bachelor•s Degree required.Three to five years of Logistics or asset management experience.Global sourcing experience preferred.Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills.Advanced Excel, Access, and asset management exposure.Excellent attention to detailApply for Position

Name: Cloud Business Analyst-Jr
Description: Business Analyst- CloudSunnyvale CA6+ months contractJob Summary:  Cloud Business Unit is growing and we need an experienced, motivated and adaptable analyst to support our management team in our endeavour to understand and grow our business through scientific and data driven methodologies. In this role, you will support design and development of metrics, business dashboards, data definitions and analytics activities. This key role will also support development of our data exchange with strategic Hyperscaler partners: Amazon Web Services, MSAzure, BlueMix and Google Computing Platform (GCP) and merge business insights with our Enterprise data ecosystem to accelerate new cloud pathways and manage our SaaS business partnerships effectively. We need data real-time and we believe standalone spreadsheets and slides are no way to run a fast-paced, innovative SaaS focused Cloud organization! Job Requirements: Deploy real-time, user friendly dashboards and visuals that quickly indicate organizational health or performance gaps Develop and analyze metrics across cloud sales and marketingprocesses and products, ex., Lead management metrics, ARR, CAC, LTV, etc.,Support integration of multiple data sources from around the company and external sources (AWS, Azure, GCP, BlueMix etc.,) to assess cloud products performance and identify gaps/opportunities. Analyze product and business performance on key dimensions for revenue, retention, and engagement Partner with cross-functional analytics and business teams to support operationalization of SaaS metrics, dashboards/ reports, and business analysis. Support development of decision ready, high quality models supporting our Hyperscaler relationships that include consumption and usage, marketplace, incentive, demand generation, program compliance, purchase lifecycle experience /cycle times and MDF /Co-op administration. Support forecasting, modeling, retention, and LTV analysis for recurring subscription billing business Adhere to Cloud Business Unit practices for user data collection, analysis, and reporting, working closely with leadership, engineers, IT, external partners and product managers to implement it Support experimentation efforts (A/B testing) for product innovations and marketing optimization • Support marketing and sales analytical efforts to understand program effectiveness (social media, event participation, webinars, etc.) Leverage our existing analytics tools, testing tools, and reporting methods (e.g., Splunk, Elasticsearch/Kibana, Google Analytics, SQL) and prioritize and implement improvements to our data pipelines, analytics toolkits, and reporting processes Education & Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in relevant area (Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science). Masters or MBA a plus. 4+ years of experience in data analytics, data modeling, and data management practices.1+ years of experience working as a consultant with business stakeholders including finance,  marketing, and partner organizations. Strong understanding of data analytics principles and practices, and experience with forecasting and statistical modelling (multi-variable regression, classification, correlation etc.,) in Excel and R/ Demonstrated experience in developing business intelligence solutions, handling large volumes of  data, analyzing trends, and making recommendations to all functions of the business to manage  costs and drive revenue and growth. Name: Cloud Business Analyst

In this role, you will support design and development of metrics, business dashboards, data definitions and analytics activities. This key role will also support development of our data exchange with strategic Hyperscaler partners: Amazon Web Services, MSAzure, BlueMix and Google Computing Platform (GCP) and merge business insights with our Enterprise data ecosystem to accelerate new cloud pathways and manage our SaaS business partnerships effectively. We need data real-time and we believe standalone spreadsheets and slides are no way to run a fast-paced, innovative SaaS focused Cloud organization! Name: Data Analyst Intern
Description: Job Description Summary:.Job Description:At PayPal, we’re literally reinventing how the world pays and gets paid. We understand that it’s about people. We connect individuals to let them shop, get paid, donate and send money using today’s technology with the confidence that comes from the security and control PayPal enables. Are you ready to help us change the world?The world’s leading payments company, PayPal, brings together a family of brands that are revolutionizing the way people move money. At PayPal you will be immersed in an amazing community with a vibrant culture that thrives on innovation, collaboration, inclusion and wellness. This is a 12-week summer internship opportunity focusing on driving PayPal’s success by providing quantitative insights and serving as business advisor to the organization.We are seeking world-class problem solvers who have a passion for data and a relentless focus on execution and delivery. You will be most successful with a healthy combination of both, technical skill and business acumen. As members of the Global Analytics and Insights team, we add significant value by consistently providing clarity and insights on PayPal’s most critical initiatives and priorities.Qualifications, Skills and Behaviors:Graduating with either an undergrad or graduate technical/quantitative degree from a top-tier institution. Degrees in Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics are a big plus.Demonstrates experience, familiarity and ease with handling large data sets and crunching numbers.Significant experience with SQL or other software engineering languages (Python, C++, Java).Familiarity with web analytics (Google Analytics, Site Catalyst), statistical packages (SAS, R), and visualization tools (Qlikview, Tableau).Passionate about problem solving.Ability to translate business questions into structured analysis and data analytics into business insights.Strategic thinking and mental flexibility to be able to understand both, the details of the problem, as well as, the big picture/business solution.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate complex problems into simpler terms, and effectively influence both peers and senior leadership.Ability to make data-driven decisions and highly results-oriented.Experience with experimentation and A/B testing is a big plus.Enjoys having fun and truly wants to make real impact in their work.Primarily Job Responsibilities:Develop a deep understanding of PayPal Products.Identify key business levers, establish cause & effect, perform analyses, and communicate key findings to various stakeholders to facilitate data driven decision-making.Discover new opportunities to grow and optimize the business through analytics, financial modeling, and business case development.Analyze complex system behavior from multiple sources, performance, and application monitoring data. Deliver insights into signup & payment conversion and landing page performance by geography and product segment. Analyze channel performance, design and execute experiments, research, financial models and other mechanisms to identify, evaluate and prioritize opportunities.Identify key metrics and build exec-facing dashboards to track progress of the business and its highest priority initiatives.Perform highly analytical deep-dives to identify root cause and mitigation opportunities or specific actions to add value.Work closely across the matrix with teams like Finance, Marketing, Product, Engineering and senior executives.EducationEnrolled in Undergraduate or Graduate DegreeSubsidiary:PayPalTravel Percent:0Primary Location:San Jose, California, United States of AmericaAdditional Locations:We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.Paypal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Name: Epic Clarity Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionHealthTECH Resources is seeking an Epic Clarity Data Analyst for a 4 month contract position at a top-tier healthcare organization in CA. Interested candidates should be Epic Clarity Data Model certified and have reporting experience working in a healthcare setting. Duties of the Epic Clarity Data AnalystWill be responsible for the architecture and development of Enterprise scale analytic content across the continuum of care for clinical and financial subject areas, including: Development of queries/stored proceduresData transformation and normalization processesSummary tables to store metric contentSecurity mechanisms to handle security for users at different echelons of the organization spanning several cross functional areas, taking into account access to combined source data in a data warehouse settingEpic Clarity Data Analyst Experience/SkillsEpic Clarity Data Model certification(s) required.Experience working in a healthcare setting with reporting experience against an EMR is mandatory.Expert level SQL coding skills required.Excellent knowledge of development (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS) in MS-SQL Server required.Excellent skills in SQL programming, debugging, developing stored procedures required.Prior experience in development of dashboards/reports using Operational Data Stores or Data Marts/Cubes desirable.Experience with EMPI software like Initiate, NextGate or Epic Identity a plus.Experience with Quality Measures reporting in Healthcare a strong plus.Experience working with data extractions and ETL/ELT process and package development in healthcare a strong plus.Experience with healthcare terminology/codesets like SNOMED, LOINC and others a strong plus.Experience with one or more of Business Objects Enterprise suite, Tableau, SQL Developer, Crystal etc.Why work here?Company enjoys a reputation for excellence throughout the region and beyond -- this is a great opportunity to get involved high up on a great project at an award-winning health care system.Imagine coming to work every day knowing you can help make a difference in ways that truly matter - not just to the bottom line, but to the health and well-being of your friends, neighbors, and community. Company DescriptionHealthTECH understands that our employees are the cornerstone to our success and is proud to offer the following benefits: Competitive compensation: we want our team to be happy & motivated.Health, Vision, Dental plan options.Bi-Weekly pay: We never make our team wonder about their pay as they travel.Direct deposit/same day.Seasoned Travel Dept. to take care of all travel needs.

Name: Product Analyst
Description: Job Description The challenge  This is a high impact, highly visible role well suited to individuals with a highly quantitative, inquisitive bent of mind. The ideal candidate will be able to work autonomously and will have a technical background with strong communication and project management skills.  As a Product Analyst you will be responsible for helping different businesses and teams achieve operational and execution efficiencies using data. Your leadership and interpersonal skills will help you engage with product management, customer success, marketing, and sales teams to understand and distill their business intelligence needs and deficiencies. Your strong data ETL skills will help you combine disparate sources of data so that they can be analyzed and your understanding of statistics will help you analyze the data and derive useful actionable insights for the various teams. Your success is predicated on providing insights that enable digital marketing businesses to lower customer churn, identify product feature utilization, and facilitate upsell and cross sell opportunities.  What you'll do Manage the data collection, analysis, and delivery of KPIs for a digital marketing business.Collaborate with a digital marketing business' technical teams to understand where data is stored and how it can be extracted.Analyze customer usage data and derive insights for product, customer success, and marketing teams.Standardize insight generation and help build automated self-service tools for the same.Own and lead relationships with stakeholders across digital marketing businesses. What you need to succeed 2- 3 years relevant experience.Degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines are strongly preferred. MS/PhDs are preferred.Basic prototyping skills in R, Python, Spark or similar language are required.Ability and preference to work in a rapidly changing and less defined business environment.Very strong project management skills are required. The ability to work with disparate teams, often in different geos, prioritize tasks and following up on them is critical for success in this role.Experience with machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or econometrics is strongly preferred.Knowledge of the digital marketing industry preferred but not required. At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you're looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the and explore the meaningful we offer.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Slalom’s Silicon Valley office is expanding and looking to add an Operations Analyst to support our managed accounts as part of our new Operations team. We’re looking for someone who wants to hit the ground running in this highly visible, fast-paced environment supporting our most prestigious clients.  The successful candidate will initially be responsible for maintaining the internal operational life cycle for Silicon Valley top tier accounts, reporting directly into the Client Service Leadership team. As the first hire of our new Operations team, this individual will be in a position to expand the team as we continue to see growth successfully serving our clients. Responsibilities Utilize internal business systems to assist accounts in day-to-day management  · Assist account leaders with identifying, obtaining, tracking, and managing engagement/project details.  · Research complex questions and troubleshoot engagement, invoicing or other issues Manage account onboarding process, time entry, and invoicing for key accountsManage burn rate reporting and periodic account/industry specific reporting and analysisMaintain/build content for information and community management technologies (SharePoint)Coordinate, monitor client proposals, engagement contracts, MSA’s and other related documentsResearch and develop presentation materials as necessary for business development opportunities.Act as a liaison between business leaders and IT or Finance teams to identify and resolve issues with engagement setup, time entry, and billing, etc. · Research and prepare financial, engagement or other operational and financial issues with ad-hoc analysis and reporting leveraging internal business systems.  · Develop, extend and refine operational to drive operational efficiency for account teams and the Silicon Valley market.  Business Development and Sales Cycle Support  · Serve as a client operations SME with Slalom corporate services  · Coordinate, monitor and assist with client proposals, contracts, MSA’s and other related documents  · Utilize business systems (Salesforce, ChangePoint, Sharepoint, etc.) to provide reporting support Qualifications · 2+ years of professional work experience  · Strong interpersonal communication skills, and executive presence  · Excellent analysis skills, and ability to focus on detail and accuracy  · Strong technology skills, including Microsoft tools, and the proven ability to learn new technologies quickly  · Self-started with the willingness to take action and find opportunities to support  · Positive, relationship-oriented attitude and communication style  · Ability to work across teams in the organization and support multiple departments and business leaders  · Ability to respond creatively and flexibly to issues, change, and high growth  · Ability to remain calm under pressure Preferred · Experience at a professional services company  · Experience with Salesforce.com platform  · Interest in technology tools, process improvement and training  · Experience working with proposals, contracts and legal documents

Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Facebook is seeking a Finance Operations Manager to focus on business within the Infrastructure Data Center Site Services organization. Site Services enables our data centers to operate safely and efficiently. The successful candidate will partner closely with business leadership to thoroughly understand technical programs, projects, and operations. Using this knowledge, the financial manager will develop short and long range financial forecasts and will be responsible for producing financial summaries that provide strategic insight into the business performance. Additionally, the manager should be willing to work diligently on fundamental financial processes to ensure smooth business operations including purchase requisitions, invoicing, and management of contracts/SOWs/SLAs. An ideal candidate will work independently to deliver high quality products and will be comfortable operating in high-growth environments. and supply chain teams to manage the end-to-end process of vendor payments per net termsInform program managers of the status and availability of funds on purchase ordersAct to prevent invoice holds changes to reconcile the differencesWillingness to work on multiple, simultaneous projects with the ability to balance priorities and exercise time managementMininum Qualifications:BS/BA in environmentExperience working across multiple internal business organizations and with external business partnersExperience innovating process and system development and implementationCommunication and presentation experienceAnalytical experienceExperience in analytics tools and systems (i.e.: Tableau, Oracle, Essbase, MySQL, Custom APIs)Experience crafting and analyzing data at a macro and micro levelPreferred Qualifications:Experience conducting large-scale financial analysis: budgeting, forecasting, variance summariesFamiliarity with procurement and sourcing operationsExperience analytics & reporting

Name: HR Data Analyst

Name: Business Marketing Analyst
Description: 183578 Business Marketing Analyst (Open)Job Title – Business Marketing Analyst About the Role – You will: We are looking for a Business Marketing Analyst who will be comfortable working closely with business teams but also dealing with complex numerical analysis. The ideal candidate must be intellectually curious about how everything ties together to run our business and be a self-starter with a strong sense of initiative. This candidate will become an integral part of the business teams and play a key role in helping them analyze and plan their business.  Key areas of responsibilities for our Analysts include: Market Research – Determine the size of data storage markets and forecasted demand. Work with external third party data along with internal business leaders to source information needed for analysis. Develop and maintain tracking and planning tools to maintain a short term and long term view of the TAM (Total Addressable Market).Analysis – Conduct market segmentation analysis and competitive analysis. Use statistical models to conduct forecasting. Develop and maintain forecast models. In-depth market analysis by geography, product, and channel. Analyze pricing strategies. Work with internal teams on competitive analysis. Examine end-user demand drivers.Planning & Consolidation – Work with business segment leaders to create quarterly business plans and prepare consolidated views of the business for executive meetings. Maintain and manage tracking of key metrics (market size, mix, pricing, costs, and margins etc.). Work across internal teams including Business Units, Products, Finance, Operations, and Cost Teams creating and integrated view of the P&L and impacts to it.Tools & process – Drive weekly and quarterly cadence of segment meetings while managing inputs for templates and presentations. Manage and develop content for pricing meetings with leaders for each business segment. Work closely with finance teams in tracking and planning. Develop new tools and look for end-to-end process efficiencies.About Our Group This position is part of the Business Analysis & Strategy organization which includes the responsibilities of Market Research, Planning, Analysis, and Business Unit Strategy. Our group’s charter is to define short and long term market trends facing the global storage industry, accurately forecast the market demand, and analyze how different strategies across Business lines impact the consolidated P&L. The market perspectives and analysis are utilized by many groups within the organization, including our executive team which communicates broadly to the outside analyst community and investment community. ​ About YouCreative and resourceful problem solver. Must be able to build a logical approach to address problems or opportunities or manage the situation at handMust be able to develop cooperation and foster teamwork at all levels while maintaining integrity of their point of viewExcellent verbal, written, and presentation skills. Must be able to think strategically and present concise information to senior staffBusiness acumen. Understands how key metrics drive a businessYour Experience Includes:Substantial experience in research and/or analytics, ideally in market, business, or financial analytics functionStrong proficiency in MS Excel and experience with SQL and different databasesProject management. Must be able to manage multiple projects and deliverables. Develop own milestones and manage deliverables of others without direct authorityExperience in statistical modeling techniques and pricing analysisBachelor's degree and/or equivalent experience (prefer a background in a quantitative field - economics, finance, statistics, applied mathematics, computer science). An advanced degree or MBA would be a plus.Experience working in a technology company with a manufacturing emphasis – preferredAny experience Tableau or other visualization tools is a plusExperience with pricing tools is a plusBusiness consulting experience is a plusLocation: Cupertino, CA Travel: 0-10%Job Family: Professional

Name: Financial Analyst - Retail FP&A
Description: SummaryDo you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. Finance is essential to upholding our global dedication to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. Apple is seeking a dynamic Financial Analyst to join the Retail Finance team supporting worldwide Financial Planning and Analysis. The team serves as the hub of financial data for Apple Retail including both online and stores. From product launches to global economic fluctuations to single store level performance, this team has the unique ability to drive and communicate results in all aspects of the business. 4+ years of relevant experience in a high performance and high growth organization Inherent curiosity to connect dots, understand all facets of Apple Retail, and drive decision-making Ability to run multiple projects at once and deliver results in a demanding and quickly-changing environment Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with flawless attention to detail Proven ability to quickly build relationships and partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate results Experience with data analytics/visualization software (e.g. Tableau), enterprise software systems (e.g. Essbase, Business Objects) and Excel is strongly preferred Retail FP&A partners closely with the retail leadership team in the management of the Retail business. This role acts as a trusted leader who assists in a cross functional capacity to align financial and investment goals for Apple Retail worldwide. Additionally, the role serves a critical function connecting and communicating Apple Retail performance to the greater Apple finance organization. Key responsibilities include: Be the analytics lead and business-technical liaison for Apple’s Stores and Online performance metrics Provide critical thought leadership in the development of key reporting tools to drive business insights Support the forecast and close process for Apple Retail management financials, including consolidation of revenue and costs, in depth analysis, and performance updates to key executives Partner with Finance teams in each geography to identify business issues and implement strategic solutions Be the lead analyst on ad hoc projects in support of annual strategic objectives Education & ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Business

Name: Partner Marketing Financial Analyst
Description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.  Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a meaningful role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success.  Apple is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Finance Analyst to join the Worldwide Marketing Finance team. The Finance Analyst will partner with Worldwide Partner Marketing and Advertising teams as well as other cross functional teams at Apple. The ideal candidate should have the ability to collaborate well with others, learn quickly in a fast-paced environment and is constantly looking for new ways to improve existing processes. Additionally, he/she should have the ability to perform detailed analyses, deal with complex data and built financial models. Experience in accounting is a plus.  Minimum 3-6 years of finance/accounting experience.  Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills; prior experience in a financial planning and analysis environment preferred  Experience with month-end, quarter-end close, including booking journal entries  Strong business acumen, high intellectual curiosity, and deep interest in Apple’s product, business and strategy  Excellent attention to detail, ability to compile and validate large amounts of information while maintaining a high degree of accuracy  Exceptional interpersonal and relationship building skills, ability to effectively influence peers and management  Proven track record of working with cross-functional teams across many levels of management  Advanced proficiency in Excel and experience in financial modeling, experience with ERP system (Tableau, SAP, Business Objects) is a plus  Ability to operate in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment  Able to deal with ambiguity and work comfortably with incomplete information  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Previous experience within a multinational company  Knowledge of advertising or marketing is a plus  The Finance Analyst will collaborate closely with the Partner Marketing and Advertising Managers to provide finance support and analysis on Worldwide Partner engagements. Analyst will also collaborate with other teams such as external ad agencies, legal, tax, technical accounting, AP/AR Shared Services and Corporate Finance and provide ad hoc analysis per the business requests.  Analyst will work with complex financial information and provide timely and accurate forecast to the business team as well as Central Advertising Finance team. He/she will be involved in the monthly forecasts, quarterly close and yearly planning.  The analyst will also continually drive process & tool improvements and standardization for the organization while ensuring systems and procedures are in place to provide timely and accurate financial information and SOX compliance. Education & Experience Bachelors Degree or equivalent

Name: Channel Operations Analyst
Description: Zoom is the world leader in video communications with the highest customer satisfaction in our industry. We have been expanding rapidly since our Series D investment from Sequoia at a $1 billion valuation. Zoom was recently awarded the 5th Best SMB Company to Work for in the United States by Glassdoor (based on anonymous employee reviews). Now is the time to join our team of motivated and passionate people as Zoom grows to provide frictionless communications for businesses and organizations across the world. Visit zoom.us and follow us on Twitter (@zoom_us) and Facebook (Zoom Video Communications).Responsibilities:Serve as a trusted advisor representing the partner organization and sustain alignment across internal stakeholders as required to grow and scale the partner organization and operational support. Liaise with the appropriate teams to develop robust, end-to-end partner operations process, including but not limited to lead to quote, partner applications and contracts, and partner order process and program support. Project management to support key initiatives associated with partner operations revenue recognition, including drafting and maintaining business requirements to consistently optimize and integrate numerous internal systems of record delivering a source of truth for partner business management and growth Liaise with the systems Team to develop the requirements and workflows that support CRM management of our partner ecosystem. Collaborate with order desk operations to ensure order processes across various partner types are understood and optimized. (Channel Reseller, ISV, Referrals). Lead applicable initiatives to automate where possible. Oversee partner account and opportunity management (e.g. ensure partner tagging, CRM record compliance, etc.) Ensure fluid and timely partner registration and acceptance workflow, compliance, tracking and drive any needed changes to support business efficiency and/or automation Lead projects that deconstruct and solve complex platform provisioning and/or payout, billing issues Requirements:BA/BS degree required 5-8 years of partner operations experience preferably in a SaaS/cloud companyComfortable engaging at all levels in an organization to deliver resultsExcellent communicator with proven ability to clearly convey ideas and information in written and verbal form to a variety of audiences Demonstrated skills in positioning and differentiating program benefits broadly to a partner communityHighly motivated, self-directed individual who thrives in a fast-paced team environmentExcellent organizational skills with attention to detail: ability to manage multiple priorities in parallelExperience in Channel Program/Sales Operations is mustSalesforce.com experience is must and Domo Visualization skills are plusExperience working in small, startup environments with building processes and functions from scratch Check us out with a free download:zoom.us/downloadZoom Video Communications is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of an individuals age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status. Our combined differences are what make us Zoom!

Name: CMS QA Analyst / Content QA Analyst
Description: Role : CMS QA Analyst Location : San Jose, CA Need Locals JD : Content QA will provide quality assurance testing for new/updated CMS templates and components for adobe.com, using Adobe Experience Manager content management system and supporting technologies. • The candidate will provide quality assurance for optimal customer experience by ensuring that page content meet high standards for content display and functionality by validating all page elements such as links, videos, images and page layouts. • The candidate will take direction from the Content QA Lead on all assignments. • The candidate is required to work closely with offshore QA team to coordinate QA efforts, analyze reported bugs and consolidate QA status. • He or she will need to communicate on a regular basis with SCRUM team members and provide proactive feedback. • The candidate must be able to think outside the box when proposing solutions to problems within Adobe. • The candidate may be required to help with test automation strategies and implementations. • The candidate is required to do hands-on authoring in AEM to assist with bug-fixes and to provide support for product launches. Requirements • 5 – 10 years of experience with Content Management System (CMS) in general, with strong preference given to experience with AEM (Adobe Experience Manager, formerly known as Day CQ) • Solid understanding of Web-based project test methodology, test environments, bug life cycle, and frequent code release deployment QA support. • Knowledge of the Web presentation layer, and business and data access layers and their interactions. • Solid knowledge of common desktop and mobile browser technology. • Experience working with highly-trafficked, scalable Web applications. • Familiarity testing with, and have applied, current Web client-side technologies - JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, XML, etc. • Ability to quickly understand and interpret design and technical specifications and provide QA time estimates. • Ability to adjust and respond to scheduling and/or technical changes, with the ability to analyze and communicate any increased risks and/or testing considerations resulting from such changes. • Self-starter, ability to adapt to shifting tasks and to support multiple requests. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. • Good problem solving and diagnostic skills. • Team player. • Experience working with global teams. Desired Experience • Experience with Adobe Analytics (SiteCatalyst), or Adobe Target. • Experience testing with content-centric applications using the Apache Sling framework. • Hands-on testing automation experience – from defining automation strategy, to planning and creation, through final implementation. Experience : 7 - 12 years. - provided by Dice5 10 years of experience with Content Management System (CMS) in general, with strong preference given to experience with AEM (Adobe Experience Manager, formerly known as Day CQ)

Schedule reports as appropriate within SuccessFactors Report Distributor.  · Work with HRIS team to design reports and dashboards based on requirements from users.  · Analyze data to interpret trends or patterns to help formulate recommendations and options for business leaders.  · Initiate new and seek opportunities to continuously improve existing reporting processes for greater efficiencies across all geographies and business units.  · Build key HR performance indicators/metrics.  · Be a key contributor to projects and initiatives involving HR reporting and data needs.  · Provide training and consultation to other HR reporting staff to fulfill operational reporting needs. Requirements: Experience, skills, and requirements: · BA or BS degree preferred  · Minimum 5 years of experience in the area of HRIS or reporting for HR  · Experience with SuccessFactors reporting tools (Advanced Reporting, ORD, Ad Hoc)  · Experience with database design and concepts and familiarity with SQL a plus  · Proficient with MS Office applications, specifically Excel, PowerPoint, and Access  · Excellent verbal and written communication skills  · Ability to juggle multiple tasks while meeting aggressive deadlines  · Highly organized, with strong attention to detail  · Demonstrate analytical and problem-solving skills, and experience applying these skills within complex programs to address business and reporting requirements  · Solutions-oriented; ability to analyze and identify areas for improvement  · Strong interpersonal skills with ability to effectively interact with various levels in the organization, including senior management and executives along with cross-geographic personnel  · Ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced, results-oriented environment, and be flexible and adaptable to changing situations  · Familiarity with one or more modules and security configuration within SuccessFactors a plus  · Experience with SaaS vendors and release management and Agile methodologies desired

Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: RESOLVIT Bringing Solutions That Make Business Better  Join Resolvit as a Sales Operations Analyst and be part of a creative, forward-thinking team. Our success at deploying skilled, highly knowledgeable experts has landed us on the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing companies four times – and we’re just getting started. Through its partnerships, Resolvit delivers highly impactful, innovative solutions across five core areas: Infrastructure Modernization, Application Development Services, Enterprise Data Management & Analytics, Knowledge & Content Management, and Strategic Staffing.
